amalfi coast italy.desc: On Italy’s Amalfi Coast, villages tumble down dramatic cliffs to tiny harbours and pebble beaches. You wind along the coastal road or hop between towns by ferry, passing lemon terraces, domed churches and viewpoints suspended above the Tyrrhenian Sea. Between swims you can follow panoramic paths such as the Path of the Gods, linger over seafood and fresh pasta on candlelit terraces, or sail out to nearby islands. It’s ideal if you dream of romantic days at the sea with a touch of Mediterranean glamour.
amalfi coast italy.highlights: Coastal road and bus routes with sweeping sea views between cliffside villages. | Pastel towns like Positano and Amalfi full of churches, piazzas and artisan boutiques. | Panoramic hiking trails, including the famous Path of the Gods above the coast. | Seafood, limoncello and local wines enjoyed on terraces overlooking the Tyrrhenian Sea.
amalfi coast italy.bonus: Book a small-boat cruise at sunset to slip into hidden coves and watch the villages light up one by one.

algarve portugal.desc: Along Portugal’s Algarve, the coastline shifts from wide sandy bays to hidden coves carved into rust-coloured cliffs. You wake up to Atlantic light, spend the day wandering between whitewashed villages and beaches framed by arches and sea stacks, then end it with a drink as the sun falls into the ocean. Boat trips take you into caves and grottoes, while surfers and families share the waves on more open stretches. It’s a great choice if you want seaside days that mix relaxation, scenery and a bit of adventure.
algarve portugal.highlights: Mix of long family-friendly beaches and small coves tucked under dramatic cliffs. | Boat and kayak tours to sea caves and arches, including the famous Benagil area. | Charming whitewashed towns with seafood restaurants, beach bars and relaxed evening promenades. | Good conditions for surfing, coastal walks and boat trips to watch dolphins offshore.
algarve portugal.bonus: Watch the sky turn orange from a cliff-top viewpoint near Lagos or Sagres as the Atlantic swallows the sun.

costa del sol spain.desc: On Spain’s Costa del Sol, a chain of beach towns stretches along the Mediterranean between the mountains and the sea. You can spend lazy hours on long urban beaches, stroll palm-lined promenades in Málaga, Marbella or Torremolinos, and slip into tapas bars when the evening lights come on. With a famously mild climate and many sunny days a year, the season here starts early and finishes late. It suits you if you like combining relaxed seaside time with city culture, family attractions and a touch of nightlife.
costa del sol spain.highlights: String of resorts with long sandy beaches and easy access along the coastal road. | Málaga’s historic centre with museums, tapas streets and a lively port promenade. | Family-friendly attractions such as waterparks, marinas and well-equipped urban beaches. | Mild climate with many sunny days, ideal for spring, autumn and winter escapes.
costa del sol spain.bonus: Ride up to a hilltop viewpoint or Nerja’s Balcón de Europa to watch the sun sink behind the silhouettes of the coastal mountains.

riviera maya mexico.desc: Along Mexico’s Riviera Maya, jungle meets Caribbean sea in a line of palm-fringed beaches, cenotes and ancient sites. You can wake up in a resort by the sand, then spend the day between turquoise bays, freshwater sinkholes hidden in the forest and Mayan ruins overlooking the coast. Offshore lies part of the Mesoamerican Barrier Reef, with easy snorkelling trips to reefs and turtles. This stretch is ideal if you want tropical comfort with the option of real adventure, culture and nature within a short drive.
riviera maya mexico.highlights: White-sand Caribbean beaches lined with palms and a wide choice of seaside resorts. | Easy day trips to Mayan sites such as Tulum, Cobá or Chichén Itzá. | Freshwater cenotes in the jungle for swimming, snorkelling and cooling off from the heat. | Snorkel or dive on the nearby reef to spot colorful fish, rays and sometimes turtles.
riviera maya mexico.bonus: Join a small-group boat trip into the Sian Ka’an Biosphere Reserve to glide through mangroves and watch wild dolphins and seabirds in protected waters.

miami beach usa.desc: In Miami Beach you get a classic Atlantic shoreline wrapped in a city that never really switches off. By day you can walk or cycle the Beachwalk, stop at wide sandy stretches of South Beach or North Beach and swim under the colorful lifeguard towers you’ve seen in photos. Just behind the sand the Art Deco District mixes pastel façades, neon lights and rooftop bars with cafés and Latin-inspired restaurants. Choose Miami Beach when you want your beach break served with nightlife, culture and a distinctly Miami energy.
miami beach usa.highlights: Long, easily accessible beaches with soft sand and iconic colorful lifeguard towers. | Art Deco Historic District full of pastel buildings, neon signs and classic hotels. | Lively nightlife with beach bars, cocktail lounges, clubs and late-opening restaurants. | Shopping and people-watching on Lincoln Road, Española Way and other pedestrian streets.
miami beach usa.bonus: Set the alarm for sunrise at South Pointe Beach, then walk along Ocean Drive as the Art Deco façades glow in the early light.

copacabana rio de janeiro brazil.desc: Copacabana Beach in Rio de Janeiro curves for kilometres between green hills and the Atlantic, lined by the black-and-white wave mosaics of Avenida Atlântica. By day you can swim in the flagged areas, rent a chair, join locals playing football and volleyball or stroll the promenade with a fresh coconut. As the light turns golden, kiosks and bars switch on music, caipirinhas and views towards Sugarloaf Mountain. It’s a classic city-beach mix, perfect if you like energy, people-watching and sea breeze in equal measure.
copacabana rio de janeiro brazil.highlights: Iconic wave-pattern promenade ideal for sunrise or sunset walks. | Long, wide sandy beach with safe flagged swimming areas. | Constant buzz of beach sports, street vendors and live music. | Easy access to Sugarloaf Mountain, Ipanema and central Rio attractions. | Legendary New Year’s Eve fireworks that turn the entire bay into a stage.
copacabana rio de janeiro brazil.bonus: Time your trip for New Year’s Eve to watch Copacabana’s oceanfront fireworks show, when millions in white gather on the sand to welcome the year.

gold coast australia.desc: The Gold Coast in Queensland, Australia stretches along more than 50 kilometres of Pacific shoreline, where long golden beaches meet a skyline of towers and relaxed surf suburbs. You can learn to surf at Surfers Paradise, find calmer waves for kids at Burleigh or Coolangatta, or simply walk the patrolled sands between lifeguard flags. Away from the water, theme parks, shopping centres and the rainforest-covered hinterland keep every day different. For many travellers it’s the image of a classic Aussie beach holiday, with as much or as little action as you want.
gold coast australia.highlights: Dozens of patrolled beaches with soft sand and reliable Pacific surf breaks. | Great mix of beginner surf schools and challenging waves for more experienced riders. | Easy days for families with playgrounds, beachfront paths and cafés right by the sand. | Quick access to theme parks, wildlife encounters and lush Gold Coast Hinterland hikes. | Lively dining, bars and markets around Surfers Paradise for evenings by the ocean.
gold coast australia.bonus: Get up for sunrise to see the Pacific turn pink while surfers catch their first waves in front of the Gold Coast skyline.

cape town camps bay south africa.desc: Camps Bay, a beach suburb of Cape Town in South Africa, sits between a wide strip of white sand and the dramatic cliffs of the Twelve Apostles mountain range. You can spend the day sunbathing, dipping into the chilly Atlantic, or renting a lounger while lifeguards watch over the flagged areas. Just across the road, palm-lined Victoria Road is packed with cafés, cocktail bars and stylish restaurants that buzz until late. Camps Bay suits travellers who like their beach time served with a touch of glamour, big sunset views and quick access to Table Mountain trails.
cape town camps bay south africa.highlights: Spectacular setting with white sand backed by the Twelve Apostles and Lion’s Head. | Family-friendly main beach plus a sheltered tidal pool for safer swimming. | Palm-lined promenade full of cafés, cocktail bars and sunset-ready terraces. | Short drive from central Cape Town and the cable car to Table Mountain. | Good base to combine ocean time with wine country or safari extensions.
cape town camps bay south africa.bonus: Hike up Lion’s Head for golden-hour views, then head back down to Camps Bay for cocktails while the sun sinks into the Atlantic.

dubai jumeirah beach uae.desc: Jumeirah Beach in Dubai, United Arab Emirates offers a long strip of soft white sand facing the warm waters of the Arabian Gulf and the sail-shaped Burj Al Arab. You can stretch out on the public beach, cool off in the calm shallows, jog along the dedicated running track or try paddleboarding and kayaking with rental centres nearby. Behind the sand, cafés, beach clubs and hotels line the coast, so it’s easy to move from sea to sundowner. Many visitors weave it into a Dubai city stay when they crave a soft-sand break between museums, malls and desert excursions.
dubai jumeirah beach uae.highlights: Free-to-enter public beach with fine white sand and clear Gulf water. | Close-up views of the Burj Al Arab for photos that scream "Dubai". | Running and cycling paths plus playgrounds make it friendly for active travellers. | Plenty of cafés, food trucks and stylish beach clubs just behind the sand. | Easy taxi and bus connections from Downtown Dubai and the Marina area.
dubai jumeirah beach uae.bonus: Time your visit for sunset to see the Burj Al Arab glow above the water, then linger over dinner in a seafront café.

da nang my khe beach vietnam.desc: My Khe Beach in Da Nang, central Vietnam, is a long ribbon of pale sand facing gentle waves and the forested hills of the Son Tra Peninsula. Often listed among Asia’s most beautiful beaches, it stays pleasantly relaxed, with lifeguards watching roped-off swimming zones and a paved path for walkers and runners parallel to the shore. Across the road you’ll find seafood restaurants, cafés and small hotels, so you can combine lazy beach time with tasty local dishes. My Khe works beautifully as a low-stress base: you wake to the sea, yet the cafés, markets and streets of Da Nang are only minutes away.
da nang my khe beach vietnam.highlights: Fine, light sand and clear, usually calm water that suits beginners and families. | Lifeguard-patrolled swimming areas and long beachfront paths for walking or jogging. | Laid-back atmosphere with space to spread out, even in busier months. | Seafood eateries, food trucks and massage spots right across from the beach. | Great base for trips to Marble Mountains, Hoi An and the Son Tra Peninsula.
da nang my khe beach vietnam.bonus: Set your alarm for sunrise: watching fishing boats drift offshore as the sky turns pink over My Khe is one of Da Nang’s unforgettable moments.

sharm el sheikh egypt.desc: Sharm El Sheikh stretches along the southern tip of the Sinai Peninsula, where desert mountains drop into the clear waters of the Red Sea. You spend your days moving between lively Naama Bay and quieter sandy coves with coral gardens just offshore. Boat trips take you out to Ras Mohammed National Park and Tiran Island for world‑class snorkeling and diving among colourful fish and steep drop‑offs. Warm weather for most of the year and a huge choice of resorts make it an easy escape for both first‑time visitors and underwater addicts.
sharm el sheikh egypt.highlights: Warm, sunny climate that works perfectly for winter beach escapes. | Day cruises to Ras Mohammed National Park and Tiran Island. | House reefs close to shore, ideal for relaxed snorkeling sessions. | Many all‑inclusive resorts suited to families, couples, and groups.
sharm el sheikh egypt.bonus: Join a sunset desert safari by quad or camel, then share a Bedouin dinner under an intensely starry Sinai sky.

nice french riviera france.desc: In Nice on France’s Côte d’Azur, you wake up between the Mediterranean and elegant Belle Époque façades. Stroll the Promenade des Anglais with its palm trees, blue chairs and long pebble beaches, then dive into the maze of lanes in the Old Town packed with markets and tiny cafés. From Castle Hill you admire the curve of the Baie des Anges, while art museums and chic boutiques wait just a short tram ride away. It is a great base if you love combining sea views, city life and easy day trips along the Riviera.
nice french riviera france.highlights: Iconic seafront walk along the Promenade des Anglais overlooking the Baie des Anges. | Atmospheric Old Town with colourful markets, bars and small restaurants. | Easy access by train or bus to Cannes, Antibes and Monaco. | Mild climate that works well for short breaks outside the peak summer heat.
nice french riviera france.bonus: Climb up to Castle Hill for golden‑hour views over the rooftops of Nice and the deep turquoise sweep of the Mediterranean.

los cabos mexico.desc: At the very tip of Baja California Sur, Los Cabos is where rust‑coloured desert meets deep blue ocean. You split your time between lively Cabo San Lucas, with its marina and nightlife, and the more laid‑back streets of San José del Cabo with galleries and plazas. Boat rides take you past the famous Arch of Cabo San Lucas at Land’s End and to beaches where the Sea of Cortez is calm enough for swimming and snorkeling. Between whale‑watching in winter, world‑class golf courses and sunset cruises, Los Cabos works as well for romantic getaways as for trips with friends.
los cabos mexico.highlights: Dramatic coastline with the Arch of Cabo San Lucas and rugged cliffs. | Choice between buzzing Cabo San Lucas and relaxed San José del Cabo. | Seasonal whale‑watching tours and excellent sport‑fishing opportunities. | Many beachfront resorts and golf courses overlooking the Sea of Cortez.
los cabos mexico.bonus: Sail out in the late afternoon for a cruise around El Arco, watching the rock glow orange as the sun sinks into the Pacific.

punta cana dominican republic.desc: On the eastern tip of the Dominican Republic, Punta Cana is all about long ribbons of pale sand backed by swaying palms and resort gardens. Along Bávaro Beach you find shallow turquoise water and plenty of places to try kayaking, catamarans or simply floating with a cocktail in hand. Many hotels are all‑inclusive, so it is easy to plan family time by the pool, kids’ clubs and evening shows in one place. With its tropical climate and relaxed Caribbean rhythm, Punta Cana works for couples wanting lazy beach days as much as for families looking for an uncomplicated escape.
punta cana dominican republic.highlights: Kilometres of palm‑lined shoreline, especially along Bávaro Beach. | Calm, shallow sections of sea suitable for less confident swimmers. | Wide choice of all‑inclusive resorts with pools, kids’ areas and spas. | Excursions to snorkel on nearby reefs or explore cenotes and adventure parks.
punta cana dominican republic.bonus: Take a catamaran cruise along the coast at sunset, stopping to swim in natural pools where the sea feels like a giant warm lagoon.

san blas guna yala panam.desc: Off Panama’s Caribbean coast, the San Blas Islands in Guna Yala feel like a chain of tiny castaway worlds. Dozens of palm‑fringed sandbars float in clear, shallow water where you jump from the boat straight into natural pools and easy snorkeling. Instead of big hotels, you stay in simple cabins run by the Indigenous Guna people, sharing fresh seafood and learning about their vibrant textile art, the molas. With limited Wi‑Fi, starry skies and no traffic noise, San Blas is ideal if you crave untouched beaches, culture and a slower rhythm of travel.
san blas guna yala panam.highlights: Remote archipelago of postcard‑perfect islands with white sand and turquoise water. | Snorkeling above coral gardens, shipwrecks and natural pools full of starfish. | Authentic stays operated by Guna communities with home‑cooked seafood. | Digital‑detox atmosphere with few roads, little light pollution and big skies.
san blas guna yala panam.bonus: Take a day trip that combines several islets, a stop at a natural pool and time on a community island to meet Guna artisans and their colourful molas.

antalya t rkiye.desc: Antalya on Turkey’s Mediterranean coast blends a lively seaside resort with a beautifully preserved old town. Wander Kaleiçi’s cobbled lanes past Ottoman mansions, Roman gates and the tiny harbor cradled between cliffs. Then swap history for sea air on nearby beaches, from long sandy Lara to pebbly Konyaalti backed by the Taurus Mountains. Boat trips to waterfalls that plunge straight into the sea and easy excursions to ancient ruins mean you never have to choose between culture, nature and lazy beach days.
antalya t rkiye.highlights: Atmospheric Kaleiçi old town with Roman walls, harbor and Ottoman-era houses. | Choice of beaches, from lively Lara to more relaxed Konyaalti. | Day trips to ancient sites like Perge and Aspendos close by. | Mediterranean climate with long seasons perfect for shoulder‑season escapes. | Plenty of cafés, bars and family‑run pensions for different travel styles.
antalya t rkiye.bonus: Join an evening boat trip from the old harbor to watch Antalya’s cliffs and Düden Waterfalls glowing in the sunset.

san sebasti n la concha spain.desc: La Concha Beach in San Sebastian curves like a seashell around one of northern Spain’s most elegant bays. You stroll along fine golden sand framed by white railings, Belle Époque buildings and the green silhouette of Urgull and Igeldo hills. Sheltered waters are usually calm enough for easy swimming, paddleboarding or simply floating while you admire Santa Clara Island in the middle of the bay. Between beach time and pintxos bars in the nearby old town, it’s perfect if you love city life and sea views in the same place.
san sebasti n la concha spain.highlights: Iconic shell‑shaped urban beach right in the centre of San Sebastian. | Soft golden sand and usually calm, shallow waters for relaxed swimming. | Elegant promenade with classic white balustrade, lamps and bay viewpoints. | Easy access to pintxos bars and restaurants just behind the beach. | Great for walks year‑round, from sunrise jogs to sunset strolls.
san sebasti n la concha spain.bonus: Take a sunset walk from La Concha towards Ondarreta, watching the city lights appear around the bay.

cartagena bocagrande colombia.desc: Bocagrande in Cartagena is the city’s modern beachfront strip, a long curve of sand backed by high‑rise hotels and shopping malls on the Caribbean Sea. You step straight from the promenade onto an urban beach where warm waters and small waves invite an easy swim between people‑watching sessions. Weekday mornings feel more relaxed, while afternoons and evenings bring music, vendors and a lively local crowd. With taxis and buses linking Bocagrande to the colonial walled city in minutes, it suits travellers who like beach time without being far from restaurants, bars and nightlife.
cartagena bocagrande colombia.highlights: Urban Caribbean beach within walking distance of hotels, malls and restaurants. | Warm water and generally gentle waves, good for casual swimming. | Lively atmosphere with locals, visitors and beach bars, especially towards evening. | Quick, inexpensive ride to Cartagena’s walled old town and its attractions. | Options from budget apartments to upscale seafront hotels along the strip.
cartagena bocagrande colombia.bonus: For a change of scenery, start your day with a dip in Bocagrande and finish it watching sunset from Cartagena’s city walls.

tel aviv gordon beach israel.desc: Gordon Beach sits at the heart of Tel Aviv’s coastline, a wide strip of pale sand right beside the Tayelet promenade. You can swim in warm Mediterranean water, try a surf or SUP lesson, or jump into a volleyball game while music drifts from the cafés. Outdoor gyms, showers and plenty of sunbeds make it easy to spend the whole day here. With the promenade linking Jaffa in the south to Tel Aviv Port in the north, Gordon Beach is ideal if you want a relaxed beach day without leaving the city buzz.
tel aviv gordon beach israel.highlights: Central city beach with fine sand just steps from hotels and cafés. | Warm Mediterranean water, breakwaters and lifeguards for comfortable swimming. | Beach volleyball courts, outdoor gym and rentals for SUP or surfboards. | Direct access to the 5‑km Tayelet promenade for walks, runs and bike rides. | Lively yet welcoming atmosphere, popular with locals, visitors and families.
tel aviv gordon beach israel.bonus: Time your visit for late afternoon to play in the waves, then watch the sun set over the Mediterranean from the promenade.

nha trang vietnam.desc: Nha Trang on Vietnam’s south‑central coast is a classic beach city, with a long curve of sand lined by palms and the lights of Tran Phu seafront. You can spend lazy hours on the main beach or take boat trips out to nearby islands for snorkelling and diving in clear water. Inland, the city offers markets, seafood stalls and spa options for rainy moments or evenings. With a tropical climate, good value accommodation and plenty of island‑hopping tours, Nha Trang suits travellers who like an easy seaside base with lots of day‑trip possibilities.
nha trang vietnam.highlights: Long city beach with palm‑lined promenade and views of offshore islands. | Snorkelling and diving trips to Hon Mun and other nearby islands. | Plenty of cafés, seafood restaurants and night markets close to the seafront. | Tropical climate with warm weather for most of the year. | Wide choice of budget and mid‑range hotels within walking distance of the beach.
nha trang vietnam.bonus: Join an island‑hopping tour that combines snorkelling at Hon Mun with a relaxed seafood lunch on deck.

dolomites italy.desc: Set among the northern Italian Alps, the Dolomites are a jagged playground of pale cliffs, green valleys and tiny alpine villages. Here you can ski vast interconnected slopes in winter and hike panoramic ridgelines, flower-filled meadows and turquoise lakes in summer. Between runs or walks, you taste mountain cuisine that blends Italian flair with Tyrolean comfort in rifugi overlooking the peaks. The Dolomites are perfect if you dream of dramatic scenery, active days outdoors and cosy evenings in wooden chalets.
dolomites italy.highlights: Endless ski slopes linked by modern lifts across famous Dolomiti Superski areas. | Scenic hiking trails to viewpoints like Seceda, Tre Cime and Alpe di Siusi. | Charming alpine villages with rifugi, family-run hotels and a relaxed, friendly pace. | Distinctive blend of Italian, Austrian and Ladin traditions in food, architecture and culture.
dolomites italy.bonus: Take a sunset cable car ride, then dine in a high-altitude rifugio while pink alpenglow slowly lights up the Dolomite walls all around you.

zermatt switzerland.desc: Zermatt is a car-free Swiss village tucked beneath the iconic Matterhorn, where wooden chalets line narrow streets and church bells echo between the peaks. In winter you ski one of the highest and most snow-sure areas in the Alps, with glacier runs and long descents into both Switzerland and Italy. Summer brings hiking paths, mountain lakes and cogwheel trains to viewpoints like Gornergrat. Zermatt is ideal if you love high-altitude adventures paired with chic alpine comfort.
zermatt switzerland.highlights: Car-free village center with cosy chalets, boutiques and lively après-ski spots. | Matterhorn Ski Paradise with year-round glacier skiing and a very long winter season. | Scenic rides on the Gornergrat Bahn and cable cars with sweeping views of 4,000-metre peaks. | Excellent mountain restaurants combining Swiss classics, gourmet dining and sunny terraces.
zermatt switzerland.bonus: Start early, ride the Gornergrat railway, and watch the first sun rays turn the Matterhorn from deep blue to glowing gold before your ski day even begins.

chamonix mont blanc france.desc: Chamonix-Mont-Blanc is a lively French alpine town nestled beneath Western Europe’s highest peak, where cable cars soar from cafés straight into the high mountains. In winter you find legendary off-piste lines like the Vallée Blanche alongside family-friendly ski areas, while summer brings hikers, trail runners and climbers from all over the world. The Aiguille du Midi and Montenvers railway open up glaciers and balconies with dizzying views. Chamonix is perfect if you crave a raw, adventurous atmosphere more than a polished resort bubble.
chamonix mont blanc france.highlights: Direct access to Mont Blanc massif with iconic lifts such as Aiguille du Midi. | World-famous freeride routes and ski touring, plus gentler slopes for mixed-level groups. | Bustling town centre with cafés, bars and gear shops open year-round. | Excellent base for hiking, trail running and alpine climbing in summer.
chamonix mont blanc france.bonus: Book a clear morning ride up the Aiguille du Midi and step onto the glass skywalk, suspended above crevasses and icefalls with Mont Blanc almost at eye level.

telluride usa.desc: Telluride is a former mining town turned character-filled ski resort, tucked into a dramatic box canyon in Colorado’s San Juan Mountains. Colourful wooden houses, historic brick buildings and waterfalls above town create a cinematic backdrop for both winter and summer adventures. In winter you ski straight into town from varied terrain, while the free gondola links you to Mountain Village; in summer, wildflower meadows, hiking and festivals keep the energy high. Telluride is ideal if you like big scenery with a laid-back, artsy vibe far from the crowds.
telluride usa.highlights: Spectacular box canyon setting with cliffs, forests and the famous Bridal Veil Falls. | Ski-in/ski-out convenience plus a free gondola connecting town and Mountain Village. | Unpretentious, creative atmosphere with music, film and food festivals throughout the year. | Excellent mix of groomers, steeps and glades, plus great hiking and biking in summer.
telluride usa.bonus: Ride the gondola at sunset, then stroll down Telluride’s main street as the last light hits the peaks and the historic façades glow warm and golden.

whistler canada.desc: Whistler is a vibrant mountain town in British Columbia, home to Whistler Blackcomb, the largest ski resort in North America. Two big mountains, linked by the record-breaking Peak 2 Peak Gondola, offer everything from gentle learning slopes to steep bowls and glacier runs. Off the snow, the pedestrian-only village buzzes with cafés, bars, shops and spas, and in summer the lifts reopen for world-class mountain biking, hiking and lake days. Whistler is ideal if you want a high-energy, international atmosphere with endless ways to play in the mountains year-round.
whistler canada.highlights: Huge Whistler Blackcomb ski area with diverse terrain and a long, reliable season. | Pedestrian village packed with restaurants, boutiques and legendary après-ski spots. | Peak 2 Peak Gondola linking two mountains with spectacular views over forests and lakes. | Strong summer offer with bike park, zip-lines, golf and swimming in nearby lakes.
whistler canada.bonus: Spend a clear day riding the Peak 2 Peak, then stay up for alpine twilight and watch the lights of Whistler Village flicker on far below.

rocky mountain national park usa.desc: Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado immerses you in dramatic peaks, alpine lakes and high mountain meadows, all within easy reach of Denver. Vast protected wilderness gives you hundreds of miles of trails, from gentle strolls around Bear Lake to full-day climbs above treeline. Scenic roads like Trail Ridge Road link sweeping viewpoints where elk, bighorn sheep and mule deer roam below. Come for cool summer hikes, fiery fall aspens or snowy winter adventures whenever you crave big, wild mountain landscapes.
rocky mountain national park usa.highlights: Accessible hiking for all levels, from lakeside paths to steep alpine trails. | Trail Ridge Road offers one of America’s highest scenic drives above the trees. | Excellent wildlife viewing, especially elk, deer and bighorn sheep in open meadows. | Four distinct seasons with wildflowers, golden aspens and quiet snowy days.
rocky mountain national park usa.bonus: Stay late near Moraine Park or Bear Lake and listen for bugling elk under a sky dense with Rocky Mountain stars.

patagonia el chalt n argentina.desc: El Chaltén, in Argentine Patagonia, is a small mountain village tucked beneath the jagged spires of Mount Fitz Roy and its neighbors. From the edge of town, trails fan out towards turquoise glacial lagoons, hanging glaciers and windswept viewpoints without needing a car. The atmosphere is relaxed and outdoorsy, with climbers, hikers and backpackers sharing trail stories in tiny cafés after long days outside. If you love long hikes, big skies and the feeling of being at the end of the world, this is your kind of place.
patagonia el chalt n argentina.highlights: Network of day hikes starting directly from the village streets. | Iconic views of Mount Fitz Roy glowing at sunrise and sunset. | Turquoise glacial lakes and viewpoints reached by well-marked mountain trails. | Friendly trekking town vibe with gear shops, refuges and simple restaurants.
patagonia el chalt n argentina.bonus: Set your alarm for a pre-dawn hike to Laguna de los Tres to watch the first pink light hit Fitz Roy mirrored in the icy water.

huaraz cordillera blanca per.desc: Huaraz, in the Peruvian Andes, is your gateway to the Cordillera Blanca, a range of snow-capped peaks, hanging glaciers and electric-blue lakes. From this lively highland city you can join day trips to famous spots like Laguna 69 or set off on multi-day treks across Huascarán National Park. Between hikes you refuel on hearty Andean food, browse local markets and slowly acclimatise to the altitude. It’s ideal if you want big mountain scenery and adventure but also appreciate returning each evening to a warm bed and a real town.
huaraz cordillera blanca per.highlights: Easy access to classic hikes such as Laguna 69 and Santa Cruz treks. | Spectacular views of glaciated peaks and bright turquoise alpine lakes. | Affordable base with plenty of guesthouses, hostels and mountain guides. | Authentic Andean markets, food and culture between your trekking days.
huaraz cordillera blanca per.bonus: Take a rest day at the local hot springs or cafés, watching snowy summits tower above the city while you plan your next high-altitude adventure.

kilimanjaro tanzania.desc: Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania rises almost alone above the African plains, a snow-dusted volcano whose summit, Uhuru Peak, reaches 5,895 metres. Multi-day treks wind slowly from rainforest to moorland and barren high plateau, giving you time to acclimatise and watch the landscape change with every camp. By night you sleep in tents or simple huts while guides and porters take care of logistics and safety. It’s a demanding but non-technical climb that rewards determined hikers with sunrise views from the highest point in Africa.
kilimanjaro tanzania.highlights: Reach Uhuru Peak, the roof of Africa at 5,895 metres above sea level. | Walk through several climate zones, from lush forest to icy summit ridge. | Choice of routes and trip lengths to match your pace and experience. | Professional local guides and porters support you throughout the ascent.
kilimanjaro tanzania.bonus: Time your summit push for a clear night and you’ll zigzag towards the crater rim under a sky full of stars before watching the sun rise over the Serengeti.

fuji five lakes japan.desc: The Fuji Five Lakes region, at the northern foot of Mount Fuji, combines calm water, wooded hillsides and Japan’s most iconic volcano in a single panorama. Around lakes such as Kawaguchiko and Yamanakako you can stroll along easy waterfront paths, rent a bike or simply sit on a bench watching the mountain change with the light. Small onsen towns offer hot-spring baths and ryokan stays with views of Fuji from the window. It’s a gentle escape from Tokyo that mixes outdoor time, relaxation and some of the best photo opportunities in the country.
fuji five lakes japan.highlights: Classic postcard views of Mount Fuji reflected in the still waters of the lakes. | Lakeside walks and easy cycling routes suitable for relaxed days outdoors. | Hot-spring baths and traditional inns where you can soak with Fuji in sight. | Good transport links make it simple to visit from Tokyo for a night or two.
fuji five lakes japan.bonus: Take the sightseeing bus to a lakeside viewpoint for sunset, then finish the day with an evening soak in an outdoor onsen facing the illuminated silhouette of Fuji.

pyrenees benasque spain.desc: Benasque, tucked into the heart of the Spanish Pyrenees, feels like a cosy mountain hideaway with big-sky views. Lace up your boots for alpine trails that weave past glacial valleys, waterfalls and high passes, or trade them for skis to carve the slopes of nearby Cerler in winter. After a day outside, you wander back through narrow streets lined with stone houses and small taverns serving hearty Aragonese dishes. It’s a great choice if you dream of a trip that balances serious mountain adventures with slow, quiet evenings in a traditional village.
pyrenees benasque spain.highlights: Authentic mountain village in the Spanish Pyrenees with dramatic valley views. | Quick access to hiking, snowshoeing and skiing in the Benasque Valley and Cerler. | Atmospheric stone streets, Gothic buildings and relaxed local bars. | Trails for all levels, from gentle riverside walks to high mountain passes. | Pleasant summer climate and snowy winters ideal for outdoor escapes.
pyrenees benasque spain.bonus: Take a day to hike towards a natural rock amphitheatre where turquoise meltwater vanishes into a hidden sinkhole in the limestone.

zakopane tatra mountains poland.desc: Zakopane, at the foot of Poland’s Tatra Mountains, mixes lively resort energy with wild alpine scenery. In winter you pick from gentle slopes and long runs on surrounding hills, while summer brings a maze of marked trails into forests, ridges and mountain lakes. Back in town, timber chalets, cosy karczma taverns and a busy main street create a festive atmosphere until late. It’s a brilliant option if you want a mountain base where skiing, hiking and Polish highland culture all come together in one place.
zakopane tatra mountains poland.highlights: Poland’s best‑known mountain town at the base of the Tatra range. | Wide choice of ski areas and lifts for beginners through advanced skiers. | Well‑marked hiking trails to ridges, valleys and scenic viewpoints. | Traditional wooden architecture and hearty regional food in karczma inns. | Plenty of cafés, shops and evening entertainment after a day outdoors.
zakopane tatra mountains poland.bonus: Ride the funicular up Gubałówka Hill at sunset for sweeping views over Zakopane and the Tatra peaks.

atlas mountains imlil morocco.desc: Imlil, high in Morocco’s Atlas Mountains, feels a world away from the bustle of Marrakech. Mud‑brick houses cling to a steep valley laced with walnut trees, terraces and rushing streams, and mule tracks fan out towards the summit of Mount Toubkal. You wake to the sound of roosters and the call to prayer before setting off on guided treks through Berber villages and rocky passes. It’s a wonderful base if you want to slow down, breathe thin, clear mountain air and discover the Atlas on foot rather than from a bus window.
atlas mountains imlil morocco.highlights: Traditional Berber village in the High Atlas, around 90 minutes from Marrakech. | Gateway to treks towards Mount Toubkal and surrounding valleys. | Simple guesthouses and riads with rooftop terraces and wide mountain views. | Opportunities to meet local families over mint tea and home‑cooked meals. | Cooler temperatures than the plains, ideal for escaping city heat.
atlas mountains imlil morocco.bonus: Ask for a sunrise hike to a nearby ridge: watching the first light hit red Atlas peaks is an unforgettable moment.

sierra nevada spain.desc: Sierra Nevada, in southern Spain above Granada, combines a modern high‑altitude ski area with the wild landscapes of a national park. In winter you dive into kilometres of pistes and sunny terraces at the resort of Pradollano, often skiing with views that stretch towards the Mediterranean on clear days. When the snow melts, the same mountains offer hiking routes past alpine meadows, glacial valleys and peaks like Mulhacén, the highest on the Iberian Peninsula. It’s a great choice if you like mixing snow sports, mountain walks and city breaks in one trip.
sierra nevada spain.highlights: Southernmost major ski resort in Europe with a long, often sunny season. | Over a hundred kilometres of pistes plus areas for beginners and families. | Access to Sierra Nevada National Park’s high peaks and hiking routes. | Easy day‑trip distance from Granada and the Alhambra. | Cool mountain air in summer with routes for trekking, trail‑running and cycling.
sierra nevada spain.bonus: On certain winter nights you can try night skiing on illuminated slopes, then warm up with tapas back in Granada.

el chalt n fitz roy argentina.desc: Banff National Park, in the Canadian Rockies, is all about big mountains, blue‑green lakes and endless forest. You can spend your days driving scenic highways, paddling or hiking around lakes like Lake Louise or Moraine Lake, or following trails deep into valleys where glaciers and waterfalls still shape the landscape. In the town of Banff you’ll find cafés, galleries and hot springs to relax in after a long day outside. It’s ideal if you want a trip that feels wild and remote at times but still offers comfortable bases and good services.
el chalt n fitz roy argentina.highlights: Canada’s first national park and part of a UNESCO World Heritage area. | Iconic turquoise lakes framed by jagged, snow‑tipped peaks. | Extensive trail network for day hikes, backpacking and wildlife watching. | Charming mountain town of Banff with restaurants, shops and hot springs. | Four distinct seasons, from colourful larch hikes to deep‑winter snow adventures.
el chalt n fitz roy argentina.bonus: Set an early alarm one morning to watch sunrise light up an alpine lake — the calm reflections are worth the lost sleep.

svaneti georgia.desc: High in the Caucasus, Svaneti is a remote Georgian region of snow-capped peaks, deep valleys and stone-tower villages. From Mestia you can follow old trails to glaciers, alpine meadows and the UNESCO-listed community of Ushguli, where watchtowers rise above tiny lanes. Long summer days are made for trekking between hamlets, while winter turns the slopes above town into small but atmospheric ski areas. Come if you love wild mountains mixed with very local culture, homemade food and starry, crystal-clear nights.
svaneti georgia.highlights: Classic multi-day treks linking Mestia, Ushguli and tiny medieval stone villages. | UNESCO-listed tower houses offering a rare glimpse of traditional Caucasus mountain life. | Small ski areas above Mestia with uncrowded slopes and deep winter snow. | Family guesthouses serving hearty dishes, Svanetian salt and warm homemade chacha. | Dramatic views of peaks like Shkhara, Tetnuldi and Ushba in every direction.
svaneti georgia.bonus: Hike between Mestia and Ushguli over several days and arrive at sunset among glowing towers, glaciers and one of Europe’s highest villages.

julian alps triglav np slovenia.desc: In north-western Slovenia, Triglav National Park spreads across the Julian Alps in a landscape of limestone ridges, turquoise rivers and flower-rich meadows. Around lakes like Bohinj and valleys such as the Soča, you find a network of well-marked trails, from gentle forest walks to airy routes across karst plateaus. Mountain huts dot the ridges, making hut-to-hut journeys accessible even if you’re not a hardcore alpinist. It’s a great choice if you want big alpine scenery, clear water and evenings spent in cosy villages rather than in a huge resort.
julian alps triglav np slovenia.highlights: Slovenia’s only national park, protecting much of the Julian Alps around Mount Triglav. | Well-marked hiking routes from easy lake circuits to demanding high-level traverses. | Mountain huts offering simple beds, hot food and sun terraces with panoramic views. | Emerald Soča River for rafting, canyoning and refreshing swims in summer. | Lakeside villages like Bohinj as peaceful bases with good buses and bike rentals.
julian alps triglav np slovenia.bonus: Plan a sunrise walk above the Valley of the Seven Lakes and watch the first light turn the pale limestone peaks pink and gold.

drakensberg south africa.desc: Along the border between South Africa and Lesotho, the Drakensberg Mountains rise in sheer basalt cliffs above rolling grasslands and winding rivers. In uKhahlamba-Drakensberg Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, you can hike to the Amphitheatre escarpment, gaze towards Tugela Falls or wander quiet valleys filled with proteas and rock pools. Caves hide thousands of years of San rock art, while mountain lodges offer fireplaces and big starry skies. It’s perfect if you dream of long days on trail followed by slow evenings listening to the sounds of the African night.
drakensberg south africa.highlights: UNESCO-listed uKhahlamba-Drakensberg Park with dramatic cliffs and high plateaus. | Iconic day hikes to viewpoints above Tugela Gorge and the Amphitheatre wall. | Opportunities to see San rock art with knowledgeable local guides. | Wide choice of trails, from family-friendly walks to demanding multi-day treks. | Lodges and camps with open fires, big views and easy access to trailheads.
drakensberg south africa.bonus: Take the Sentinel car park route to the Amphitheatre and climb the chain ladders for an unforgettable panorama over the escarpment and valley below.

kazbegi stepantsminda georgia.desc: At the end of the Georgian Military Highway, Stepantsminda (Kazbegi) rests in a wide valley under the snowy cone of Mount Kazbek. The silhouette of Gergeti Trinity Church on its hilltop ridge is never far from view as you hike to waterfalls, alpine meadows or viewpoints over the Dariali Gorge. The town offers a mix of cosy guesthouses and modern design hotels, and many walks start right from your door. It’s an easy-to-reach mountain base if you want big Caucasus scenery without giving up comfort, hot showers and good khachapuri at the end of the day.
kazbegi stepantsminda georgia.highlights: Spectacular setting beneath Mount Kazbek with quick access from Tbilisi by road. | Classic hike up to Gergeti Trinity Church for sweeping views over the valley. | Day trips to Truso Valley or Juta for wilder trails and high pastures. | Variety of accommodation, from family homestays to spa-style mountain hotels. | Good mix of short walks, longer ridge hikes and options for horse riding.
kazbegi stepantsminda georgia.bonus: Climb to Gergeti in the late afternoon, then wait on the hill as the sun drops and the summit of Kazbek slowly turns pastel pink.

scottish highlands glencoe uk.desc: Glencoe, in the Scottish Highlands, is a narrow glen carved by ancient volcanoes and glaciers into steep walls, waterfalls and layered ridgelines. The A82 road threads the valley floor, but step a little away and you enter a world of heather slopes, rocky corries and silent lochans. Short paths lead to viewpoints like the Three Sisters, while longer routes tackle airy ridges or link with nearby Glen Etive. In winter a small ski area and snow-covered peaks change the mood completely. It’s a place for walkers, photographers and road-trippers who love dramatic, cinematic landscapes.
scottish highlands glencoe uk.highlights: Iconic Highland scenery with green slopes, sheer cliffs and ever-changing light. | Range of walks, from easy glen trails to demanding ridge scrambles. | Glencoe Mountain Resort for skiing, snowboarding and summer chairlift rides. | Close to Fort William, making it easy to combine with Ben Nevis or the West Highland Way. | Famous film location featured in James Bond, Harry Potter and other movies.
scottish highlands glencoe uk.bonus: Drive the A82 at golden hour, stop near the Three Sisters and watch the light slide across the glen as mist drifts between the peaks.

lake como italy.desc: Lake Como, in northern Italy’s Lombardy region, wraps a deep-blue lake between steep mountains and elegant lakeside towns. In villages like Bellagio and Varenna you wander stone alleys, climb stairways lined with geraniums and pause on tiny piazzas facing the water. Historic villas hide romantic gardens, jettys and citrus terraces that you can admire from slow ferries or private boat rides. This is a place for unhurried days, long lunches by the shore and sunset views that feel made for couples and dreamers.
lake como italy.highlights: Charming villages like Bellagio and Varenna linked by frequent lake ferries. | Historic villas with romantic gardens, citrus terraces and sweeping water views. | Possibility of easy panoramic walks and hikes above the lake. | Mild climate, long season and many lakefront cafés for slow travel.
lake como italy.bonus: Hop on an evening boat from Bellagio to watch the lights of tiny villages and hillside villas sparkle all around the darkening lake.

lake garda italy.desc: Lake Garda, Italy’s largest lake, stretches between olive groves, vineyards and mountain slopes in the north. Colorful towns like Sirmione, Malcesine and Riva del Garda mix medieval castles, lakeside promenades and relaxed beach life. You can ride ferries, try sailing or windsurfing, cycle along the waterfront or take the cable car up Monte Baldo for huge views. With family‑friendly resorts, thermal spas and plenty of gelato stops, it works just as well for active trips as for slow sunny holidays.
lake garda italy.highlights: Great mix of castles, old towns and lively lakeside promenades. | Wide choice of water sports, from sailing to windsurfing and SUP. | Monte Baldo cable car with sweeping views over lake and Alps. | Family‑friendly beaches, theme parks nearby and many budget options.
lake garda italy.bonus: Spend an evening in Sirmione: stroll past the castle, soak in thermal waters and watch the sunset from the peninsula.

lake tahoe usa.desc: Lake Tahoe, on the border between California and Nevada, is a high‑altitude lake with famously clear, deep‑blue water framed by pine forests and rugged peaks. In summer you can paddle along sandy coves, hike to granite viewpoints and enjoy long evenings on the beach or at lakefront bars. Winter turns the region into a snowy playground with major ski resorts, snowshoe trails and cozy lodges. It’s a versatile destination if you want a trip that combines outdoor adventure, easy road‑trip access and classic American mountain‑town vibes.
lake tahoe usa.highlights: Year‑round destination with distinct summer beach and winter ski seasons. | Dozens of trails for hiking, biking and snowshoeing with lake views. | Choice of ski resorts around the lake, from relaxed to high‑energy. | Plenty of lakeside bars, restaurants and casinos on the Nevada side.
lake tahoe usa.bonus: Drive or cycle a section of the lakeshore loop to discover hidden coves and viewpoints far from the busiest beaches.

lake bled slovenia.desc: Lake Bled, in the Slovenian Alps, looks almost unreal with its emerald water, little island church and castle perched on a cliff above the shore. You can walk or cycle the easy path around the lake, stopping at wooden jetties to dangle your feet in the water or hire a traditional pletna boat to the island. Short hikes to viewpoints like Ojstrica reward you with classic postcard panoramas. It’s a gentle mountain escape that works well for couples, families and anyone who loves fairytale‑style landscapes without long, difficult treks.
lake bled slovenia.highlights: Flat lakeside path ideal for strolling, cycling or pushing a stroller. | Row or take a pletna boat to the tiny island church. | Viewpoints such as Ojstrica offering iconic photos over lake and mountains. | Nearby activities from canyoning and rafting to spa hotels and saunas.
lake bled slovenia.bonus: Try the local Bled cream cake on a lakeside terrace after your walk and see the castle mirrored in the water.

lake louise canada.desc: Lake Louise, in Banff National Park in the Canadian Rockies, is famous for its milky‑turquoise glacial water backed by dramatic peaks and hanging glaciers. In summer you can follow lakeside paths, hike up to spots like Lake Agnes Tea House or the Plain of Six Glaciers and watch canoes glide across the mirror‑calm surface. When the snow arrives, the nearby ski resort and winter trails turn the valley into a classic cold‑season playground. It’s a place for big mountain scenery, crisp air and days that move between adventure and quiet, reflective moments by the shore.
lake louise canada.highlights: Iconic turquoise lake framed by high peaks and glaciers. | Well‑marked hiking trails to Lake Agnes, viewpoints and neighboring valleys. | Renowned ski resort and winter activities just above the village. | Easy access to other Banff and Icefields Parkway highlights by road or shuttle.
lake louise canada.bonus: Visit at sunrise, when the first light hits the glacier and the lake turns from pale grey to an intense, almost electric turquoise.

lake geneva switzerland france.desc: Lake Geneva stretches between Switzerland and France, where elegant waterfront cities meet vineyard‑covered hillsides and snowy Alpine peaks. Cruise past Geneva’s Jet d’Eau, Lausanne’s lakeside promenades and the Belle Époque facades of Montreux, watching the light change on the deep blue water. Stop for wine tasting in the terraced Lavaux vineyards or ride a cogwheel train up to panoramic viewpoints above the lake. Here puoi passare in pochi minuti dal treno al battello, da un castello medievale a un villaggio di vignaioli, godendoti giornate lente in riva all’acqua.
lake geneva switzerland france.highlights: Scenic boat cruises linking Geneva, Lausanne, Vevey and Montreux. | Romantic promenades with swimming spots and glowing sunset views. | Lavaux vineyard terraces for wine tasting above the lake. | Quick access to Alpine viewpoints, hikes and winter resorts. | Lively cultural scene with castles, museums and lakeside festivals.
lake geneva switzerland france.bonus: Take a sunset cruise to Chillon Castle and watch the Swiss Riviera light up while the Alps slowly turn pink above the lake.

lake titicaca peru bolivia.desc: Lake Titicaca spreads across the high plateau between Peru and Bolivia, more than 3,800 metres above sea level. Here deep blue water, snow‑tipped Andes and tiny island communities create a landscape that feels both remote and very alive. You can glide over the lake in traditional reed boats to visit the Uros floating islands, hike ancient paths on Taquile or Isla del Sol and stay with local families who still keep Quechua and Aymara traditions. It’s a powerful choice if you’re drawn to culture, stories and big open horizons.
lake titicaca peru bolivia.highlights: High‑altitude lake views framed by distant Andean snow peaks. | Boat trips to Uros floating islands and hand‑woven reed boats. | Walk stone paths on Taquile or Isla del Sol at your pace. | Overnight homestays with local families, sharing food and traditions. | Crystal‑clear night skies ideal for stargazing after bright Andean sunsets.
lake titicaca peru bolivia.bonus: Join a dawn boat to Isla del Sol, then watch the first light spill across the sacred waters from a quiet hilltop viewpoint.

lake atitl n guatemala.desc: Lake Tekapo sits in New Zealand’s Mackenzie Basin, where an impossibly turquoise lake meets wide open tussock plains and the snowy Southern Alps. By day you can photograph the Church of the Good Shepherd framed by lupins, soak in hot pools or walk gentle lakeside trails with views towards Aoraki / Mount Cook. After dark, the Aoraki Mackenzie International Dark Sky Reserve reveals a sky packed with stars and the glowing Milky Way. It’s a dream stop if you love big landscapes, clear nights and peaceful small‑town vibes.
lake atitl n guatemala.highlights: Iconic turquoise glacial lake with constant views to the Southern Alps. | Easy walks and bike rides along quiet lakeside tracks and viewpoints. | Stargazing tours in the Aoraki Mackenzie Dark Sky Reserve. | Relaxing soak at Tekapo Springs with outdoor hot pools. | Photogenic Church of the Good Shepherd and springtime lupin fields.
lake atitl n guatemala.bonus: Book a late‑night observatory tour on Mount John and watch the Southern Cross and Magellanic Clouds shine above the black silhouette of the lake.

plitvice lakes croatia.desc: Plitvice Lakes National Park, in the wooded hills of central Croatia, is a chain of 16 terraced lakes linked by countless waterfalls and wooden boardwalks. You follow turquoise pools and travertine cascades through beech forest, crossing over the water on narrow paths and small bridges while dragonflies skim the surface. Boats and shuttle buses connect the upper and lower lakes, so you can choose anything from a gentle stroll to a full‑day hike. It’s a magical stop if you love forest trails, close‑up waterfall views and watching a landscape shift from emerald green to deep blue as the light changes.
plitvice lakes croatia.highlights: Network of wooden boardwalks bringing you just above turquoise lakes. | Sixteen interconnected lakes and over ninety waterfalls in one park. | Clearly marked routes ranging from short loops to full‑day hikes. | Boat and shuttle services connecting upper and lower lake areas. | Spectacular autumn colours and misty spring mornings away from the coast.
plitvice lakes croatia.bonus: Start early on a longer trail from Entrance 2 and you’ll reach quiet viewpoints where the big cascades roar below almost without any crowds.

lago atitl n guatemala.desc: Lake Atitlán lies in a volcanic crater in the Guatemalan highlands, its deep blue water ringed by three dramatic volcanoes and a necklace of Maya villages. From Panajachel you hop on small lanchas that shuttle between towns, each with a different personality – from arty San Juan to laid‑back Santa Cruz or lively San Pedro. Days slip by kayaking across the calm morning water, browsing textile markets or hiking to viewpoints like Indian Nose for sunrise. It’s an inspiring base if you enjoy slow travel, local culture and big views without a resort atmosphere.
lago atitl n guatemala.highlights: Unique setting inside a caldera, surrounded by three steep volcanoes. | Colorful lakeside towns connected by frequent public boats. | Opportunities for kayaking, paddle‑boarding and gentle lakeshore walks. | Local cooperatives selling hand‑woven textiles, coffee and crafts. | Comfortable “eternal spring” climate ideal for longer, relaxed stays.
lago atitl n guatemala.bonus: Set your alarm for the Indian Nose hike and watch the first light pour over the lake while village lights still twinkle along the shore.

bali indonesia.desc: On Bali, the "Island of the Gods", you drift between emerald rice terraces, ornate temples and surf-washed beaches. Tropical Ubud draws you into a world of art, yoga studios and green river valleys, while the coast offers lively beach clubs in Seminyak or laid-back breaks around Canggu and Uluwatu. Inland roads lead past waterfalls, village shrines and steaming volcanoes to quieter bays and family-run guesthouses. Whether you're chasing your first wave, a sunrise over the rice fields or a retreat-style escape, Bali lets you set the rhythm of your own journey.
bali indonesia.highlights: Blend days between temples, rice terraces, waterfalls and golden beaches. | Excellent surf spots for all levels around Canggu, Uluwatu and beyond. | Strong wellness scene with yoga studios, spas and healthy cafés in Ubud. | Wide choice of stays, from simple homestays to stylish private villas. | Warm tropical climate that suits winter escapes and shoulder-season adventures.
bali indonesia.bonus: Set your alarm to wander Jatiluwih or Tegallalang at sunrise, when the rice terraces glow green and the paths are almost empty.

santorini greece.desc: Santorini curves like a half-moon around a flooded volcanic crater, its white houses spilling down cliffs above the Aegean. In villages such as Fira, Imerovigli and Oia, you wander narrow lanes between blue-domed churches, wine bars and terraces with sweeping caldera views. Down at sea level, black-sand and red-rock beaches offer a more relaxed side of the island, with tavernas and boat trips to the hot springs. It’s a dream setting for couples and friends who love dramatic landscapes, sunsets and long dinners by the water.
santorini greece.highlights: Spectacular caldera views from clifftop villages like Fira, Imerovigli and Oia. | Iconic blue-domed churches and whitewashed lanes made for evening strolls. | Volcanic beaches with dark sand, clear water and laid-back tavernas. | Excellent local wines from Assyrtiko grapes grown in volcanic soil. | Sunset cruises and sailing trips to hot springs and nearby islets.
santorini greece.bonus: Treat yourself to a late-afternoon boat cruise inside the caldera, ending with the sun setting behind Oia while you watch from the water.

maui usa.desc: Maui squeezes rainforest valleys, golden beaches and a vast volcanic summit into one island you can actually drive around. The legendary Road to Hana winds past waterfalls, sea cliffs and black-sand coves, while the slopes of Haleakalā rise to more than 3,000 metres for sunrise-above-the-clouds views. On the west and south coasts you’ll find long swimming beaches, laid-back surf towns and winter whale-watching cruises. Maui works just as well for an active road trip as for a relaxed base where you explore a different corner of the island every day.
maui usa.highlights: Scenic Road to Hana with waterfalls, lookouts and short jungle hikes. | Haleakalā National Park for sunrise views high above the clouds. | Long family-friendly beaches with good swimming and easy facilities. | Seasonal whale-watching, snorkelling and sailing tours straight from resort areas. | American-style convenience combined with distinctive Hawaiian culture and music.
maui usa.bonus: Set aside one morning for Haleakalā: leave in the dark, watch the sun rise over the crater, then drive slowly down through changing climates.

seychelles.desc: The Seychelles archipelago, scattered across the Indian Ocean northeast of Madagascar, is a daydream of granite islands, bright lagoons and slow island life. On inner islands such as Mahé, Praslin and La Digue, tropical forest slides down to white-sand beaches where blush-pink boulders meet shallow, clear water. Just off the sand you can snorkel or dive with turtles and shoals of reef fish, sail between tiny islets or wander along shady coastal paths. With a warm climate, Creole flavours and stays ranging from guesthouses to high-end resorts, the Seychelles are perfect if you’re chasing postcard beaches but also quiet nature and unhurried days.
seychelles.highlights: Stroll Anse Source d’Argent, where sculpted granite boulders frame calm, shallow water. | Island-hop between Mahé, Praslin and La Digue by ferry, mixing lively bays with sleepy villages. | Snorkel from the beach to reefs where colourful fish and turtles glide by. | Explore Vallée de Mai’s ancient palm forest or visit nearby islands to see giant tortoises.
seychelles.bonus: Charter a small boat at golden hour to swim in a quiet cove, then watch the sky turn pastel behind the granite silhouettes.

mauritius.desc: Mauritius is a volcanic island wrapped in a turquoise lagoon and coral reef, where sugar-cane fields slide down to long, palm-lined beaches. Stay on the west or north coast for calm bays such as Trou-aux-Biches and Flic-en-Flac, or head south-west to Le Morne, a UNESCO-listed mountain rising straight above a dreamy peninsula. Inland, days out take you to Chamarel’s Seven Coloured Earths, waterfalls and the forested trails of Black River Gorges National Park. Mauritius suits couples, families and friends who want an easy beach holiday but still like to explore.
mauritius.highlights: Lagoon protected by one of the world’s largest continuous coral reefs. | Choice of relaxed villages or full-service resorts along the coast. | Le Morne peninsula with dramatic mountain backdrop and good kite-surfing winds. | Excursions to Chamarel’s coloured earths, viewpoints and nearby waterfalls. | Hiking and nature watching in Black River Gorges National Park.
mauritius.bonus: For a special day, hike partway up Le Morne in the cool morning, then reward yourself with a swim and sunset on the beach below.

ibiza spain.desc: Ibiza is a Balearic island where coves of turquoise water meet pine-covered hills and whitewashed villages. By day you can move between quiet beaches, scenic coastal paths and relaxed chiringuitos, or explore the fortified old town of Dalt Vila. As the sun sets, world-famous beach clubs and open-air bars light up with DJs, cocktails and sea views. Whether you're travelling with friends, as a couple or even with older kids, you can shape Ibiza into the getaway you want.
ibiza spain.highlights: Hidden coves with clear, calm water ideal for long, lazy swims. | Lively beach clubs mixing good music, creative cocktails and sunset views. | UNESCO-listed Dalt Vila with cobbled alleys, city walls and harbour panoramas. | Plenty of quieter resorts and family-friendly beaches away from party hotspots. | Excellent ferry and flight connections that make island-hopping around the Balearics easy.
ibiza spain.bonus: Take a small-group boat trip at sunset and watch Ibiza's coastline glow orange while you swim off the boat in warm, transparent water.

zanzibar tanzania.desc: Off the coast of Tanzania, Zanzibar feels like a dream of the Indian Ocean, with palm-fringed beaches, sandbanks at low tide and bright coral reefs offshore. On the main island you can split your days between kitesurf beaches like Paje, calmer swimming bays in the north and sunset dhow cruises that slide silently across the water. Stone Town adds another layer, with carved wooden doors, mosques and markets that smell of cloves and cinnamon. It's a great choice if you want tropical sea, warm people and a hint of adventure without sacrificing comfort.
zanzibar tanzania.highlights: Long white-sand beaches such as Nungwi, Kendwa or Paje with different vibes. | Excellent snorkelling and diving on shallow reefs full of colourful fish. | Atmospheric Stone Town with Swahili, Arab and Indian influences in every alley. | Spice farm and Jozani Forest excursions that break up your beach days. | Dry, warm climate during many months, ideal for escaping northern-hemisphere winters.
zanzibar tanzania.bonus: Join a late-afternoon dhow cruise, sip fresh coconut on deck and watch the sun sink into the Indian Ocean behind the sails.

phuket thailand.desc: In southern Thailand, Phuket is a large, easy-to-reach island where golden beaches, jungle-covered hills and colourful temples sit side by side. You can spend your mornings on family-friendly stretches like Karon or Kata, move to livelier areas with markets and rooftop bars in the evening, or escape by long-tail boat to smaller nearby islands. Inland, viewpoints, the Big Buddha and night markets give you a taste of local life between swims. Phuket suits you if you like mixing relaxed beach time with Thai food, day trips and a bit of nightlife rather than staying in one place.
phuket thailand.highlights: Wide choice of beaches, from quiet coves to busy resort strips. | Plenty of direct flights and a bridge to the mainland for easy access. | Island-hopping by speedboat or long-tail to Phi Phi or Phang Nga Bay. | Temples, viewpoints and markets that bring Thai culture into a beach holiday. | Resorts for every budget, from simple guesthouses to full-service luxury hotels.
phuket thailand.bonus: Join a small boat tour to Phang Nga Bay and paddle a kayak beneath limestone cliffs and hidden caves between swimming stops.

palawan philippines.desc: In the western Philippines, Palawan feels wild and cinematic: limestone cliffs rise straight from turquoise lagoons, jungles cover the hills and tiny islands dot clear water. Around El Nido and Coron you can spend your days island-hopping, swimming in hidden coves, kayaking into quiet lagoons and snorkelling above reefs full of life. On land, small coastal towns, seafood markets and simple beach bars keep the atmosphere relaxed and unpretentious. Palawan suits travellers who value nature, boat trips and starry skies more than big nightlife, and it works beautifully for couples, friends or adventurous families.
palawan philippines.highlights: Spectacular karst landscapes and lagoons that feel almost unreal in their colours. | Island-hopping tours with plenty of time for swimming, snorkelling and beaches. | Generally quieter, more low-key atmosphere than many other Southeast Asian islands. | Fresh seafood grills and simple beach bars right on the sand. | Opportunities for diving, kayaking and exploring caves for more active travellers.
palawan philippines.bonus: Book an early-morning island-hopping tour from El Nido and be among the first boats to glide into still, mirror-calm lagoons.

jeju island south korea.desc: Jeju Island, off the southern coast of South Korea, blends volcanic landscapes, seaside cliffs and gentle rural life on one compact island. You can hike sections of the Jeju Olle Trail or even part of Hallasan, visit waterfalls that tumble into forested gorges and walk across old lava fields and tubes recognised by UNESCO. Along the coast, black-rock beaches, tea fields and tangerine orchards create a very different mood from tropical islands further south. Jeju works well if you enjoy walking, scenic drives and local food, and want a nature escape that still feels organised and easy to explore.
jeju island south korea.highlights: UNESCO-listed lava tubes, craters and tuff cones unlike typical beach islands. | Well-marked Jeju Olle walking trails with sea views and countryside villages. | Possibility to hike up Hallasan for sweeping views across the island. | Distinct seasons with cherry blossoms, lush summers and snowy winter peaks. | Excellent cafés, seafood restaurants and local markets for post-hike rewards.
jeju island south korea.bonus: Wake up early to watch sunrise from Seongsan Ilchulbong and see the volcanic cone glowing above the sea before the day-trippers arrive.

rome italy.desc: Rome is where layers of ancient history sit beside lively piazzas, cafés and everyday neighbourhood life. In the space of a day you can step inside the Colosseum, wander the Roman Forum, gaze up at the Pantheon and cross the river to the cobbled lanes of Trastevere. Vatican City, with St. Peter’s Basilica and the Vatican Museums, adds a completely different atmosphere of grand basilicas and masterpieces. Between gelato stops, trattorie and viewpoints like Janiculum Hill, Rome is ideal if you love city breaks that mix culture, food and scenic sunsets.
rome italy.highlights: Walk among icons like the Colosseum, Roman Forum and Pantheon within a compact centre. | Cross to Trastevere for cobbled lanes, trattorie and laid‑back evening vibes. | Visit Vatican City for St. Peter’s Basilica, the dome and world‑class art. | Panoramic viewpoints such as Janiculum Hill give wide cityscapes, perfect at sunset.
rome italy.bonus: Catch the golden hour from Janiculum Hill, where the domes and rooftops of Rome light up gradually as the city starts its evening.

athens greece.desc: Athens spreads out between rocky hills and the sea, with the Acropolis and its Parthenon watching over everything. In a single walk you can explore centuries of history, from ancient temples and the Agora to neoclassical streets in Plaka filled with tavernas and little shops. Cafés spill onto squares, and in the evening rooftops light up with views back to the illuminated Acropolis. With a warm Mediterranean climate and easy metro links to beaches and ferries, Athens suits you if you enjoy mixing culture with relaxed urban life.
athens greece.highlights: See the Acropolis, Parthenon and Ancient Agora all within easy walking distance. | Wander Plaka’s lanes lined with tavernas, neoclassical houses and souvenir shops. | Enjoy rooftop bars and café terraces with night views of the lit‑up Acropolis. | Mediterranean climate with especially pleasant sightseeing in spring and autumn.
athens greece.bonus: Take the funicular or path up Lycabettus Hill at sunset for a wide view over Athens, the sea and the glowing Acropolis.

cairo egypt.desc: Cairo stretches along the Nile, a huge, energetic capital where desert light, traffic and minarets blend into one skyline. Within a short drive you swap the city streets for the Giza Plateau, standing in front of the pyramids and the Sphinx, or visiting the new Grand Egyptian Museum near them. In the centre you can wander the lanes of Islamic Cairo, explore mosques and browse Khan el‑Khalili bazaar before relaxing with mint tea. With a hot desert climate and milder evenings in spring and autumn, Cairo suits travellers who enjoy busy cities full of history.
cairo egypt.highlights: Iconic day trip to the Giza Plateau with pyramids and the Sphinx close to town. | Atmospheric wander through Islamic Cairo’s alleys, mosques and old city gates. | Bargain and people‑watch in Khan el‑Khalili bazaar over tea and pastries. | Cruise the Nile at sunset, then sleep in a modern hotel with skyline views. | Visit the Grand Egyptian Museum near Giza to see thousands of artifacts together.
cairo egypt.bonus: Keep one evening free for a felucca or small boat ride on the Nile as the call to prayer and city lights rise around you.

jerusalem israel.desc: Jerusalem sits high in the hills of Israel, its pale stone walls surrounding an Old City that is sacred to Jews, Christians and Muslims. Inside the gates you move between the Western Wall, the Church of the Holy Sepulchre and the golden Dome of the Rock, crossing narrow alleys filled with spice stalls and small bakeries. Above, viewpoints like the Mount of Olives or the city ramparts give wide panoramas over domes, minarets and bell towers. With cool winters, warm summers and dry, clear evenings, Jerusalem is ideal if you’re drawn to places where history and spirituality shape everyday life.
jerusalem israel.highlights: Explore the four quarters of the Old City on foot, each with its own character. | Visit key holy sites such as the Western Wall, Church of the Holy Sepulchre and Temple Mount. | Wander through souqs scented with coffee, spices and freshly baked flatbread. | Climb the Mount of Olives or the ramparts walk for sweeping views over the city and surrounding hills.
jerusalem israel.bonus: Take an early‑morning or sunset walk on the Mount of Olives path to watch the Old City gradually light up below you.

paris france.desc: Paris stretches along the Seine with grand boulevards, elegant bridges and neighbourhoods that all feel a little different. One day you might climb the Eiffel Tower, wander through the Louvre, then end in the artists’ lanes of Montmartre; another you simply follow the river past bookstalls and café terraces. The city has a temperate climate, with blossom in spring, lively café life in summer and crisp, romantic evenings in autumn and winter. Paris is ideal if you want an urban break where world‑class art, food and everyday street scenes are all part of the same walk.
paris france.highlights: See Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre‑Dame and the Seine embankments in a compact area. | Explore characterful districts like Le Marais, Saint‑Germain and Montmartre on foot. | Enjoy café terraces, bakeries and neighbourhood markets from breakfast to late evening. | Take a river cruise or stroll along the quays at sunset for classic Paris views. | Mild, changeable climate makes the city interesting in every season, from blossom to Christmas lights.
paris france.bonus: For a simple but memorable moment, watch the Eiffel Tower sparkle from the Trocadéro or from a boat on the Seine just after dusk.

beijing china.desc: Beijing, China’s vast capital, blends imperial grandeur with the buzz of a futuristic megacity. Wander from the crimson courtyards of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square into quiet hutong alleys where everyday life still unfolds behind grey-brick walls. Between leafy parks and sleek skyscrapers you can feast on Peking duck, discover contemporary art in former factory districts and browse lively markets. With the Great Wall within easy reach, Beijing rewards curious travellers who enjoy dense history, big-city energy and surprising pockets of calm.
beijing china.highlights: Iconic Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square and Temple of Heaven within easy metro reach. | Atmospheric hutong lanes with traditional courtyards, tiny cafés and local street food. | Day trips to less-crowded Great Wall sections such as Mutianyu from the city. | Lakes and gardens like Beihai Park offer boating, shade and local life. | Modern subway and bike-sharing keep long distances manageable even on short stays.
beijing china.bonus: Climb the hilltop pavilion in Jingshan Park at sunset for sweeping views over the Forbidden City’s golden roofs and Beijing’s ever-growing skyline.

mexico city mexico.desc: Mexico City is a restless, creative capital where Aztec ruins, colonial palaces and bold street art share the same skyline. In the Centro Histórico you wander past the Zócalo, the cathedral and ancient Templo Mayor before diving into markets bursting with chilies, flowers and fresh tortillas. Leafy Roma and Condesa invite you to café-hop, taste world‑class cuisine and linger on tree‑lined plazas, while a boat ride along the canals of Xochimilco shows the city at its most festive. Mexico City suits travellers who love big flavours, intense culture and long days of exploring on foot.
mexico city mexico.highlights: Historic center packed with UNESCO‑listed landmarks, museums and grand colonial architecture. | Colorful markets and street food stalls serving tacos, tamales and fresh fruit juices. | Characterful neighborhoods like Roma and Condesa with galleries, boutiques and leafy cafés. | Traditional trajinera boat rides through Xochimilco’s canals, music and floating food vendors. | Exceptional museums, from Frida Kahlo’s Blue House to world‑class anthropology collections.
mexico city mexico.bonus: Reserve a morning for the Museo Nacional de Antropología, then end the day at a rooftop bar overlooking the Zócalo as the city lights slowly switch on.

cusco peru.desc: Cusco, high in the Peruvian Andes, was once the heart of the Inca Empire and today mixes stone temples, colonial plazas and mountain views in every direction. In the historic center you wander narrow cobbled streets where finely cut Inca walls support pastel‑colored balconies, and lively markets overflow with textiles, coca tea and local snacks. Many travellers use Cusco as a base for exploring the Sacred Valley and eventually Machu Picchu, but the city itself rewards slow days of café‑hopping and staircase climbs to viewpoints. Cusco is ideal if you enjoy altitude, history and an intimate, small‑city atmosphere.
cusco peru.highlights: Beautiful Plaza de Armas lined with arcades, churches and inviting cafés. | Steep alleys like San Blas quarter with artisans’ workshops and panoramic viewpoints. | Easy access to the Sacred Valley, including Pisac, Ollantaytambo and surrounding ruins. | Gateway for train and trekking routes leading on towards Machu Picchu. | Lively markets offering alpaca knits, fresh juices and Andean street food at low prices.
cusco peru.bonus: Take a late‑afternoon walk up to the San Cristóbal viewpoint or Sacsayhuamán ruins to watch golden light settle over Cusco’s terracotta roofs and surrounding mountains.

kyoto japan.desc: Kyoto, once Japan’s imperial capital, feels like a living gallery of temples, shrines and carefully raked gardens framed by low mountains. In districts such as Higashiyama and Gion you wander past wooden machiya townhouses, lantern‑lit lanes and occasional glimpses of geiko hurrying to evening appointments. To the west, Arashiyama offers bamboo groves, riverside walks and hillside viewpoints, while markets and covered shopping streets keep the city buzzing with everyday life. Kyoto suits travellers who enjoy slow exploration, seasonal scenery and the contrast between tranquil Zen spaces and busy, modern neighborhoods.
kyoto japan.highlights: Hundreds of temples and shrines, from Kiyomizu-dera to Fushimi Inari’s iconic torii tunnels. | Historic streets of Gion and Higashiyama with traditional wooden houses and teahouses. | Arashiyama area for bamboo forest walks, riverside boats and mountain views. | Excellent public transport linking sights, from suburban trains to city buses and subways. | Rich food scene with kaiseki cuisine, matcha sweets and casual noodle shops.
kyoto japan.bonus: Wake up early and walk through a quieter Fushimi Inari or Arashiyama bamboo grove at dawn, when the light and silence make Kyoto feel almost timeless.

istanbul t rkiye.desc: Istanbul straddles Europe and Asia, a city of domes, minarets and busy waterways where history never feels far away. Around Sultanahmet you wander between Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapı Palace, then dive into the Grand Bazaar and nearby Spice Market with their vaults of gold, textiles and fragrant stalls. Ferries crisscross the Bosphorus, revealing wooden yalıs, hilltop mosques and entire neighborhoods unfolding along the shoreline. By evening, cafés and meyhanes fill with conversation and the sound of clinking tea glasses. Istanbul is perfect if you love layered history, vivid street life and the feeling of crossing continents in a single day.
istanbul t rkiye.highlights: World‑famous landmarks in walking distance: Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapı Palace. | Grand Bazaar and Spice Market offering carpets, ceramics, spices and Turkish delight. | Scenic Bosphorus ferries linking the European and Asian sides of the city. | Lively food culture with meze, fresh fish, street simit and strong Turkish coffee. | Mix of historic streets and modern districts like Karaköy, Galata and Kadıköy.
istanbul t rkiye.bonus: Take an evening Bosphorus cruise or simple public ferry as the sun sets to watch the city’s skyline glow while the call to prayer echoes from both shores.

sedona usa.desc: Sedona, Arizona is a desert town framed by towering red-rock spires and wide, open sky. From almost anywhere you look, sandstone cathedrals rise above juniper-covered slopes and winding canyon trails. Spend your days hiking routes like Cathedral Rock or Devil’s Bridge, joining a jeep tour deep into the backcountry, or soaking in a spa while the cliffs turn orange and pink. Sedona is a great choice if you love outdoor adventures, wellness and big landscapes that feel almost otherworldly.
sedona usa.highlights: Iconic hiking on Cathedral Rock, Bell Rock and Devil’s Bridge viewpoints. | Jeep tours and mountain biking through dramatic red-rock canyons. | Dry desert climate with plenty of sunshine and glowing sunsets. | Spa resorts, yoga studios and energy vortex sites for wellness seekers. | Art galleries, Native-inspired crafts and cosy restaurants in town.
