venice italy.highlights: Unique car‑free historic centre where you walk or travel everywhere by vaporetto or gondola. | Grand Canal lined with palaces and crossed by Rialto Bridge and the Bridge of Sighs. | St Mark’s Basilica, Doge’s Palace and hidden churches packed with Renaissance and Byzantine art. | Atmospheric backstreets, canalside cafés and local bacari serving small cicchetti plates with wine. | Easy boat trips across the lagoon to colourful Burano, glass‑making Murano or peaceful outer islands.
venice italy.bonus: Set your alarm for sunrise and wander the empty calli and canals before the day‑trippers arrive; Venice feels like it belongs only to you.

prague czech republic.desc: Prague, the storybook capital of the Czech Republic, spreads along the Vltava River with a skyline of gothic spires and red roofs. From the cobbled alleys of the Old Town to the courtyards of Prague Castle, every corner feels made for wandering between cafés, beer halls and hidden gardens. Cross Charles Bridge at dawn, listen to street musicians and watch boats glide below you, or ride a tram up to leafy viewpoints. It’s an easy city break if you love history, romantic walks and relaxed nights out.
prague czech republic.highlights: Sunrise walks across Charles Bridge with sweeping views over the Vltava River. | Compact historic center where you can explore main sights easily on foot. | Mix of gothic churches, baroque palaces and quirky art along the riverbanks. | Legendary beer culture, from traditional pubs to modern craft breweries and garden terraces. | Seasonal charm, with Christmas markets, summer river cruises and colorful autumn parks.
prague czech republic.bonus: Climb up to Letná Park at sunset to see Prague’s bridges lined up across the Vltava, with the castle glowing above the rooftops.

bruges belgium.desc: Bruges, in the northwest of Belgium, feels like a perfectly preserved medieval town wrapped around quiet canals. Gabled houses, stone bridges and church towers reflect in the water as you wander between the Markt, the Burg and tiny side streets lined with chocolatiers. You can climb the Belfry for a wide view over the rooftops, then escape the crowds by the romantic Minnewaterpark or the windmills on the old ramparts. It’s a gentle, walkable escape if you enjoy slow travel, photography and evenings spent tasting local beer and chocolate.
bruges belgium.highlights: Storybook canals where every bend reveals new reflections of gables and bridges. | Compact UNESCO-listed center that is easy and relaxing to explore on foot. | Iconic Belfry tower with panoramic views over rooftops, squares and canals. | Excellent Belgian chocolate, waffles and beer bars for indulgent breaks between walks. | Quiet evenings and soft lighting that create a very romantic atmosphere after day-trippers leave.
bruges belgium.bonus: Take a late-afternoon canal cruise as the light turns golden and watch the façades of Bruges double in the still water.

udaipur india.desc: Udaipur, in the Indian state of Rajasthan, spreads around a chain of shimmering lakes backed by arid hills and whitewashed palaces. Around Lake Pichola and Lake Fateh Sagar you’ll find ghats where locals gather, rooftop restaurants with candlelight views and the vast City Palace rising above the water. Narrow lanes of the old town hide temples, havelis and colourful markets, while boat rides and sunset viewpoints keep the pace surprisingly relaxed for an Indian city. Udaipur is made for travellers who dream of romantic scenery, heritage hotels and warm evenings by the lake breeze.
udaipur india.highlights: Chain of natural and man-made lakes creating cooler air and reflections of palaces. | Iconic City Palace complex with courtyards, terraces and balconies overlooking Lake Pichola. | Atmospheric old town lanes full of temples, textile shops and traditional havelis. | Romantic rooftop dining and cafés with wide views of the lake and hills at sunset. | Gentler pace than many Indian cities, yet easy access to day trips and countryside.
udaipur india.bonus: For a truly magical evening, take a sunset boat ride on Lake Pichola and watch the palaces and ghats slowly light up around you.

seville spain.desc: Seville, capital of Andalusia in southern Spain, is a sun-drenched city where orange trees, tiled patios and gothic towers share the same skyline. Around the Cathedral and the Real Alcázar you wander through the lanes of Santa Cruz, ducking into tapas bars, hidden courtyards and shaded squares. Cross the river to Triana for ceramics workshops and late-night flamenco, or cycle along the Guadalquivir to parks and the spectacular Plaza de España. Seville suits travellers who love warm evenings outdoors, a vivid cultural scene and days that mix sightseeing with long, social meals.
seville spain.highlights: Iconic Cathedral and Giralda tower paired with the lush, Moorish-inspired Real Alcázar gardens. | Atmospheric Santa Cruz quarter with narrow lanes, tiled patios and orange-scented squares. | Authentic flamenco culture in Triana, from intimate bars to dedicated tablaos and museums. | Excellent tapas scene, easy to sample different dishes by hopping between neighbourhood bars. | Mild winters and long summer evenings that invite late terraces, riverside walks and festivals.
seville spain.bonus: For a special evening, see an intimate flamenco show in Triana then stroll back along the riverfront as Seville’s towers glow across the water.

quebec city canada.desc: Quebec City, perched above the St. Lawrence River in eastern Canada, feels like a small walled French town dropped into North America. In Old Quebec you wander cobblestone streets, stone fortifications and lively squares watched over by the Château Frontenac and the Dufferin Terrace. In winter the city becomes a snow-covered playground with ice slides, nearby ski hills and a famous carnival, while summer brings café terraces, street performers and river views until late in the evening. Quebec City suits travellers who like European charm, four distinct seasons and easy access to nature just outside the walls.
quebec city canada.highlights: UNESCO-listed Old Quebec with fortified walls, narrow lanes and centuries-old stone houses. | Iconic Château Frontenac hotel and boardwalk terraces overlooking the St. Lawrence River. | Strong French-speaking culture, from bistros and bakeries to festivals and local music. | Winter fun with snow slides, nearby skiing, snowshoe trails and a lively carnival atmosphere. | Quick escapes into nature, with riverside paths, surrounding forests and easy day trips.
quebec city canada.bonus: Ride the historic toboggan slide on Dufferin Terrace on a clear winter night, with the Château Frontenac glowing above the frozen river.

porto portugal.desc: Porto, in northern Portugal, is a characterful riverside city where steep lanes tumble down to the Douro. In the colourful Ribeira quarter you wander between tiled facades, lively cafés and views of the Dom Luís I bridge. Cross the river to the famous port wine cellars of Vila Nova de Gaia or hop on a vintage tram towards the Atlantic beaches at Foz do Douro. Porto suits you if you love mixing culture, food and sea breeze in a compact, walkable city.
porto portugal.highlights: Riverside old town with colourful houses and UNESCO‑listed Ribeira streets. | Easy access to Atlantic beaches and sunset walks in Foz do Douro. | Historic port wine lodges with tastings overlooking the Douro River. | Striking viewpoints from Clérigos Tower and along the Dom Luís I bridge. | Compact centre, good public transport and plenty of cosy cafés.
porto portugal.bonus: For a memorable evening, take a traditional rabelo boat cruise under Porto’s six bridges while the city lights reflect on the Douro.

buenos aires argentina.desc: Buenos Aires, Argentina’s vibrant capital, feels like a mix of European elegance and Latin American energy. You stroll past Belle Époque facades, leafy plazas and wide avenues before diving into neighbourhoods like tango‑filled San Telmo, colourful La Boca and trendy Palermo. Evenings stretch late with parrillas, Malbec and live music on almost every corner. It’s a great choice if you enjoy big‑city culture, nightlife and local traditions but still want parks, riverside walks and relaxed cafés where you can slow the pace.
buenos aires argentina.highlights: Diverse neighbourhoods from bohemian San Telmo to stylish Palermo and Recoleta. | Strong tango culture with milongas, street performances and dance classes. | Excellent food scene, from traditional parrillas to modern gourmet restaurants. | Many museums, theatres and historic cafés around the city centre. | Large urban parks and riverside areas for cycling, picnics and fresh air.
buenos aires argentina.bonus: For a special night, book a smaller local milonga instead of a tourist show and watch porteños dance tango until the early hours.

chiang mai thailand.desc: Chiang Mai, in northern Thailand, combines a relaxed small‑city feeling with golden temples and jungle‑covered mountains on the horizon. Inside the moated Old City you wander between historic wats, street‑food stalls and cafés where travellers and digital nomads linger for hours. Just outside town, winding roads climb up to Doi Suthep and cooler forest villages, while night bazaars fill with textiles, crafts and local snacks. Chiang Mai suits you if you want Thailand’s culture and nature with gentler heat, slower rhythms and plenty of options for day trips.
chiang mai thailand.highlights: Compact Old City ringed by walls and filled with ornate Buddhist temples. | Easy access to Doi Suthep and nearby mountain viewpoints. | Lively night markets with handicrafts, street food and live music. | Plenty of cafés, coworking spaces and wellness studios for longer stays. | Day trips to waterfalls, hill villages and ethical elephant sanctuaries.
chiang mai thailand.bonus: Wake up early one morning to offer alms to monks on quiet streets, then watch the city slowly come to life around the markets.

hallstatt austria.desc: Hallstatt, in Austria’s Salzkammergut region, is a tiny village squeezed between steep mountains and the glassy waters of Lake Hallstatt. Wooden houses climb the slope above the church spire, mirrored in the lake that you can cross by boat or stroll along on a lakeside promenade. Above the village, the historic salt mine and Hallstatt Skywalk reveal just how long people have lived and worked in this landscape. Hallstatt is ideal if you dream of alpine views, gentle walks and storybook scenery, especially outside the busiest summer weekends.
hallstatt austria.highlights: Picture‑perfect village centre with traditional wooden houses on the lakeshore. | UNESCO‑listed cultural landscape surrounded by dramatic Dachstein mountains. | Boat trips and easy lakeside paths with constant photo opportunities. | Access to the historic Hallstatt salt mine and panoramic Skywalk platform. | Many nearby hiking routes and viewpoints for half‑day or full‑day outings.
hallstatt austria.bonus: If you visit early or stay overnight, you can watch morning mist lift off Lake Hallstatt before the day‑trippers arrive.

val d orcia tuscany italy.desc: Val d’Orcia in southern Tuscany is a wide, rolling valley of golden fields, vineyards and cypress‑lined ridges that seems made for slow travel. Hilltop towns like Pienza, Montalcino and San Quirico d’Orcia overlook patchworks of wheat, olive groves and orderly rows of vines, all part of a UNESCO‑listed cultural landscape. You can follow winding country roads by car, bike or on foot, stopping for farm lunches, Brunello tastings and views that change with every curve. Val d’Orcia suits you if you love quiet countryside, good wine and long horizons more than big‑city buzz.
val d orcia tuscany italy.highlights: Iconic Tuscan scenery of rolling hills, cypress lanes and stone farmhouses. | UNESCO‑protected agricultural landscape shaped since Renaissance times. | Medieval hill towns such as Pienza, Montalcino and San Quirico d’Orcia. | Excellent wines including Brunello di Montalcino and Vino Nobile from nearby estates. | Opportunities for scenic drives, cycling routes and gentle countryside walks.
val d orcia tuscany italy.bonus: Treat yourself to an afternoon in the thermal pools of Bagno Vignoni or Bagni San Filippo, soaking with views of the surrounding hills.

napa valley usa.desc: Just north of San Francisco, Napa Valley rolls out vineyards, cypress-lined lanes, and small towns where wine sets the rhythm of your days. You swirl glasses in atmospheric tasting rooms, drift past the vines by bike or vintage convertible, and linger over long farm-to-table dinners in cosy restaurants. Between spa resorts, hot springs in Calistoga, hot-air balloon flights at sunrise, and quiet trails in the surrounding hills, this is a place to slow down in style, especially if you love food, wine, and relaxed road trips.
napa valley usa.highlights: Scenic vineyards, cellar doors and tasting rooms for every level of wine lover. | Easy drives between charming towns like Yountville, St. Helena and Calistoga. | Spa resorts, hot springs and wellness retreats to completely switch off. | Gentle cycling routes, hiking trails and hot-air balloon rides over the valley.
napa valley usa.bonus: For a memory-making morning, book a sunrise hot-air balloon flight watching Napa Valley turn gold below you.

stellenbosch south africa.desc: Framed by rugged mountains and vineyards, Stellenbosch in South Africa mixes small-town charm with a serious love of food and wine. You wander under oak-shaded streets lined with Cape Dutch houses, pop into art galleries and cafés, then escape a few minutes out of town to estates where tastings spill out onto lawns. Nearby nature reserves offer hiking and mountain-bike trails, so you can swap the cellar door for fynbos views whenever you feel like moving.
stellenbosch south africa.highlights: Historic centre with white Cape Dutch houses and leafy streets. | Easy wine tasting at numerous estates just outside town. | Excellent restaurants, farm stalls and cheese or chocolate pairings. | Access to nearby nature reserves for hiking and mountain biking.
stellenbosch south africa.bonus: Pack a picnic at a wine farm dam and sip a local Chenin Blanc while the mountains turn pink at sunset.

vienna austria.desc: Vienna, Austria’s imperial capital, charms you with grand boulevards, palaces and a rhythm that is elegant but never stiff. You can wander from the historic center to Schönbrunn Palace, pause in traditional coffee houses with marble tables and pastries, then dive into museums, markets and music halls in the evening. Trams, metro and walking paths make it easy to explore, whether you’re here for art, Christmas markets or simply to soak up the city’s lived-in, everyday charm.
vienna austria.highlights: Compact historic center with landmarks, cafés and shops within easy walking distance. | Iconic sights like Schönbrunn Palace, the Hofburg and the giant Ferris wheel. | Strong cultural scene with classical concerts, museums and contemporary galleries. | Efficient public transport that makes day-to-day exploring simple without a car.
vienna austria.bonus: Treat yourself to an evening concert in a small church or palace hall to feel Vienna’s musical tradition up close.

dubrovnik croatia.desc: Dubrovnik, on Croatia’s Adriatic coast, is a walled stone city where the sea is never far from view. You stroll along marble-bright streets in the Old Town, climb the city walls for sweeping panoramas of terracotta roofs and turquoise water, then cool off on nearby beaches or in hidden coves. Boat trips to Lokrum or the Elaphiti Islands and the cable car up Mount Srđ add even more perspectives, making it a great choice if you love coastal cities with history and drama.
dubrovnik croatia.highlights: Spectacular medieval walls encircling the UNESCO-listed Old Town. | Easy access to beaches and swimming spots just outside the city gates. | Boat excursions to islands like Lokrum and the Elaphiti archipelago. | Cable car and viewpoints on Mount Srđ with wide Adriatic vistas.
dubrovnik croatia.bonus: Walk the city walls late in the afternoon for golden light over the rooftops and a far quieter atmosphere than midday.

taormina sicily italy.desc: Taormina, perched on a hillside on Sicily’s east coast, looks out over the Ionian Sea with Mount Etna on the horizon. You weave through narrow medieval lanes, pause at cafés with tiled terraces and step into the ancient Greek Theatre where the stage opens directly onto sea and sky. Down below, cable cars and winding roads lead to pebble beaches like Isola Bella, while day trips to Etna add a dash of volcanic adventure to an otherwise slow, sun-drenched stay.
taormina sicily italy.highlights: Dramatic hilltop setting with wide views of the sea and Mount Etna. | Atmospheric Greek Theatre hosting events with a natural sea-view backdrop. | Easy access to beaches and coves such as Isola Bella by cable car. | Great base for day trips along the coast or up to Etna’s lava landscapes.
taormina sicily italy.bonus: Stay out late one evening to watch a show or concert at the Greek Theatre as the sky darkens over the bay.

funchal madeira portugal.desc: Perched on the steep green slopes of Madeira, Funchal spills down like an amphitheatre towards the Atlantic, with dazzling sea views at every turn. Wander its cobbled old town, browse the colourful Mercado dos Lavradores and sample fragrant Madeira wines in traditional lodges. Take the cable car up to Monte for lush botanical gardens and panoramic trails, then drift back down towards the marina for a sunset stroll. Funchal suits you if you want a gentle mix of ocean, nature and relaxed city vibes all year round.
funchal madeira portugal.highlights: Hillside city with sweeping Atlantic views from many streets and terraces. | Mild subtropical climate, ideal for winter sun and off-season escapes. | Cable car to Monte with botanical gardens and classic wicker toboggan ride. | Easy access to levada walks, mountain viewpoints and whale-watching trips. | Compact centre with cosy restaurants, wine bars and waterfront promenade.
funchal madeira portugal.bonus: Sneak away to the nearby viewpoint at Pico dos Barcelos at sunset for a magical, crowd-free panorama over Funchal’s bay and glittering lights.

edinburgh uk.desc: Edinburgh, Scotland’s atmospheric capital, rises around a volcanic hill crowned by its famous castle and looks out over the North Sea. You wander between the medieval wynds of the Old Town and the elegant Georgian streets of the New Town, discovering tiny pubs, museums and views at every corner. Climb Arthur’s Seat for a windswept panorama, then warm up with a whisky in a cosy bar. Edinburgh is ideal if you enjoy history-soaked cities with dramatic scenery and a lively cultural scene.
edinburgh uk.highlights: Dramatic skyline dominated by Edinburgh Castle on an ancient volcanic rock. | Characterful contrast between medieval Old Town and Georgian New Town streets. | Easy walks to viewpoints like Arthur’s Seat and Calton Hill. | Rich mix of museums, festivals, theatres and live music venues. | Welcoming pubs and whisky bars perfect after a windy day exploring.
edinburgh uk.bonus: Join an evening walking tour through the closes off the Royal Mile to hear eerie stories that bring the city’s darker history to life.

valletta malta.desc: Laid out on a narrow peninsula between two harbours, Valletta is Malta’s compact, golden-stone capital and a UNESCO World Heritage city. You stroll past baroque facades and colourful balconies, duck into cool churches like St John’s Co-Cathedral and pause on the bastion walls to watch ferries crossing the water. Cafés, wine bars and small museums are never far away, and most sights are reachable on foot in minutes. Valletta is a great base if you like dense, walkable cities with big views and Mediterranean light.
valletta malta.highlights: Tiny hilltop capital with honey-coloured streets and fortified ramparts. | UNESCO-listed baroque architecture shaped by the Knights of St John. | Panoramic views over Grand Harbour and the Three Cities from the Upper Barrakka Gardens. | Easy day trips by ferry or bus to nearby towns, beaches and historic sites. | Plenty of cafés, restaurants and wine bars packed into a very small area.
valletta malta.bonus: Time your visit to the Upper Barrakka Gardens for the midday cannon salute, then stay a little longer to enjoy the sweeping harbour views in relative calm.

carmel by the sea usa.desc: Carmel-by-the-Sea, on California’s central coast, feels like a storybook village tucked beside a wide, pale-sand beach. You wander past ivy-covered cottages, art galleries and wine-tasting rooms, then follow Ocean Avenue down to the cypress-lined shore to watch surfers and dogs playing in the waves. Scenic drives like Highway 1, 17-Mile Drive and the trails of Point Lobos are just minutes away. Carmel suits you if you imagine slow mornings in cafés, golden sunsets over the Pacific and days that alternate between boutiques and coastal walks.
carmel by the sea usa.highlights: Compact, walkable village with fairytale cottages, galleries and independent boutiques. | Wide white-sand beach backed by cypress trees and gentle Pacific waves. | Easy access to Highway 1, 17-Mile Drive and nearby Big Sur viewpoints. | Excellent food and wine scene with tasting rooms and intimate restaurants. | Relaxed, dog-friendly atmosphere that makes even short stays feel like a proper escape.
carmel by the sea usa.bonus: Walk the Scenic Road path at dusk from Carmel Beach towards Carmel River State Beach to see the coastline glow in soft pastel colours.

maldives.desc: Scattered across the Indian Ocean like emeralds on turquoise water, the Maldives are a chain of coral atolls where each island feels like its own tiny world. You wake up a few steps from the sea, snorkel above reefs full of colourful fish and then laze on powder-soft sand under leaning palm trees. Many resorts offer overwater villas, sunset cruises and spa rituals that make it easy to slow right down. The Maldives are a dream if you’re craving warm, clear water, barefoot luxury and quiet nights under huge starry skies.
maldives.highlights: Picture-perfect lagoons with shallow, crystal-clear water ideal for swimming and floating. | Abundant house reefs for easy snorkelling straight from the beach or villa. | Choice of overwater bungalows and beachfront villas with direct ocean access. | Strong focus on privacy, wellness and slow, barefoot days. | Excellent destination for honeymoons and special celebrations in tropical surroundings.
maldives.bonus: Book at least one night in an overwater villa so you can slip into the lagoon at sunrise and have the reef almost entirely to yourself.

bora bora french polynesia.desc: Bora Bora, in French Polynesia, is a small volcanic island wrapped in a luminous turquoise lagoon and a ring of tiny motu islets. You wake up above the water in overwater bungalows, step straight into coral gardens alive with rays and reef sharks, and spend your days gliding by canoe, catamaran or paddleboard between sandbars. When the sun falls behind Mount Otemanu and the sky turns pink, the island becomes a dream setting for honeymoons, proposal trips and anyone craving tropical luxury with silence and stars.
bora bora french polynesia.highlights: Iconic turquoise lagoon ideal for swimming, snorkelling and gentle paddleboarding. | Overwater bungalows with direct ladder access to warm, clear water. | Romantic sunset cruises and private dinners facing dramatic Mount Otemanu. | Easy lagoon tours to coral gardens, stingrays and reef sharks with guides.
bora bora french polynesia.bonus: Treat yourself to a guided snorkelling trip ending with a picnic on a tiny motu, with only the lagoon, palm trees and quiet around you.

tahiti french polynesia.desc: Tahiti, the main island of French Polynesia, mixes everyday island life with wild tropical scenery, from Papeete’s harbourfront and markets to misty mountains in the interior. You can drive the coastal road between black-sand beaches, surf breaks and small villages, stopping to swim under waterfalls, visit botanical gardens or taste fresh poisson cru at a roadside stand. It’s an easy base if you like combining culture, food and local nightlife with day trips on the lagoon or ferry hops to nearby Moorea.
tahiti french polynesia.highlights: Black-sand beaches and surf spots within easy reach of the island’s ring road. | Lively Papeete waterfront with roulotte food trucks, markets and local music. | Day trips to waterfalls, lava tubes and lush valleys in the interior. | Simple guesthouses to upscale resorts, giving options for many budgets.
tahiti french polynesia.bonus: Spend an evening at the waterfront roulottes in Papeete, tasting grilled fish and crêpes while locals gather, chat and play live music.

saint lucia.desc: Saint Lucia, in the eastern Caribbean, is an island where jungle‑covered mountains drop straight into sheltered bays of dark volcanic sand. From the twin Pitons rising behind Soufrière to hot springs, cocoa plantations and small fishing villages, the landscapes change quickly as you move around the coast. You can spend mornings hiking through rainforest or soaking in mud baths and afternoons sailing, snorkelling or simply watching the light fade over the bay from a hillside infinity pool.
saint lucia.highlights: Dramatic Pitons peaks towering above beaches and bays around Soufrière. | Natural hot springs and mud baths at Sulphur Springs near the drive-in volcano. | Rainforest hikes with birdlife, waterfalls and canopy zip-lines. | Romantic boutique resorts and villas ideal for honeymoons and anniversaries.
saint lucia.bonus: Book a sunset cruise that glides just below the Pitons, toasting with rum punch as the mountains slowly turn deep purple against the sky.

kaua i usa.desc: Kaua‘i, the “Garden Isle” of Hawaii, feels wilder and slower than the larger islands, with emerald cliffs, deep valleys and quiet one‑street towns. Along the Nā Pali Coast and Waimea Canyon you find hiking trails, lookout points and boat tours that reveal sheer sea cliffs, waterfalls and rust‑red ridges dropping to the ocean. Between adventures you can unwind on sandy bays like Hanalei or Poipu, watch sea turtles from shore and end the day with a simple plate lunch at a local spot.
kaua i usa.highlights: Na Pali Coast hikes and boat tours with towering sea cliffs and waterfalls. | Waimea Canyon viewpoints offering wide, colourful views over deep valleys. | Laid‑back small towns like Hanalei and Kapa‘a with cafés and food trucks. | Beaches for families, surfers and snorkellers, from Poipu’s calm coves to wilder north shore.
kaua i usa.bonus: Take a helicopter flight over Nā Pali and Waimea Canyon for sweeping views of cliffs, waterfalls and hidden valleys unreachable by road.

whitsundays australia.desc: The Whitsundays, off the coast of Queensland, are a scatter of green islands set in the turquoise waters between the mainland and the Great Barrier Reef. From Airlie Beach or Hamilton Island you can sail past secluded coves, drop anchor off Whitehaven Beach with its pure silica sand, or join reef trips to snorkel above colourful coral and tropical fish. The relaxed atmosphere, mild winters and mix of backpacker boats, day cruises and luxury catamarans make it easy to find a style of trip that fits you.
whitsundays australia.highlights: Easy access to Whitehaven Beach, often listed among the world’s best beaches. | Day cruises and overnight sailing trips through calm, island‑sheltered waters. | Snorkelling and diving on Great Barrier Reef coral gardens rich in marine life. | Choice of bases from lively Airlie Beach to resort-style Hamilton Island.
whitsundays australia.bonus: Book a scenic flight over Heart Reef and Hill Inlet to see Whitehaven’s bright sand and turquoise water forming swirling patterns below you.

phu quoc vietnam.desc: Phu Quoc is a lush Vietnamese island in the Gulf of Thailand, where coconut palms lean over long ribbons of pale sand and incredibly clear water. You spend your days hopping between bays like Sao Beach and Starfish Beach, snorkeling above coral gardens or drifting on a boat past tiny islets and floating villages. Inland, trails cross Phu Quoc National Park’s jungle, pepper farms and waterfalls, while the night market fills the air with grilling seafood and spices. It’s an easygoing escape if you want tropical scenery without losing good comforts and a touch of local life.
phu quoc vietnam.highlights: Long, gently sloping beaches with calm, swimmable water. | Excellent snorkeling and island-hopping boat trips. | Green interior with trails, viewpoints and waterfalls. | Relaxed night market for fresh seafood and street food.
phu quoc vietnam.bonus: Take a small boat to Starfish Beach at low tide and wade among bright orange starfish in shallow turquoise water.

punta mita mexico.desc: On a small peninsula along Mexico’s Riviera Nayarit, Punta Mita mixes wild Pacific coastline with ultra-relaxed, upscale beach life. You wake up to views of quiet coves and long surf breaks, spend the day between infinity pools, golden sand and boat trips towards the Marietas Islands. Golfers find world-class courses with ocean holes, while food lovers wander between beach clubs and creative Mexican restaurants in the nearby village. With plenty of sunshine, gentle evenings and discreet, high-end service, it’s ideal if you want a polished sea escape that still feels laid-back and close to nature.
punta mita mexico.highlights: Secluded peninsula with calm coves and open Pacific surf. | Luxury resorts and villas with direct beach access. | Boat excursions to the Marietas Islands and Hidden Beach. | Seasonal whale watching, surfing and paddleboarding opportunities.
punta mita mexico.bonus: Time a boat trip to the Marietas Islands for sunrise or sunset and you may spot whales framed by the silhouette of the peninsula.

bay of islands new zealand.desc: In Northland, at the top of New Zealand’s North Island, the Bay of Islands is a subtropical pocket of calm bays, emerald hills and 144 small islands. You can base yourself in Paihia or Russell, join a cruise to spot dolphins and sail through sandstone arches, or simply ferry-hop between beaches and short coastal walks. Inland, waterfalls and the Waitangi Treaty Grounds add a sense of history to all that sea and sky, while evenings feel relaxed and low-key. It’s a great choice if you love being on the water and want scenery that feels wild but very easy to explore.
bay of islands new zealand.highlights: Subtropical climate with sheltered bays and clear, swimmable water. | Boat trips to 144 islands, dolphin watching and sailing. | Historic towns like Russell and Waitangi Treaty Grounds to visit. | Short coastal hikes and waterfalls for easy nature days.
bay of islands new zealand.bonus: Spend a night on an overnight cruise and wake up at anchor in a quiet bay with sunrise lighting dozens of islands around you.

boracay philippines.desc: Boracay is a tiny Philippine island famous for White Beach, a four-kilometre curve of almost powder-soft sand washed by shallow turquoise water. By day you can swim, paddle or join an island-hopping tour, and if you prefer something windier there’s kitesurfing and watersports on Bulabog Beach on the other side of the island. Towards sunset, beach bars light up, sailing boats cross the horizon and the promenade fills with music, street food and families strolling. With quieter corners like Puka Beach still easy to reach, Boracay works whether you want a lively holiday or simply postcard-perfect sea with a bit of buzz.
boracay philippines.highlights: Famous White Beach with fine sand and gentle, warm water. | Island-hopping, snorkeling and diving trips straight from the shore. | Kitesurfing and watersports on windier Bulabog Beach. | Sunset sailing, beach bars and a lively but walkable nightlife scene.
boracay philippines.bonus: Book a sunset paraw sailing trip from White Beach and watch the sky turn orange and pink with only the sound of the wind in the sails.

abu dhabi uae.desc: Abu Dhabi, capital of the United Arab Emirates, feels calmer than Dubai yet just as impressive, with a skyline of glass towers opening onto long sandy beaches. Your days can move from the white marble of Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque to the galleries of Louvre Abu Dhabi, then out to the laid-back resorts on Saadiyat Island or the family-friendly Corniche promenade. Theme parks on Yas Island keep thrill-seekers busy, while nearby desert dunes invite sunset drives and stargazing. With modern hotels, good public spaces and a warm, relaxed pace, it suits travellers who want Middle Eastern culture, beach time and comfort in one city stop.
abu dhabi uae.highlights: Striking Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque with intricate marble and chandeliers. | World-class museums and beaches on Saadiyat Island and along the Corniche. | Theme parks and attractions on Yas Island for families and thrill-seekers. | Easy day trips into the surrounding desert for dunes, sunsets and stars.
abu dhabi uae.bonus: Visit the mosque in the late afternoon, then head to the Corniche to watch the city lights switch on as the sky turns deep blue.

tenerife spain.desc: Set in the Atlantic off the coast of Africa, Tenerife blends laid‑back beach life with dramatic volcanic scenery. In one day you can ride a cable car up Mount Teide’s lunar slopes, hike through misty laurel forests in Anaga or follow coastal paths above black‑sand coves and golden resort beaches. Ocean breezes keep the climate pleasantly mild all year, with calm bays for families and surfier spots for the adventurous. Choose Tenerife when you want winter sun, varied landscapes and plenty of activities without giving up comfort.
tenerife spain.highlights: Year‑round mild climate ideal for escaping winter without long‑haul jet lag. | Mix of black‑sand coves, golden beaches and lively seaside promenades. | Teide National Park’s volcanic scenery, hiking trails and memorable cable‑car views. | Anaga and Teno parks for cloud forests, cliff paths and quiet villages. | Frequent boat tours to spot resident whales and playful dolphins close by.
tenerife spain.bonus: At sunset, drive up to a Teide viewpoint and watch the clouds glow beneath you, then stay to stargaze under Tenerife’s famously clear skies.

goa india.desc: On India’s west coast, Goa combines palm‑lined beaches with a surprising mix of Portuguese heritage and laid‑back tropical life. You can spend the day between lively sands in the north, quieter crescents in the south, colourful markets and whitewashed churches in Old Goa. Evenings bring beach shacks grilling fresh fish, music drifting from bars and sunsets that slide into the Arabian Sea. Goa suits you if you want warm weather, relaxed vibes and the freedom to choose between party nights, yoga mornings or pure, sandy idleness.
goa india.highlights: Long coastline with both busy party beaches and peaceful coves for downtime. | Blend of Indian temples, baroque churches and colourful Portuguese‑style neighbourhoods. | Affordable beach shacks, homestays and resorts with excellent seafood and curries. | Options for yoga, wellness retreats and sunrise meditation by the sea. | Day trips to spice plantations, waterfalls and wildlife sanctuaries inland.
goa india.bonus: Take a scooter into the hinterland, combining a visit to a spice plantation with a stop in Fontainhas, the old Latin Quarter painted in bright pastels.

key west usa.desc: At the very end of the Florida Keys, Key West feels like a colourful village floating between the Gulf of Mexico and the Atlantic. Pastel conch houses, swaying palms and chickens in the streets set a quirky, relaxed tone as you wander between cozy cafés, historic sights and small city beaches. Days are for snorkeling trips to the reef, bike rides through Old Town and lazy hours in a hammock. When the sun drops at Mallory Square and music spills out of Duval Street bars, you understand why people keep coming back.
key west usa.highlights: Southernmost city in the continental US with an easy, walkable Old Town. | Signature sunset celebration every evening on Mallory Square’s lively waterfront. | Snorkeling and boat tours to nearby coral reefs with clear, shallow water. | Duval Street’s mix of bars, live music, galleries and iconic landmarks. | Island vibe that feels tropical yet keeps US‑style comfort and services.
key west usa.bonus: Arrive early at Mallory Square, pick a spot by the water and watch street performers, sailboats and a blazing sunset all play out in front of you.

puerto vallarta mexico.desc: On Mexico’s Pacific coast, Puerto Vallarta sits between jungle‑covered Sierra Madre hills and the wide Bahía de Banderas. Cobblestone streets, bougainvillea‑draped balconies and the crown of Our Lady of Guadalupe church give the old town a charming, lived‑in feel, while the Malecón boardwalk buzzes with sculptures, street food and ocean views. You can spend mornings on city beaches or nearby coves, then head out by boat to spot whales in season or snorkel around rocky islets. It’s a great choice if you want a mix of Mexican culture, resort comfort and easy access to nature.
puerto vallarta mexico.highlights: Scenic Malecón promenade lined with art, bars, street performers and sea views. | Romantic Zone’s narrow streets, cafés and LGBTQ‑friendly nightlife close to the beach. | Choice of city beaches or quieter coves south of town like Mismaloya. | Boat excursions across Bahía de Banderas for snorkeling, hidden beaches and whales. | Jungle and Sierra Madre foothills nearby for zip‑lining, hiking and village visits.
puerto vallarta mexico.bonus: Walk the Malecón at dusk, stopping for a taco al pastor and a margarita before watching the sun sink behind the bay’s silhouettes of Los Arcos.

koh phi phi thailand.desc: Off Thailand’s Andaman coast, the Phi Phi Islands are a compact cluster of limestone peaks rising from turquoise water. Longtail boats shuttle you between sandy coves, sheer cliffs and hidden lagoons where the sea glows almost neon. By day you can snorkel over coral gardens, swim in sheltered bays like Pileh Lagoon or hike to a viewpoint above the main village on Phi Phi Don. Nights range from quiet dinners on the beach to fire shows and bars with your feet still in the sand, so you can tune the island’s energy to your own.
koh phi phi thailand.highlights: Dramatic karst scenery with cliffs, caves and small beaches in a very small area. | Boat trips to Maya Bay, Pileh Lagoon and Bamboo Island with time to swim. | Clear, warm water ideal for easy snorkeling among fish and colourful corals. | Choice between lively village area and calmer stretches like Long Beach. | Many day tours from Phuket or Krabi if you prefer to stay on the mainland.
koh phi phi thailand.bonus: Join a late‑afternoon longtail tour that stays out after sunset, so you can snorkel with bioluminescent plankton glowing around you in the dark water.

durban south africa.desc: Durban is South Africa’s laid‑back ocean city, stretching along the warm Indian Ocean on the KwaZulu‑Natal coast. Stroll the Golden Mile promenade between wide sandy beaches, surf breaks and family‑friendly pools, with subtropical sunshine that invites you outside in every season. Away from the seafront you discover markets scented with spices, street food influenced by the city’s large Indian community and neighbourhoods where Zulu and contemporary cultures mix. It’s a great choice if you want easy beach time combined with relaxed urban energy.
durban south africa.highlights: Year‑round warm Indian Ocean water along Durban’s famous Golden Mile beachfront. | Long promenade ideal for walks, cycling, sunrise runs and people‑watching. | Indian‑influenced street food, curries and markets offering budget‑friendly local flavors. | Good base for day trips to Drakensberg foothills and nearby nature reserves.
durban south africa.bonus: Time your evening for a stroll along the Golden Mile, pausing to watch surfers and fishermen as the sky turns pink over the Indian Ocean.

salvador brazil.desc: Salvador de Bahia, on Brazil’s northeastern coast, feels like a sun‑drenched mix of colonial charm and Afro‑Brazilian soul. In the hilltop streets of Pelourinho, a UNESCO‑listed historic centre, you wander between colourful churches, cobbled squares and drum rhythms echoing from capoeira circles. Down by the waterfront, calm city beaches and bayside promenades invite you to swim, sip coconut water and watch the light fade over Todos os Santos Bay. Choose this city if you’re drawn to music, heritage and tropical seaside life all in the same place.
salvador brazil.highlights: UNESCO‑listed Pelourinho with pastel‑coloured houses, baroque churches and live music at night. | City beaches like Porto da Barra with usually gentle waves and golden sunsets. | Rich Afro‑Brazilian culture, from capoeira shows to percussion‑driven street music. | Distinctive Bahian cuisine with seafood stews and street snacks served fresh and affordable.
salvador brazil.bonus: Ride the Elevador Lacerda at dusk and watch Salvador’s upper city light up above the immense Bay of All Saints.

sydney australia.desc: Sydney is a bright, harbor‑side metropolis on Australia’s east coast, where skyscrapers meet sailboats and surf. From Circular Quay you can walk between the Sydney Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and the Royal Botanic Garden, or hop on a ferry to glide past coves, islands and waterfront neighbourhoods. A short ride brings you to ocean beaches like Bondi or Manly, with coastal walks, rock pools and cafés overlooking the waves. It suits travellers who love big‑city culture but want sand, sea and green spaces always within easy reach.
sydney australia.highlights: Iconic harbour with Opera House, Harbour Bridge and easy ferry connections to many bays. | City beaches such as Bondi and Manly for swimming, surfing and relaxed seaside cafés. | Scenic coastal walks with ocean views, like the clifftop path between Bondi and Coogee. | Lively food and café scene reflecting Sydney’s multicultural mix and love of good coffee.
sydney australia.bonus: Take an evening ferry from Circular Quay to Manly to watch the skyline glow behind the Opera House as the harbour lights come on.

muscat oman.desc: Muscat, the capital of Oman, lies between rugged Hajar Mountains and the calm blue of the Gulf of Oman. Along the Muttrah corniche you stroll past whitewashed houses, mosques and fishing boats, with sea breezes softening the heat, especially from October to April. Duck into the covered Muttrah Souq to bargain for incense, textiles and silver, then continue to hilltop forts and quiet city beaches like Shatti Al Qurum. Muscat is ideal if you prefer an authentic, low‑rise seaside city with easy access to both sea and desert landscapes.
muscat oman.highlights: Scenic waterfront corniche in Muttrah, perfect for evening walks with sea and mountain views. | Atmospheric Muttrah Souq selling spices, frankincense, textiles and traditional handicrafts. | Calm city beaches and coves where you can swim or join a simple boat trip. | Day‑trip options to wadis, desert dunes and mountain villages only a short drive away.
muscat oman.bonus: Climb up to Muttrah Fort late afternoon to watch the sun sink behind the mountains as the harbour and corniche lights slowly switch on below.

st moritz switzerland.desc: St. Moritz sits high in Switzerland’s Engadin valley, a glamorous alpine resort surrounded by bright white peaks and a glittering frozen lake in winter. Here you ski wide, well‑groomed pistes that have hosted World Championships and Winter Olympics, then finish the day with long views over sun‑drenched slopes from a mountain terrace. Off the snow you can try winter walking, toboggan runs, spa rituals or simply watch the scene around the lake, where horses and polo matches sometimes take over the ice. Come when you dream of serious snow, big mountain scenery and a touch of classic Swiss luxury.
st moritz switzerland.highlights: Extensive ski area with World Cup‑level runs and sunny slopes for many skill levels. | Frequent winter sunshine and crisp alpine air in the high Engadin valley. | Frozen Lake St. Moritz hosting ice sports, horse races and atmospheric walks. | Elegant hotels, gourmet restaurants and stylish après‑ski terraces with panoramic views.
st moritz switzerland.bonus: Try an early‑morning ride on the funicular up to Corviglia to carve freshly groomed slopes while the sun slowly lights the Engadin peaks.

val d is re france.desc: Val d'Isère, high in the French Alps near the Italian border, feels like a proper mountain village wrapped in 3,000‑metre peaks and snow‑sure slopes. You ski straight from stone‑and‑wood chalets into the vast Tignes–Val d'Isère area, with everything from gentle beginner runs to legendary off‑piste faces. Lifts are fast, the snow is reliable thanks to the altitude, and the après‑ski swings from cosy wine bars to live‑music terraces. It’s a dream if you love long ski days, good food and a festive alpine vibe.
val d is re france.highlights: Snow-sure ski area with 300 km of varied pistes at high altitude. | Slopes for every level, from relaxed greens to steep challenge runs. | Lively après-ski, from gourmet restaurants to relaxed pubs and wine bars. | Charming alpine village with traditional chalets and easy ski-in/ski-out stays.
val d is re france.bonus: Set your alarm for first tracks on La Face de Bellevarde, with empty corduroy and sunrise colouring the surrounding peaks just for you.

cortina d ampezzo italy.desc: Set in the heart of the Dolomites, Cortina d'Ampezzo mixes dramatic rock towers with elegant streets, boutiques and historic cafés. You carve wide slopes between pink-tinged cliffs and quiet larch forests, then swap ski boots for aperitivo along Corso Italia. The ski area suits both relaxed cruisers and experienced skiers who love steep couloirs and long panoramic runs. It’s ideal if you dream of combining serious skiing with Italian style, great food and a glamorous yet laid-back mountain atmosphere.
cortina d ampezzo italy.highlights: UNESCO-listed Dolomites scenery with jagged peaks glowing pink at sunset. | Varied pistes and off-piste options for confident skiers and adventurous riders. | Chic town centre with designer shops, historic cafés and refined Italian dining. | Easy day trips to nearby Dolomite passes for scenic ski safaris.
cortina d ampezzo italy.bonus: Book a clear evening for dinner in a mountain rifugio, watching the Dolomites turn pink then deep blue above the twinkling lights of Cortina.

aspen usa.desc: In the Colorado Rockies, Aspen combines serious skiing with a small‑town, big‑personality vibe. One lift pass opens up four different mountains, from mellow groomers and terrain parks to steep bowls and hidden tree runs. Off the slopes you wander Victorian streets filled with cosy cafés, galleries and buzzing après‑ski spots that feel more like a city than a village. It’s perfect if you want North American snow, playful terrain and a social scene where long lunches and live music are part of every ski day.
aspen usa.highlights: Four distinct mountains offering everything from gentle cruisers to challenging expert terrain. | Reliable Colorado snow with long seasons and plenty of blue-sky powder days. | Characterful town with Victorian architecture, galleries and lively après-ski bars. | Excellent dining, from relaxed burger joints to refined farm-to-table restaurants.
aspen usa.bonus: Finish your day with a last run on Aspen Mountain, then glide straight into town for après on a sun deck facing the glowing Rockies.

revelstoke canada.desc: Revelstoke, in British Columbia’s Selkirk Mountains, is all about big vertical, deep snow and a laid‑back Canadian town at the base. From the valley floor you climb almost 1,800 metres in one go, linking long groomers with vast alpine bowls and perfectly spaced glades. The terrain suits confident skiers and riders who enjoy leg‑burning descents and playful off‑piste rather than gentle cruising. Between storms you can soak in the scenery along the Columbia River and swap powder stories over craft beer in low‑key local bars.
revelstoke canada.highlights: North America’s biggest vertical drop for long, satisfying top-to-bottom runs. | Wide alpine bowls and tree-lined glades ideal for advanced and expert skiers. | Consistently deep snowfall creating soft landings and true big-mountain sensations. | Authentic mountain town vibe with friendly locals, breweries and relaxed eateries.
revelstoke canada.bonus: Treat yourself to a guided day that links in-resort steeps with nearby heli-ski or backcountry zones, turning Revelstoke into one unforgettable, all‑day vertical adventure.

niseko japan.desc: On Japan’s northern island of Hokkaido, Niseko is famous for bottomless, feather‑light powder and a relaxed, international atmosphere. Several interconnected resorts spread across Mount Annupuri, offering mellow tree runs, playful sidecountry and groomed pistes that refill with fresh snow again and again. After skiing you soak in steaming outdoor onsens while snowflakes fall around you, then wander villages filled with izakaya, ramen joints and stylish bars. It’s ideal if you dream of combining world‑class powder days with Japanese culture, hot springs and an easygoing nightlife.
niseko japan.highlights: Exceptionally deep, light powder snow falling throughout most of the winter. | Four linked resorts on Mount Annupuri with varied pistes and sidecountry lines. | Natural hot-spring onsens where you can soak outdoors while it snows. | Welcoming international vibe with English-friendly services, bars and diverse dining.
niseko japan.bonus: Book a night-skiing session under the floodlights, carving fresh powder as Hirafu’s lights sparkle below and the shadow of Mount Yotei rises beyond the slopes.

kitzb hel austria.desc: Kitzbühel, Austria, combines a storybook medieval town with one of the most legendary ski areas in the Alps. Its cobbled, mostly car‑free centre sits beneath the Hahnenkamm and Kitzbüheler Horn, where long pistes and modern lifts keep beginners and experts busy all winter. Between famous race runs, cosy mountain huts and relaxed evenings in wine bars and spas, you enjoy a classic Tyrolean atmosphere that feels both traditional and stylish, ideal if you like mixing serious skiing with slow strolls past colourful houses.
kitzb hel austria.highlights: Medieval, largely car‑free old town with colourful Tyrolean houses and boutiques. | Extensive ski area with varied pistes, from gentle slopes to iconic race runs. | Modern lift network and snowmaking that help keep the season long and reliable. | Cosy huts, wine bars and wellness centres for unhurried, atmospheric après‑ski.
kitzb hel austria.bonus: Walk beside the legendary Hahnenkamm racecourse and, in January, feel the electric World Cup buzz right next to the Streif.

courchevel france.desc: Courchevel, in the French Alps, stretches across several villages that all plug straight into the vast Three Valleys ski area. Perfectly groomed pistes fan out in every direction, from sheltered forest runs for learners to broad, high‑altitude slopes and fast links towards Méribel and Val Thorens. Off the snow you can browse designer boutiques, soak in hotel spas and linger over French cuisine, making this an easy choice if you want long ski days combined with glamorous, effortless evenings.
courchevel france.highlights: Direct access to the Three Valleys, one of the world’s largest ski domains. | Mixture of gentle beginner zones, cruising blues and demanding red and black runs. | High standard of accommodation, from stylish residences to ultra‑luxury hotels and chalets. | Lively villages with spas, ice rinks, shopping streets and excellent French restaurants.
courchevel france.bonus: Book a dawn hot‑air‑balloon or helicopter flight for unforgettable views over the snow‑covered Three Valleys peaks.

verbier switzerland.desc: Verbier, Switzerland, mixes serious high‑mountain terrain with a relaxed yet polished village atmosphere. From its sunny, south‑facing slopes you drop into the vast 4 Vallées area, with long pistes, itineraries and legendary freeride routes that attract skiers and snowboarders from all over the world. Back in the resort, chalet‑style streets hide lively bars, stylish restaurants and cosy corners, so your days can swing from big‑mountain adventure to evenings of fondue, music and Swiss wine with friends.
verbier switzerland.highlights: Direct access to the 4 Vallées, with extensive pistes and off‑piste itineraries. | South‑facing slopes offering long runs and wide‑open Alpine panoramas. | Energetic après‑ski scene with bars, live music, clubs and late‑night venues. | Many guiding options and ski schools to help you explore freeride terrain safely.
verbier switzerland.bonus: Ride up to Mont Fort on a clear day for sunrise or sunset views that stretch towards Mont Blanc and the Matterhorn.

bansko bulgaria.desc: Bansko, Bulgaria, sits where a modern ski area meets a characterful old town at the foot of the Pirin Mountains. You’ll find long groomed runs, tree‑lined slopes and snow parks served by a contemporary lift system, while down in the valley cobbled streets, stone houses and churches give the centre a distinctly traditional feel. Evenings are for mehanas – rustic taverns with grills, live music and local wine – making this a great‑value base if you want to mix reliable snow with plenty of local flavour.
bansko bulgaria.highlights: Modern ski area with varied pistes for beginners, intermediates and confident skiers. | Location beside Pirin National Park, a UNESCO‑listed landscape of peaks and forests. | Atmospheric old town with cobbled lanes, historic houses and Orthodox churches. | Excellent value for money on accommodation, lift passes, lessons and eating out.
bansko bulgaria.bonus: Keep one afternoon free to wander the old town, ducking into mehanas for hearty Bulgarian dishes, folk music and generous glasses of red wine.

las vegas usa.desc: Las Vegas, Nevada, is a desert city that rarely seems to switch off, with the Strip glowing all night in neon, fountains and giant screens. You can hop between themed casinos, headline concerts, Cirque du Soleil shows and celebrity‑chef restaurants, or slow the pace with a few sunny hours by the pool. When you’re ready for a change of scenery, day trips to Red Rock Canyon, the Hoover Dam or even the Grand Canyon reveal vast desert landscapes that contrast sharply with the city’s bright excess.
las vegas usa.highlights: Iconic Strip lined with casinos, shows, rooftop bars and spectacular light displays. | Huge choice of restaurants, from casual diners and buffets to tasting menus by star chefs. | Entertainment for every mood: concerts, magic shows, clubs, museums and immersive art. | Easy access to desert adventures in Red Rock Canyon, Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon.
las vegas usa.bonus: Take a sunset helicopter flight above the Strip and out toward the Grand Canyon, toasting the desert from an unforgettable viewpoint.

mykonos greece.desc: Mykonos, Greece, is a Cycladic island where whitewashed alleys tumble down to turquoise bays and a famously hedonistic nightlife. By day you move between golden-sand beaches, choosing between calm coves, family-friendly bays and legendary party shores where DJs start as the sun goes down. Evenings mean getting lost in the lanes of Mykonos Town, under the old windmills and beside the sea in Little Venice, lingering over mezze and cocktails. Friends and couples come here for long beach days followed by nights that feel like a never-ending summer party.
mykonos greece.highlights: Wide choice of beaches, from chilled family coves to world-famous party sands. | Photogenic Mykonos Town with cube-shaped houses, blue shutters and iconic windmills. | Lively bars and beach clubs with international DJs during the long summer season. | Easy boat trips to sacred Delos island for ruins, mythology and sea views.
mykonos greece.bonus: Sneak away to the inland village of Ano Mera, where quiet tavernas and a small monastery show you Mykonos beyond the party scene.

new orleans usa.desc: New Orleans, Louisiana, is a soulful river city where jazz spills from doorways and wrought-iron balconies overlook cobbled streets. Spend your days wandering the French Quarter and neighboring districts, tasting beignets, gumbo and po’boys, and admiring colorful Creole townhouses and oak-lined squares. After dark, live bands take over jazz clubs and tiny bars, from Bourbon Street to Frenchmen Street, mixing brass, blues and funk late into the night. Here, music, food and local stories spill into the streets, so every corner feels like part of the experience.
new orleans usa.highlights: Atmospheric French Quarter with wrought-iron balconies, hidden courtyards and street performers by night. | Incredible Creole and Cajun food — from gumbo and jambalaya to po’boys and beignets. | Live jazz, brass bands and blues in intimate clubs and on lively Frenchmen Street. | Distinct neighborhoods like the Garden District and Tremé, each with its own history and vibe.
new orleans usa.bonus: Book a guided evening food-and-music walk that weaves through small jazz bars and local eateries, so you taste the city while the soundtrack plays live.

valencia spain.desc: Valencia, Spain, is a Mediterranean city where a Gothic old town meets daring futuristic architecture and long urban beaches. You might start your day between cathedral spires, market stalls and tiled plazas, then follow the green ribbon of the Turia Gardens down to the gleaming City of Arts and Sciences. Afternoons invite a swim at La Malvarrosa or a bike ride along the seafront before sitting down to authentic paella in the region where it was born. Expect a relaxed, sunlit rhythm that lets you switch easily between culture, good food and the sea.
valencia spain.highlights: Compact historic centre with cathedral, silk exchange and lively local markets. | Striking City of Arts and Sciences beside the green park in the old riverbed. | Wide, sandy Mediterranean beaches like La Malvarrosa within easy reach of the centre. | Birthplace of paella, with countless spots to taste the classic rice dish by the sea.
valencia spain.bonus: Rent a bike and follow the Turia Gardens from the old town to the City of Arts and Sciences at sunset for effortlessly beautiful views.

medell n colombia.desc: Medellín, Colombia, spreads along a green valley in the Andes at a mild “eternal spring” altitude that keeps temperatures comfortable all year. Sleek metro lines and cable cars climb the hillsides, linking leafy parks, lookout points and once-isolated barrios now known for colorful street art and community projects. In the flat valley floor you’ll find lively districts like El Poblado and Laureles, filled with cafés, rooftop bars and creative restaurants, plus museums and plazas that tell the city’s complex story. Few cities combine urban buzz, green mountain views and visible social change as clearly as Medellín.
medell n colombia.highlights: Pleasant year-round climate around 1,500 metres, earning Medellín its “city of eternal spring” nickname. | Modern metro and Metrocable system connecting valley neighbourhoods with panoramic hillside viewpoints. | Street art, escalators and community tours in areas like Comuna 13 that showcase urban transformation. | Trendy districts such as El Poblado and Laureles with cafés, nightlife and inventive Colombian cuisine.
medell n colombia.bonus: Ride the Metrocable up to Parque Arví early to watch Medellín spread beneath you, then follow quiet forest trails in the fresh mountain air.

punta del este uruguay.desc: Punta del Este, Uruguay, curves out into the Atlantic on a narrow peninsula where calm bays and surf beaches meet a skyline of high-rises and palm-lined promenades. Along Playa Mansa the water stays gentle and family-friendly, while Playa Brava faces the open ocean, with rolling waves and the famous “Hand” sculpture rising from the sand. Summer brings beach clubs, stylish restaurants and long nights around the marina, but quieter months reveal a slower, seaside-town rhythm for walks and sunsets. The result is a South American beach escape with soft sand, a little glamour and enough going on that you never have to just lie still.
punta del este uruguay.highlights: Two distinct coasts: sheltered Playa Mansa for families and wave-washed Playa Brava for surfers. | Iconic “Hand” sculpture emerging from the sand, a must-see Punta del Este landmark. | Mix of chic beach clubs, art galleries and good seafood restaurants around the marina. | Option to visit in shoulder season for quieter walks, sunsets and more relaxed prices.
punta del este uruguay.bonus: Head to nearby Punta Ballena and Casapueblo at sunset to watch the Atlantic glow orange from clifftop terraces high above the water.

ho chi minh city vietnam.desc: Ho Chi Minh City, in southern Vietnam, is a fast-paced metropolis where scooters, neon lights and colonial boulevards all jostle for your attention. Wander between steaming street-food stalls, tree-lined Nguyen Hue Walking Street and the French-era Notre-Dame Cathedral and Central Post Office, then dive into history at the War Remnants Museum. Between tropical downpours the air stays warm, so you can sip iced coffee on hidden rooftop terraces and browse Ben Thanh Market late into the evening. It’s an exciting base if you love big-city energy, bold flavours and affordable adventures in Southeast Asia.
ho chi minh city vietnam.highlights: Buzzing mix of markets, cafés and rooftop bars open from morning to late. | Street food stalls serve fragrant pho, banh mi and fresh tropical fruit everywhere. | Historic sights like the War Remnants Museum and Cu Chi day trips nearby. | Warm climate most of the year, ideal for combining city breaks with excursions.
ho chi minh city vietnam.bonus: Slip into a tiny alley café for slow-drip Vietnamese coffee, then watch the city light up from a rooftop along Nguyen Hue Walking Street.

krak w poland.desc: Krakow, in southern Poland, revolves around a beautifully preserved Old Town crowned by one of Europe’s largest medieval squares and the royal Wawel Castle above the river. You wander past churches and townhouses into leafy Planty Park, then on to Kazimierz, the former Jewish quarter now filled with creative bars, galleries and late-night zapiekanki stalls. In winter the city glows with markets and snow-dusted rooftops; in summer café terraces spill onto the streets. It’s a walkable, atmospheric city break if you enjoy history, culture and long evenings in cosy bars.
krak w poland.highlights: Huge Main Market Square with St. Mary’s Basilica, Cloth Hall and street musicians. | Wawel Castle and Cathedral looking over the Vistula, rich in Polish history. | Bohemian bars and cafés in Kazimierz, the lively former Jewish quarter. | Good value for food, drinks and accommodation compared with many European cities.
krak w poland.bonus: Take an evening stroll along the Vistula embankments to see Wawel Castle glowing above the river and the city lights reflecting in the water.

hvar croatia.desc: Hvar, off the Dalmatian coast of Croatia, combines bright stone alleys, a glamourous harbour and transparent bays that seem made for long summer days. From the palm-lined waterfront you climb up to the hilltop fortress for views over the terracotta roofs and the Pakleni Islands scattered in the Adriatic. During the day you can swim off pebble coves or take a boat to beach clubs and quieter inlets; after dark bars and terraces fill with music. It’s a great choice if you want island scenery with a lively, Mediterranean holiday mood.
hvar croatia.highlights: Sun-drenched island with clear Adriatic water and plenty of swimmable bays. | Hvar Town’s medieval lanes and fortress overlooking the harbour and Pakleni Islands. | Choice of relaxed beach clubs, sunset bars and more exclusive nightspots. | Boat trips to hidden coves, vineyards and nearby islands for varied days out.
hvar croatia.bonus: Stay to watch the sunset from the fortress above Hvar Town, when the sea turns pink and the lights of the Pakleni Islands begin to sparkle.

budapest hungary.desc: Budapest, straddling the Danube in Hungary, feels like two cities in one: hilly Buda with its castle and viewpoints, and flat Pest with grand boulevards and buzzing cafés. You can soak for hours in steaming thermal baths such as Széchenyi or Gellért, then drift past Parliament and chain bridges on an evening river cruise. In the Jewish Quarter, quirky ruin bars fill abandoned courtyards with fairy lights, art and music. Whether you come in winter for hot pools in the cold air or in summer for long nights by the river, it’s a city that mixes elegance with fun.
budapest hungary.highlights: Iconic thermal baths where you can bathe outdoors even on cold days. | Danube riverfront with views of Buda Castle, Parliament and lit-up bridges. | Atmospheric ruin bars in the Jewish Quarter with creative décor and live DJs. | Good public transport and fair prices for a European capital city.
budapest hungary.bonus: Visit Széchenyi Baths after dark in winter, when warm steam rises into the cold night and the yellow Neo-Baroque buildings glow around the pools.

lisbon portugal.desc: Lisbon, spread over a series of hills facing the Tagus River in Portugal, charms you with tile-covered façades, pastel houses and the soft Atlantic light. Tram 28 rattles through Alfama, Graça and Baixa, climbing steep streets that lead to miradouros where you can look out over red roofs and church towers. Down in the alleys of Alfama and Mouraria you’ll hear fado drifting from tiny taverns, while Bairro Alto comes alive with bars and rooftops at night. With mild winters, breezy summers and beaches just outside the city, Lisbon suits travellers who like mixing culture, views and relaxed seaside vibes.
lisbon portugal.highlights: Scenic tram 28 route linking historic neighbourhoods with classic yellow wooden trams. | Viewpoints such as Miradouro da Senhora do Monte and Portas do Sol over Alfama. | Traditional fado houses in Alfama and Mouraria for intimate live music evenings. | Easy access to nearby beaches and day trips to Sintra or Cascais.
lisbon portugal.bonus: Ride tram 28 early in the morning to avoid crowds, then get off at Portas do Sol for a quiet coffee above the tiled rooftops of Alfama.

taipei taiwan.desc: Taipei, Taiwan’s lively capital, combines shimmering skyscrapers with leafy hillsides and incense-filled temples. You can glide on the clean, fast metro from historic neighbourhoods and food-packed night markets to the viewing platform of Taipei 101 and the hiking trails of Elephant Mountain. Street stalls tempt you with steaming dumplings, bubble tea and grilled snacks, while quieter corners like parks or riverside bike paths let you slow the pace. It’s an easy city to navigate, ideal if you love big-city energy with pockets of nature and local life.
taipei taiwan.highlights: Efficient metro and signage make exploring the city stress-free for first-time visitors. | Iconic skyline with Taipei 101 and sunset views from nearby Elephant Mountain trails. | Famous night markets serving affordable street food, desserts and late-night snacks. | Easy access to hot springs, tea houses and green hills on half-day trips around the city.
taipei taiwan.bonus: Don’t miss riding the Maokong Gondola at dusk for tea with sweeping views over the city lights and surrounding mountains.

reykjav k iceland.desc: Reykjavik, Iceland’s colourful seaside capital, feels more like a welcoming town than a big city. From the harbourfront and Hallgrímskirkja church you’re never far from cosy cafés, design shops and steamy geothermal pools where locals soak year-round. In winter you can chase the northern lights on land or by boat, while long summer evenings invite you to stroll the waterfront or join a whale‑watching cruise. Reykjavik works both as a relaxed city break and as a base for adventures to waterfalls, glaciers and the famous Golden Circle.
reykjav k iceland.highlights: Compact, walkable centre with cafés, street art and views from Hallgrímskirkja tower. | Easy access to geothermal pools and designer lagoons for relaxing soaks in any season. | Northern lights and midnight‑sun experiences within reach of the city on guided tours. | Ideal base for day trips to waterfalls, black‑sand beaches and other South Iceland highlights.
reykjav k iceland.bonus: Join an evening cruise from Reykjavik’s Old Harbour to look for northern lights dancing above the bay and distant mountains.

ljubljana slovenia.desc: Ljubljana, Slovenia’s charming riverside capital, feels intimate yet full of life. Pastel facades, elegant bridges and outdoor cafés line the Ljubljanica River, while a medieval castle watches from the hill above. Much of the centre is car‑free, so you can wander between markets, galleries and leafy squares at an easy pace or hop on a river boat to see the city from the water. With its bike paths, green parks and quick train links, Ljubljana is perfect if you enjoy relaxed city breaks with plenty of nature close by.
ljubljana slovenia.highlights: Atmospheric old town with riverside terraces, markets and café culture along the Ljubljanica. | Hilltop Ljubljana Castle offering panoramic views and easy access by funicular or forest paths. | Largely car‑free centre that’s comfortable to explore on foot or by bike. | Excellent base for day trips to Lake Bled, Alpine valleys and Slovenia’s karst caves.
ljubljana slovenia.bonus: Take an evening boat cruise on the Ljubljanica to glide under the city’s iconic bridges as the façades light up and street musicians play.

melbourne australia.desc: Melbourne blends a relaxed bayside setting with one of the most creative urban scenes in Australia. In the city centre you can slip from grand Victorian arcades into narrow laneways filled with ever-changing street art, tiny cafés and independent boutiques. Food markets, rooftop bars and a serious coffee culture keep the days and nights busy, while nearby beaches like St Kilda add a holiday vibe. With easy day trips to the Great Ocean Road or Yarra Valley, Melbourne suits travellers who like culture, cuisine and coastal escapes in one trip.
melbourne australia.highlights: Famous laneways showcasing street art, tiny espresso bars and hidden eateries. | Strong café and dining culture, from food trucks to top‑end restaurants and markets. | Bayside promenades and nearby St Kilda beach for walks, sunsets and casual bike rides. | Convenient starting point for road trips to the Great Ocean Road or Yarra Valley wine region.
melbourne australia.bonus: Join a guided laneway walk that uncovers street‑art alleys, heritage arcades and rooftop bars you’d probably never find on your own.

montreal canada.desc: Montreal mixes North American energy with a distinctly European rhythm. In Old Montreal you’ll wander cobbled streets, stone warehouses and the lively Old Port, while up on Mount Royal the city and St Lawrence River spread out below you. Neighbourhoods like the Plateau and Mile End tempt you with bagel shops, creative bistros and relaxed cafés, and markets brim with Québec flavours in every season. From summer festivals and terrace evenings to snowy streets and twinkling winter markets, Montreal is made for travellers who enjoy culture, food and changing atmospheres.
montreal canada.highlights: Historic Old Montreal and Old Port with cobblestones, river views and heritage architecture. | Panoramic walks and viewpoints in Mount Royal Park right above the downtown core. | Standout food scene, from classic bagels and poutine to creative Québécois cuisine and markets. | Year‑round calendar of festivals, events and winter or holiday celebrations across the city.
montreal canada.bonus: Plan time for Jean‑Talon Market, where you can sample seasonal produce, Québec cheeses and local specialties alongside Montrealers doing their weekly shopping.

tallinn estonia.desc: Tallinn, Estonia’s compact capital on the Baltic Sea, feels like a storybook city with its cobbled lanes, red roofs and sturdy stone towers. Wander between the UNESCO‑listed Old Town and the hilltop quarter of Toompea, where viewpoints like Kohtuotsa open over pastel façades, church spires and the harbor. Down in Town Hall Square you can linger in cafés, discover handicraft shops and, in winter, fairy‑lit Christmas markets. Beyond the medieval walls, creative districts such as Telliskivi and Kalamaja add street art, design stores and relaxed bars, ideal if you enjoy mixing history with a laid‑back city vibe.
tallinn estonia.highlights: Atmospheric UNESCO Old Town with cobbled streets, towers and medieval merchants’ houses. | Panoramic viewpoints from Toompea Hill across rooftops, church spires and the Baltic Sea. | Cosy cafés, craft shops and seasonal markets around historic Town Hall Square. | Trendy Telliskivi and Kalamaja districts with street art, design boutiques and casual dining. | Easy-to-walk city ideal for short breaks and Baltic itineraries.
tallinn estonia.bonus: Climb to Kohtuotsa viewpoint at sunset to watch Tallinn’s rooftops turn gold while ferries glide across the bay and church bells echo below.

chiang rai thailand.desc: Chiang Rai, in the green hills of northern Thailand, is much quieter than big‑city Chiang Mai but full of surreal temples and lush landscapes. Here you can visit Wat Rong Khun, the gleaming White Temple, the sapphire‑blue Wat Rong Suea Ten and the dark, intriguing Black House before ending the day at the lively night bazaar with street food and music. Just outside town, tea plantations and mountain villages offer misty sunrises, trekking trails and viewpoints over the valleys. It’s a great base if you love mixing culture, nature and a slower Thai rhythm.
chiang rai thailand.highlights: Iconic White Temple, Blue Temple and Black House with unique, contemporary Buddhist art. | Relaxed small‑city atmosphere with far fewer crowds than Chiang Mai. | Evening night bazaar for street food, local crafts and live music. | Nearby tea plantations and hilltop viewpoints with cool, misty mornings. | Easy access to mountain trails, waterfalls and villages in northern Thailand.
chiang rai thailand.bonus: Take a dawn trip to a nearby tea plantation, sipping hot oolong as the fog slowly lifts from the emerald hills all around you.

hanoi vietnam.desc: Hanoi, Vietnam’s atmospheric capital, blends tree‑lined boulevards and faded French villas with lively alleyways packed with scooters and steaming street‑food stalls. In the Old Quarter you wander the maze of 36 streets, each once dedicated to a different trade, passing guild houses, tiny cafés and shopfront temples before reaching the calm of Hoan Kiem Lake. Around you rise pagodas, the scholarly Temple of Literature and museums that tell the city’s layered history. With its egg coffee, bia hơi corners and night markets, Hanoi is ideal if you enjoy dense urban energy softened by lakes, parks and everyday rituals.
hanoi vietnam.highlights: Characterful Old Quarter with 36 bustling streets, guild houses and tiny shopfront temples. | Hoan Kiem Lake and shaded parks offering calm breaks from the city’s traffic. | Exceptional street‑food scene with pho, bun cha, banh mi and creamy egg coffee. | Blend of French colonial buildings, traditional pagodas and modern Vietnamese life. | Good base for excursions to surrounding countryside and famous northern landscapes.
hanoi vietnam.bonus: Join locals for an early stroll or tai chi session around Hoan Kiem Lake, then reward yourself with a sweet egg coffee overlooking the water.

copenhagen denmark.desc: Copenhagen, Denmark’s waterside capital, feels bright, bike‑friendly and effortlessly stylish. You pedal along canals and past colorful townhouses in Nyhavn, stop for a cinnamon bun in a cosy café and browse Nordic design stores before ending the day in Tivoli Gardens among lights, rides and live music. Royal palaces, waterfront promenades and modern food halls all sit within easy walking distance, and locals embrace the concept of hygge with candles and good company. It’s an ideal city break if you enjoy culture, gastronomy and exploring largely car‑free streets at a relaxed Scandinavian pace.
copenhagen denmark.highlights: Iconic Nyhavn harbor with 17th‑century townhouses, cafés and boat tours. | Magical Tivoli Gardens amusement park with rides, concerts and seasonal markets. | Extensive cycling paths making it easy and safe to explore by bike. | Strong food scene from smørrebrød and bakeries to creative New Nordic restaurants. | Compact, walkable center with royal palaces, museums and waterfront promenades.
copenhagen denmark.bonus: Visit Tivoli after dark, when thousands of lights and live music turn the park into a fairytale playground in the heart of the city.

lake district uk.desc: The Lake District in northwest England is a landscape of deep lakes, stone walls and rounded green fells that seems made for slow adventures. You can cruise across Windermere, paddle on Derwentwater or follow sheep‑dotted trails up to ridges with sweeping views over valleys and tarns. Villages like Keswick, Ambleside and Grasmere offer cosy pubs, tea rooms and gear shops for when the weather turns. With its mix of gentle lakeside paths, more demanding hikes and atmospheric country houses that inspired poets like Wordsworth, the Lake District is perfect if you love fresh air, big skies and long days outdoors.
lake district uk.highlights: UNESCO‑listed national park with dramatic lakes, rolling fells and classic English countryside. | Boat trips, kayaking and lakeside walks on Windermere, Derwentwater and other scenic waters. | Charming villages such as Keswick, Ambleside and Grasmere with pubs and tearooms. | Wide choice of walking routes, from easy valley strolls to full‑day ridge hikes. | Rich literary heritage linked to Wordsworth and other Romantic poets, plus historic houses and gardens.
lake district uk.bonus: On a clear evening, hike a low fell above Derwentwater to watch the sun sink behind layered hills while the lake slowly turns silver below.

amboise loire valley france.desc: Amboise, in the heart of France’s Loire Valley, feels like a small riverside town built for slow, scenic days. From the Royal Château d’Amboise you look out over the Loire, slate rooftops and vineyards that fade into the horizon. Nearby châteaux such as Chenonceau and Chambord are easy day trips, while quiet lanes invite you to wander between bakeries, wine bars and riverside paths. It’s a gentle base if you want history, countryside and good food without the rush of a big city.
amboise loire valley france.highlights: Charming Loire riverside setting with a walkable historic centre. | Royal château with wide views over the river and rooftops. | Easy day trips to many famous Loire Valley castles. | Cycling, canoeing and riverside walks for relaxed exploration. | Cosy restaurants and wine bars showcasing local Loire wines.
amboise loire valley france.bonus: Climb up to the château terraces at golden hour for wide Loire views that glow in the evening light and feel surprisingly peaceful.

cinque terre italy.desc: Cinque Terre on Italy’s Ligurian coast is a string of five colourful villages clinging to steep cliffs above the sea. Between terraced vineyards and pastel houses you follow coastal paths and old mule tracks with views that change at every turn. Trains and boats glide from village to village, so you can swim in coves, linger over seafood and travel without a car.
