It’s a place for unhurried days outdoors, whether you love hiking, sea swims or sunset aperitivos over the harbour.
cinque terre italy.highlights: Five cliffside villages linked by panoramic coastal hiking trails. | National park scenery with terraces, vineyards and dramatic sea views. | Easy train and boat connections, no need to drive between villages. | Small beaches and rocky coves with clear Ligurian water. | Trattorias serving fresh seafood, pesto and local white wines.
cinque terre italy.bonus: Walk an early-morning section of the coastal trail to enjoy views almost alone before the day’s boats and crowds arrive.

marrakech morocco.desc: Marrakesh in southern Morocco is a city of colour, sound and spice-scented air. Within the old medina you weave through narrow alleys, busy souks and hidden riads with cool inner courtyards. As evening falls, Jemaa el-Fna square fills with storytellers, food stalls and music, while the call to prayer echoes around the Koutoubia Mosque. By day you can escape to gardens, rooftop cafés or take trips toward the Atlas Mountains, making Marrakesh a vibrant base for culture, markets and short adventures.
marrakech morocco.highlights: Lively medina packed with souks, crafts and traditional workshops. | Jemaa el-Fna square with street food, performers and night-time energy. | Atmospheric riads featuring patios, fountains and rooftop terraces. | Easy access to gardens, palm groves and Atlas Mountains excursions. | Rich mix of flavours from tagines to fresh mint tea.
marrakech morocco.bonus: Head to a rooftop terrace at sunset for mint tea as the city lights glow and the Koutoubia’s silhouette stands out against the sky.

bariloche argentina.desc: Bariloche, on the shores of Lake Nahuel Huapi in Argentine Patagonia, feels like an alpine town transported to the end of the world. Snowy peaks, deep-blue lakes and forests surround a centre known for its chocolate shops, breweries and wooden chalets. In winter you ski on nearby Cerro Catedral, while summer and autumn bring hiking, kayaking and scenic drives along the Circuito Chico. With four distinct seasons and plenty of outdoor activities, Bariloche works as well for adventurous trips as for cosy, slow-paced getaways.
bariloche argentina.highlights: Stunning setting on Lake Nahuel Huapi backed by Patagonian peaks. | Year-round outdoor activities: skiing, hiking, biking and kayaking. | Alpine-style centre with chocolate shops, cafés and craft beer. | Classic viewpoints and drives along the Circuito Chico route. | Good base for families, friends or solo travellers exploring Patagonia.
bariloche argentina.bonus: Take the chairlift up Cerro Campanario for one of the most famous panoramas in the region, a 360° view of lakes and mountains.

manuel antonio quepos costa rica.desc: Manuel Antonio and nearby Quepos on Costa Rica’s Pacific coast bring together rainforest, beaches and abundant wildlife in a compact area. Trails in Manuel Antonio National Park lead through dense greenery to viewpoints and sheltered bays, where monkeys, sloths and colourful birds are often easy to spot. Outside the park, Quepos offers restaurants, a marina and tour operators for boat trips, zip-lines or sunset cruises. With warm temperatures most of the year, it’s a great place if you want a few days of nature without going completely off-grid.
manuel antonio quepos costa rica.highlights: Small but famous national park mixing rainforest, beaches and viewpoints. | Frequent wildlife encounters, from monkeys and sloths to iguanas and birds. | Short, well-marked trails suitable for most levels of fitness. | Quepos town with dining options, marina and organised excursions. | Popular stop on Costa Rican itineraries combining coast and jungle.
manuel antonio quepos costa rica.bonus: Book an early-morning guided walk in the park to enjoy cooler air, quieter trails and a better chance of spotting wildlife before the crowds arrive.

nafplio greece.desc: Set on the Argolic Gulf in the Peloponnese, Nafplio is a graceful seaside town where pastel mansions, palm-lined promenades, and fishing boats share the same postcard view. Wander the car-free Old Town, with its Venetian balconies, marble squares, and tiny boutiques spilling onto cobbled lanes, before following the seafront path towards hidden coves for a swim. Climb up to the hilltop Palamidi Fortress or take a short boat ride to Bourtzi Castle for sweeping sea-and-mountain panoramas. Nafplio suits unhurried romantics, history lovers, and families who like mixing culture with easy beach time.
nafplio greece.highlights: Car-free old town of Venetian houses, lively squares, and café-lined cobbled streets. | Scenic seafront promenade with easy swimming spots and relaxed tavern terraces. | Dramatic Palamidi Fortress with panoramic views over town, sea, and mountains. | Short boat trip to island Bourtzi Castle, magical at sunset.
nafplio greece.bonus: Time your visit for golden hour and watch Nafplio glow from the bastions of Palamidi, as the castles and harbor lights flicker on.

rovinj croatia.desc: Rovinj, on Croatia’s Istrian coast, curls around a rocky peninsula where pastel façades tumble down to the Adriatic and a bell tower crowns the skyline. Lose yourself in the old town’s tangle of cobbled lanes, art studios, wine bars and stone stairways that end right at the water. Just beyond, pine forests hide pebble beaches and clear coves, while boats shuttle you to nearby islands for lazy days by the sea. Rovinj feels made for slow evenings, fresh seafood and long, romantic sunsets over the terracotta rooftops.
rovinj croatia.highlights: Compact, walkable old town with Venetian charm and sea views at every turn. | Nearby beaches and coves, from lively Mulini Beach to quieter rocky swimming spots. | Boat trips through the Rovinj archipelago for island picnics and snorkelling. | Excellent seafood restaurants and wine bars showcasing Istrian flavours.
rovinj croatia.bonus: Climb the tower of St. Euphemia’s Church for a sweeping 360° view of the old town, islands and open Adriatic at sunset.

granada spain.desc: Cradled between the Sierra Nevada mountains and the plains of Andalusia, Granada is a vibrant city where Moorish palaces, whitewashed lanes and lively tapas bars coexist. Above the rooftops rises the Alhambra, a UNESCO‑listed palace‑fortress whose gardens, courtyards and intricate arches seem to float between sky and city. Down in the Albaicín and Sacromonte quarters you wander steep cobbled streets, catch flamenco in cave venues and stumble upon viewpoints framing the Alhambra against snowy peaks. Granada is ideal if you love mixing culture, night‑time atmosphere and day trips to the mountains or nearby villages.
granada spain.highlights: Iconic Alhambra palace‑fortress with exquisite Islamic architecture and lush Generalife gardens. | Characterful Albaicín quarter of narrow lanes, miradores and traditional houses. | Flamenco shows in the caves of Sacromonte, with views over the illuminated Alhambra. | Excellent tapas culture where many bars still serve small plates with your drink.
granada spain.bonus: Plan one sunset at Mirador de San Nicolás, where the Alhambra turns gold and the Sierra Nevada blushes pink behind it.

kanazawa japan.desc: On Japan’s west coast, Kanazawa blends samurai history, delicate gardens and contemporary creativity in a compact, walkable city. At its heart is Kenrokuen, one of Japan’s most celebrated landscape gardens, where lanterns, ponds and seasonal blossoms frame views of Kanazawa Castle next door. In the Nagamachi samurai district and the geisha teahouse quarters of Higashi Chaya you wander past earthen walls, wooden machiya townhouses and lantern‑lit alleys that feel frozen in time. Fresh seafood at Omicho Market and hands‑on gold leaf workshops round out a stay that suits travellers seeking culture, craft and a calmer alternative to Kyoto.
kanazawa japan.highlights: Kenrokuen Garden, famed for its ponds, stone lanterns and seasonal scenery in all four seasons. | Kanazawa Castle Park with broad lawns, restored gates and impressive timber architecture. | Historic districts Nagamachi and Higashi Chaya showcasing samurai residences and teahouses. | Omicho Market’s stalls of local crab, sushi and produce, plus gold leaf crafts to try.
kanazawa japan.bonus: Join an evening stroll through Higashi Chaya, when paper lanterns glow, shamisen music drifts from teahouses and the wooden streets feel almost deserted.

orlando usa.desc: In the heart of Central Florida, Orlando is a playground of theme parks, lakes and palm‑lined neighborhoods where sunshine is part of the daily routine. Here you can spend your days riding coasters at Walt Disney World, Universal Orlando or the brand‑new Epic Universe, then slow things down with a stroll around Lake Eola, a boat tour in nearby Winter Park or a kayak on a clear natural spring. Beyond the parks, food halls, rooftop bars and shopping districts keep evenings busy. Orlando suits families, friend groups and theme‑park fans who also like to mix in a little nature and city life.
orlando usa.highlights: World‑class theme parks including Walt Disney World, Universal Orlando and SeaWorld. | New Epic Universe park adding cutting‑edge lands like Super Nintendo World and Celestial Park. | Easy access to lakes, gardens and natural springs for kayaking, airboat rides or gentle walks. | Lively dining, shopping and entertainment areas such as Disney Springs, ICON Park and CityWalk.
orlando usa.bonus: Swap one day of rides for a paddle on a clear spring or a Lake Eola sunset and discover a calmer side of Orlando.

billund denmark.desc: Billund, in the soft green countryside of Jutland, is the playful hometown of LEGO and a surprisingly easy base for a family getaway. Within a few minutes you can move from the original LEGOLAND® park to the hands-on LEGO® House in the compact town centre, or to water worlds like Lalandia when the weather turns. Short walking distances, a nearby international airport and relaxed Scandinavian vibes mean less stress for parents and more time for kids to run, build and explore together.
billund denmark.highlights: Original LEGOLAND® with themed rides, mini cities and gentle coasters. | Immersive LEGO® House packed with creative zones for all ages. | Billund Airport only minutes away, ideal for short family breaks. | Compact, walkable town; attractions, airport and hotels only minutes apart. | Indoor waterparks and forest adventure parks for any weather days.
billund denmark.bonus: Stay an extra night to explore quieter forest playgrounds and bike paths around Billund, where kids can burn energy while you enjoy calm Danish scenery.

san diego usa.desc: San Diego, on California’s sunny Pacific coast, blends golden beaches with a laid-back city vibe. Spend the morning exploring the museums, gardens and world‑famous zoo of Balboa Park, then head to beaches like La Jolla or Pacific Beach for surfing, tide pools and fiery sunsets. The mild climate makes it easy to enjoy coastal walks, harbour cruises and rooftop bars almost year‑round, whether you’re travelling with kids, friends or a partner who dreams of waking up by the ocean.
san diego usa.highlights: Wide sandy beaches ideal for swimming, surfing and sunset strolls. | Balboa Park with museums, lush gardens and the San Diego Zoo. | Distinct coastal neighborhoods, each with its own food and nightlife. | Pleasant weather most of the year encourages outdoor living. | Whale-watching cruises and harbor tours for a different view of the city.
san diego usa.bonus: Catch sunset at Sunset Cliffs or along La Jolla’s shore, where crashing waves and glowing skies create a cinematic finish to your day.

sun city south africa.desc: Sun City, in South Africa’s North West province, feels like a self-contained holiday world tucked between bushveld hills and a shimmering man-made lake. You can float in the wave pool of the Valley of Waves, tee off on Gary Player–designed golf courses or try your luck at the casino before ending the night with live shows and restaurants. With nearby Pilanesberg National Park offering Big Five game drives, it’s an easy place to combine resort comforts with a first taste of African safari.
sun city south africa.highlights: Legendary Valley of Waves waterpark with sandy beach and big wave pool. | Wide choice of hotels, from family resorts to the opulent Palace. | Two renowned golf courses framed by rugged bushveld scenery. | Casino, concerts and restaurants for lively evenings without leaving the resort. | Short drive to Pilanesberg National Park for Big Five safaris.
sun city south africa.bonus: Book an early-morning game drive from Sun City into Pilanesberg, when cooler air and golden light make animal sightings and photos especially memorable.

toronto canada.desc: Toronto, on the northern shore of Lake Ontario, combines a glittering skyline with an inviting, walkable waterfront. Ride the elevator up the CN Tower for big-sky views, wander through neighbourhoods filled with independent shops and global cuisine, then hop on a ferry to the Toronto Islands for car-free bike paths and quiet beaches. Each season feels different here, from patio evenings and lake swims in summer to colourful fall foliage and cosy bars when the city is dusted with snow.
toronto canada.highlights: Iconic CN Tower with panoramic views over the lake and skyline. | Diverse neighbourhoods like Kensington Market and the Entertainment District. | Waterfront promenades, parks and islands ideal for cycling and picnics. | Multicultural food scene with flavours from all over the world. | Distinct four seasons offering new reasons to visit year-round.
toronto canada.bonus: On a clear evening, sail back from the islands at dusk and watch Toronto’s towers slowly light up, reflecting like a second city on the dark lake.

osaka japan.desc: Osaka, on Japan’s Pacific coast, blends castle views, neon canals and some of the country’s most playful food culture. Start with Osaka Castle and its surrounding park, then dive into districts like Dotonbori and Shinsekai, where sizzling takoyaki, okonomiyaki and lantern-lit izakaya line the streets. Compared with Tokyo, the mood is looser and more talkative, and locals are quick to recommend a favourite noodle bar. It’s a great base if you love night life, street food and easy day trips around Kansai.
osaka japan.highlights: Osaka Castle and park for history, views and spring cherry blossoms. | Dotonbori’s canal-side neon, giant signs and endless snack stalls. | Retro Shinsekai area with cheap kushi-katsu and local colour. | Fast train links to Kyoto, Nara and Kobe for simple day trips. | Friendly, informal atmosphere ideal for first-time visitors to Japan.
osaka japan.bonus: Join an evening food walk through the side alleys of Dotonbori, where tiny counters and chatty chefs reveal a far more local Osaka than the main canal.

nassau bahamas.desc: Set on New Providence Island, Nassau welcomes you with pastel houses, Caribbean rhythms and water so clear you can see the seabed from the pier. You can split your days between powdery beaches like Cable Beach, snorkelling over coral gardens or slipping across the bridge to Paradise Island’s lively resorts. Colourful street markets, rum distilleries and colonial forts add a dash of history to all that sun and sea. Nassau suits you if you love warm evenings, easy island vibes and plenty of things to do.
nassau bahamas.highlights: Easy access to white-sand beaches and turquoise water right near the city | Short boat trips to cays for snorkelling, turtles and colourful coral reefs | Lively Paradise Island resorts with casinos, water parks and nightlife options | Historic forts and downtown streets with pastel-coloured Bahamian architecture | Warm tropical climate ideal for winter sun escapes and long beach days
nassau bahamas.bonus: Take a sunset cruise from Nassau Harbour: watching the sky turn pink over the Bahamian cays with a rum punch in hand feels unforgettable.

penang malaysia.desc: On the island of Penang, off Malaysia’s northwest coast, you’ll find George Town’s heritage shophouses, street art and food stalls perfuming every corner. Days slip by wandering between Chinese clan houses, mosques and temples, riding the funicular up Penang Hill or escaping to the beaches of Batu Ferringhi and the forest trails of Penang National Park. Evenings are all about hawker centres where you sample char kway teow, laksa and icy desserts shoulder to shoulder with locals. Penang suits you if you travel with your taste buds and love mixing city buzz with pockets of nature.
penang malaysia.highlights: UNESCO-listed George Town full of murals, shophouses and multicultural temples | Legendary street food and hawker centres open late into the night | Easy access to Batu Ferringhi beaches and coastal walks in Penang National Park | Cooler air and wide views from the top of Penang Hill | Great choice for curious travellers who value culture as much as the sea
penang malaysia.bonus: Join a guided evening food tour through George Town’s hawker stalls to taste hidden specialities and learn the stories behind Penang’s famous dishes.

crete greece.desc: Crete, the largest island in Greece, stretches from dramatic mountain ranges down to coves of clear, impossibly blue sea. One day you might be wandering the Venetian lanes of Chania or Rethymno, the next walking a gorge, driving through olive groves or swimming at pink-tinged Elafonissi and the lagoons of Balos. Inland villages still move at a slower rhythm, with tiny cafés and family-run tavernas. Crete is ideal if you like combining road trips, beaches and history instead of staying in a single resort.
crete greece.highlights: Huge variety of beaches, from pink sands at Elafonissi to quiet coves | Mountain landscapes, gorges and viewpoints for scenic drives and day hikes | Charming old towns like Chania and Rethymno with harbourside tavernas | Archaeological sites such as Knossos revealing the Minoan civilisation | Plenty of small hotels and villas for couples, families or groups of friends
crete greece.bonus: Plan one full day to reach Balos Lagoon by boat or 4x4 track: the layered shades of turquoise and the views from above are unforgettable.

tampa usa.desc: On Florida’s Gulf Coast, Tampa mixes waterfront living, theme-park thrills and a laid-back subtropical climate. You can stroll or cycle the Tampa Riverwalk, linking museums, parks and the downtown skyline, then head out to nearby beaches like Clearwater or St. Pete for white sand and warm, shallow water. Historic Ybor City adds cigar factories, Latin flavours and nightspots to the mix, while Busch Gardens brings roller coasters and animals. Tampa works well if you want a base with plenty of family-friendly attractions and easy day trips along the coast.
tampa usa.highlights: Tampa Riverwalk connecting downtown, museums, parks and restaurants along the water | Short drives to Gulf Coast beaches such as Clearwater Beach and St. Pete | Busch Gardens Tampa Bay combining roller coasters with zoo-style animal areas | Historic Ybor City district with brick streets, nightlife and Cuban influence | Mild winters and long sunny days ideal for outdoor plans with children
tampa usa.bonus: Spend one evening on a dolphin-watching cruise from the bay: spotting playful fins against the skyline at sunset is a highlight for kids and adults alike.

arenal monteverde costa rica.desc: In northern Costa Rica, Arenal and Monteverde give you two very different sides of the rainforest in one trip. Around Arenal Volcano you hike over old lava fields, soak in natural hot springs and explore lowland jungle and waterfalls near La Fortuna. A scenic drive or boat-and-shuttle ride brings you up into Monteverde’s cool cloud forest, where hanging bridges, misty trails and zip-lines run through the canopy. Together they’re perfect if you want an active holiday surrounded by wildlife rather than beaches, with nights spent listening to the sounds of the forest.
arenal monteverde costa rica.highlights: Contrast between warm Arenal rainforest and cooler, mist-covered Monteverde cloud forest | Trails over lava fields with views of Arenal Volcano and Lake Arenal | Natural hot-spring resorts around La Fortuna for relaxing after activities | Canopy tours, hanging bridges and zip lines through Monteverde’s treetops | Excellent chance to spot birds, frogs and other wildlife with local guides
arenal monteverde costa rica.bonus: Book a guided night walk in either Arenal or Monteverde: once your eyes adjust, you’ll see tree frogs, insects and jungle life that stay hidden by day.

interlaken switzerland.desc: Interlaken, Switzerland sits between deep-blue Lake Thun and Lake Brienz, with the snowy peaks of the Jungfrau Region rising all around. From the quays you can watch boats glide across the water, then ride mountain railways and cable cars up to panoramic viewpoints and glacier trails. Days here can be as active as you like, from paragliding above the town to gentle walks along riverside paths and through chalet villages. It’s an easy base if you want outdoor thrills without giving up cafés, shops and relaxed evenings by the lake.
interlaken switzerland.highlights: Central base between Lake Thun and Lake Brienz for scenic cruises. | Fast access to Jungfraujoch, Grindelwald and Lauterbrunnen by train. | Wide choice of paragliding, skydiving, rafting and canyoning tours. | Plenty of easy trails and viewpoints for non-experts and families. | Compact town with Swiss cafés, chocolate shops and mountain-view terraces.
interlaken switzerland.bonus: Ride the funicular up to Harder Kulm near sunset to see both lakes and the high peaks glowing in soft evening colours.

monteverde costa rica.desc: Queenstown, New Zealand curves around the shores of Lake Wakatipu, backed by jagged peaks of the Southern Alps. Here you can launch yourself off historic bungy bridges, race along canyons in a jet boat or ride gondolas up to ridgelines before hiking back down. In winter nearby ski fields transform the mountains into a snow playground; in summer you swap skis for lake swims, bike rides and vineyard visits. The town itself is lively and compact, mixing laid-back bars, inventive restaurants and new luxury stays that make it easy to balance adventure with comfort.
monteverde costa rica.highlights: Spectacular setting on Lake Wakatipu with constant mountain and sunset views. | Iconic bungy jumping and jet-boating experiences in nearby canyons. | Access to multiple ski areas plus alpine hikes right above town. | Easy day trips to Glenorchy, Arrowtown and Central Otago wine country. | Walkable centre packed with cafés, bars, eateries and upscale lodges.
monteverde costa rica.bonus: Take an evening cruise on a vintage-style boat across Lake Wakatipu to a high-country farm for a relaxed dinner and starry ride back to town.

moab usa.desc: Moab, in the desert of southeastern Utah, is the small town that links some of the American West’s most dramatic red-rock landscapes. From here you can reach Arches and Canyonlands National Parks, where stone arches, fins and canyons glow orange at sunrise and sunset. Closer to town, the Colorado River carves a lush corridor for rafting, paddle trips and scenic drives. World-class mountain bike trails, 4x4 routes and quiet hikes mean you can choose between full-on adventure and slow exploration of the high desert.
moab usa.highlights: Easy base for visiting both Arches and Canyonlands National Parks. | Iconic red-rock scenery with arches, mesas, slot canyons and wide vistas. | Famous slickrock mountain bike routes and guided 4x4 backcountry tours. | Rafting, kayaking and scenic drives along the Colorado River corridor. | Skies dark enough for outstanding stargazing once the sun goes down.
moab usa.bonus: Set your alarm for a pre-dawn visit to a viewpoint like Mesa Arch and watch the rising sun turn the stone and distant canyons fiery red.

zell am see austria.desc: Zell am See, in the Austrian Alps, wraps around a clear lake at the foot of snow-tipped mountains and the nearby Kitzsteinhorn glacier. In winter you wake up to groomed slopes, cosy huts and the chance to ski or snowboard with views down to the water. When the snow retreats, hiking trails, bike paths and lakeside lidos take over, with stand-up paddleboards and boats cutting across the calm surface. The town itself blends traditional Austrian charm with modern wellness hotels, making it an easy choice if you like your mountain holiday to feel both active and relaxing.
zell am see austria.highlights: Lake-side resort with swimming beaches, promenades and mountain reflections. | Access to several ski areas, including glacier slopes with long seasons. | Well-marked hiking and biking routes for all levels above town and lake. | Family-friendly activities, from boat trips to easy nature trails and playgrounds. | Mix of alpine restaurants, cafés and spa hotels in a compact centre.
zell am see austria.bonus: On a clear day, combine a morning on Kitzsteinhorn’s high-altitude snow with an afternoon swim or paddle on Lake Zell for a true mountain-and-lake experience.

akureyri iceland.desc: Akureyri, in northern Iceland, sits at the end of the long Eyjafjörður fjord, where colourful houses, cafés and a small harbour face snow-dusted mountains. In summer, nearly endless daylight lets you wander botanical gardens, hike nearby valleys or join whale-watching boats searching for humpbacks out on the fjord. When winter arrives, ski runs on the hills above town and long, dark nights made for Northern Lights hunting take over. With its compact centre, geothermal pools and easy day trips to places like Goðafoss and Lake Mývatn, Akureyri feels more like a cosy base than a big city.
akureyri iceland.highlights: Harbour town location on Eyjafjörður with mountain and fjord views. | Excellent whale-watching tours with chances to see humpback whales and dolphins. | Nearby ski area and winter excursions focused on Northern Lights and snow. | Summer hiking, botanical gardens and relaxed café culture in town. | Convenient starting point for day trips around North Iceland’s waterfalls and lava fields.
akureyri iceland.bonus: Finish your day soaking in a geothermal pool overlooking the fjord, then step outside to look for the Northern Lights dancing above the mountains in winter.

siem reap cambodia.desc: Siem Reap, in north-western Cambodia, is your base for exploring the legendary temples of Angkor. Each day you can slip from a lively town of cafés, markets and spas into a landscape of jungle-wrapped towers, serene Buddha faces and ancient reservoirs glowing at sunrise. Between temple days, glide by boat through floating villages on Tonlé Sap or learn more about local history and crafts in small museums and workshops. It’s a great choice if you want culture, gentle adventure and warm Southeast Asian hospitality.
siem reap cambodia.highlights: Easy access to Angkor Wat and dozens of lesser-known jungle temples. | Atmospheric night markets with Khmer street food, silk, spices and souvenirs. | Day trips by boat to Tonlé Sap’s floating villages and stilt houses. | Range of simple guesthouses and stylish resorts with pools for relaxing.
siem reap cambodia.bonus: For a magical start to the day, ride a tuk-tuk to Angkor Wat before sunrise and watch the temple towers glow over the lotus pools.

guadalajara mexico.desc: Guadalajara, in western Mexico, mixes grand colonial plazas with a creative, modern energy. In the historic centre you wander between the twin-towered cathedral, elegant Teatro Degollado and shady squares where mariachi bands play as families stroll past. Beyond the old stone facades lie colourful markets, contemporary mural art and cafés serving rich Jalisco-style dishes. From here you can easily plan day trips to nearby tequila distilleries or artisan towns like Tlaquepaque. It’s a vibrant option if you want culture, music and Mexican life without the rush of the capital.
guadalajara mexico.highlights: Atmospheric historic centre with cathedral, plazas and neoclassical Teatro Degollado. | Live mariachi music in traditional plazas and local cantinas. | Huge covered markets for street food, leather goods and everyday shopping. | Easy excursions to tequila country and craft towns like Tlaquepaque.
guadalajara mexico.bonus: Join an evening walking route through the historic centre, ending with a tequila tasting in a traditional cantina while the mariachis play.

thessaloniki greece.desc: Thessaloniki, on the Thermaic Gulf in northern Greece, feels like a relaxed seaside city with a strong creative streak. You can stroll the Nea Paralia waterfront at sunset, watch locals gather by the White Tower and then dive into lanes full of cafés, bars and bakeries open late into the night. Byzantine churches, Ottoman hammams and colourful markets remind you of its layered history, while modern restaurants celebrate its status as a UNESCO City of Gastronomy. It’s ideal if you love food, sea views and an urban vibe that never feels too formal.
thessaloniki greece.highlights: Long seafront promenade with bike path, parks and sunset views over the gulf. | Historic White Tower and Byzantine churches listed as UNESCO sites. | Excellent food scene mixing Greek, Balkan and Middle Eastern flavours. | Lively cafè and bar culture, especially in Ladadika and Ano Poli districts.
thessaloniki greece.bonus: Climb to the old city walls in Ano Poli at golden hour for sweeping views of Thessaloniki’s rooftops and the sea framed by Mount Olympus.

glasgow uk.desc: Glasgow, Scotland’s largest city, combines grand Victorian streets with a bold contemporary art and music scene. You can spend the day wandering free museums like Kelvingrove and the Riverside, exploring riverside paths and leafy West End districts, then move on to buzzing bars and venues that showcase why it’s a UNESCO City of Music. Street art trails, design-led boutiques and colourful neighbourhood cafés add character at every corner. Choose Glasgow if you enjoy friendly locals, culture packed into walkable areas and city breaks with a creative edge.
glasgow uk.highlights: Outstanding free museums and galleries, including Kelvingrove and the Riverside Museum. | Renowned live music scene and festivals as a UNESCO City of Music. | Leafy West End with Botanic Gardens, independent shops and relaxed cafés. | Compact centre with historic buildings, street art and plenty of cosy pubs.
glasgow uk.bonus: Join a guided city walking tour that links murals, Mackintosh-inspired architecture and a pub stop, giving you insider stories you’d never find alone.

puerto escondido mexico.desc: Puerto Escondido, on Mexico’s Pacific coast in Oaxaca, is a laid-back beach town famous for powerful waves and golden sunsets. Along Playa Zicatela, the “Mexican Pipeline”, expert surfers ride heavy barrels while cafés and beach bars line the sand; a short ride away, smaller coves like Carrizalillo or Manzanillo offer calmer water for swimming and beginner lessons. Inland streets stay low-rise and relaxed, with taco stands, yoga studios and simple guesthouses shaded by palms. Come here if you dream of barefoot days, salty hair and nights listening to the ocean.
puerto escondido mexico.highlights: World-class surf at Playa Zicatela, with consistent, powerful beach-break waves. | Smaller bays like Carrizalillo ideal for swimming and beginner surf lessons. | Bohemian atmosphere with cafés, yoga spaces and relaxed beach bars. | Boat trips to spot dolphins, turtles or bioluminescence, depending on season.
puerto escondido mexico.bonus: Time your visit with a new-moon night and join a lagoon tour to see bioluminescent plankton glitter around you as you swim.

gili trawangan indonesia.desc: Gili Trawangan, Indonesia, is a tiny coral-fringed island off the coast of Lombok where you get around by bicycle or horse cart instead of cars. White-sand beaches and shallow turquoise water wrap almost the entire shoreline, with laid-back beach cafés on the east coast and quieter stretches to the north. Just off the beach you can snorkel above colourful coral gardens and often spot sea turtles cruising past, while dozens of dive centres take you to deeper reefs around the Gili islands. Evenings bring relaxed sunsets over Bali on the west side and a sociable, bohemian nightlife along the main strip, ideal if you want a mix of chilled island life and easy-going parties.
gili trawangan indonesia.highlights: Car-free island you explore by bike or horse cart along a scenic coastal path. | Snorkelling with sea turtles just offshore in clear, warm tropical water. | Many dive shops offering beginner courses and fun dives around nearby reefs. | Mix of lively beach bars and quieter corners for sunset cocktails or stargazing. | Easy island-hopping by boat to more tranquil Gili Meno and Gili Air.
gili trawangan indonesia.bonus: Watch the sun sink behind distant Bali from a swing in the shallows on the west coast, as lanterns and live music slowly light up the beach.

pag zr e beach croatia.desc: Zrće Beach on the island of Pag, Croatia, is a pebbly bay that turns into an open-air festival ground every summer night. By day you can swim in clear Adriatic water, lounge on sunbeds or try wakeboarding, inflatables and other water sports in front of the beach clubs. After sunset the strip lights up with world‑class sound systems, laser shows and international DJs playing until sunrise, giving it a reputation as one of Europe’s wildest party beaches. It’s perfect if you want a beach holiday built around music, dancing and long, hot nights with friends.
pag zr e beach croatia.highlights: Famous open-air clubs hosting international DJs and electronic music festivals all summer. | Long pebble beach with clear water, sunbeds and daytime beach parties. | Wide choice of water sports, from jet skis to wake park and floating fun parks. | Lively base in nearby Novalja with apartments, bars and late‑night food. | Party atmosphere similar to Ibiza, but in a compact, easy‑to‑navigate setting.
pag zr e beach croatia.bonus: Time your trip for a festival week, when pool parties, boat parties and after‑beach sessions blend into one long, unforgettable night on the Adriatic.

split croatia.desc: Split, Croatia, is a lively coastal city built inside and around the Roman Emperor Diocletian’s Palace, whose stone walls now hide cafés, boutiques and everyday life. Just a few minutes from the Old Town you can stroll the palm‑lined Riva promenade, watch ferries glide in and out and then head to city beaches like Bačvice, Kašjuni or the revamped Žnjan to cool off in the Adriatic. With Marjan Hill’s pine forests rising behind the harbour and islands such as Brač and Hvar just a boat ride away, Split is ideal if you want to mix history, sea swims, viewpoints and easy day trips in one base.
split croatia.highlights: UNESCO‑listed Diocletian’s Palace with narrow lanes, hidden courtyards and Roman remains. | Riva waterfront promenade for sunset strolls, coffee breaks and people‑watching. | City beaches including sandy Bačvice and pebbly Kašjuni and Žnjan close to the centre. | Marjan Hill viewpoints and forest paths for walks or sunset runs above the sea. | Ferries and tours to nearby islands and waterfalls for simple, car‑free day trips.
split croatia.bonus: Climb up to a Marjan Hill viewpoint in late afternoon, then finish the day with grilled fish and local wine back on the Riva as the harbour lights reflect on the water.

budva montenegro.desc: Budva, Montenegro, stretches along the Adriatic with a fortified Old Town on a rocky peninsula and a long sweep of beaches curving away on either side. Inside the stone walls you wander cobbled lanes, small churches and a citadel terrace with sea views, while just outside a seaside promenade links cafés, ice‑cream stands and boat piers. By day you can hop between family‑friendly bays and livelier beach clubs; by night Budva earns its nickname “the Miami of Montenegro” with bars, open‑air clubs and music along the waterfront. It’s a great choice if you want classic Mediterranean sun mixed with nightlife and easy boat trips to tiny Sveti Nikola island or glamorous Sveti Stefan.
budva montenegro.highlights: Atmospheric walled Old Town with Venetian‑style lanes, churches and citadel views. | Several beaches nearby, from Slovenska Plaža to Mogren and Jaz with clear water. | Seafront promenade lined with cafés, restaurants and casual bars. | Nightlife ranging from cocktail bars to big summer clubs by the sea. | Boat trips to Sveti Nikola island and viewpoints of Sveti Stefan peninsula.
budva montenegro.bonus: Walk the Old Town walls in the late afternoon, then take a short boat ride to Sveti Nikola for a swim at sunset with Budva’s lights twinkling on the horizon.

ayia napa cyprus.desc: Ayia Napa, on the southeast coast of Cyprus, is famous for its nightlife but just as memorable for its soft‑sand, turquoise bays and family‑friendly activities. You can spend lazy days between Nissi Beach, Makronissos or Konnos Bay, where shallow water and beach bars make swims and paddleboarding easy. Offshore, boat trips cruise to Cape Greco’s cliffs, the Blue Lagoon and Turtle Cove for snorkelling in clear water, while inland you’ll find WaterWorld waterpark and the Parko Paliatso funfair for extra thrills. After dark the focus shifts to Ayia Napa Square, where bars and clubs keep the music going late, making the town ideal if you like lively evenings but still want plenty to do in the daytime.
ayia napa cyprus.highlights: String of Blue Flag beaches like Nissi, Makronissos and Konnos with shallow, clear water. | Legendary nightlife around Ayia Napa Square with big clubs and bar streets. | Boat trips to Blue Lagoon, sea caves and Turtle Cove for swimming and snorkelling. | Family‑friendly attractions including WaterWorld waterpark and Parko Paliatso Luna Park. | Long sunny season, great for early‑summer or late‑season beach breaks.
ayia napa cyprus.bonus: Take a half‑day cruise that stops at the sea caves and Blue Lagoon, so you can jump from the boat into unreal blue water and still be back in town for a sunset drink.

sunny beach bulgaria.desc: Sunny Beach on Bulgaria’s Black Sea coast is a long ribbon of golden sand lined with lively promenades, hotels and beach bars. You spend your days swimming in the gentle shallows, trying jet skis or parasailing, taking the kids to water parks and hopping on boat trips along the coast. Evenings shift to sunset cocktails, neon-lit clubs and relaxed seafront restaurants serving grilled fish and Bulgarian favourites. With nearby Nessebar’s cobbled UNESCO-listed old town, it’s a playful base if you like combining lazy beach time, nightlife and easy day trips.
sunny beach bulgaria.highlights: Eight-kilometre sandy beach with shallow water, ideal for relaxed swimming. | Plenty of water sports, from jet skis to parasailing and banana boats. | Big water parks nearby to keep children and teenagers entertained for hours. | Legendary nightlife with beach clubs, cocktail bars and late-opening discos.
sunny beach bulgaria.bonus: For a memorable evening, book a dinner-and-show at Khan’s Tent above the resort, where panoramic sea views meet acrobats, live music and cabaret.

ios greece.desc: Ios, in the Cyclades between Santorini and Naxos, mixes whitewashed lanes, golden beaches and a famously lively nightlife. By day you can wander through the hilltop town of Chora, swim in the turquoise water at Mylopotas or hop on a boat to quieter bays with almost transparent water. As evening falls, tavernas, rooftop bars and clubs spill music into the narrow streets and along the beach. It’s a great choice if you like small-island freedom, lazy beach days and long, sociable nights with friends or as a couple.
ios greece.highlights: Golden beaches like Mylopotas with clear water and relaxed daytime beach bars. | Atmospheric Chora with white houses, viewpoints and countless tiny bars. | Boat trips to quieter coves and snorkelling spots around the island. | Legendary nightlife ranging from sunset cocktails to clubs open until dawn.
ios greece.bonus: Head to Pathos or another clifftop bar at sunset, where infinity pools, DJs and sea views turn golden hour into the start of your night.

tulum mexico.desc: Tulum on Mexico’s Caribbean coast blends white-sand beaches, jungle and Mayan history in a compact, easygoing town. You can spend mornings walking among the cliff-top ruins overlooking turquoise water, then cool off in nearby cenotes where sunlight filters into deep, freshwater pools. Along the beachfront a string of eco-chic hotels, yoga decks and beach clubs invite you to slow down, while downtown Tulum keeps things more local with taquerías and small bars. It’s ideal if you like combining culture, nature and laid-back beach days in one trip.
tulum mexico.highlights: Iconic Mayan ruins perched on cliffs directly above the Caribbean Sea. | Dozens of cenotes nearby for swimming, snorkeling and freshwater diving. | Boho, eco-chic beachfront hotels with yoga, spas and sunrise loungers. | Lively yet relaxed town with street food, mezcal bars and bike rentals.
tulum mexico.bonus: Visit the Jaguar National Park and Tulum ruins at sunrise, when cooler air, soft light and quieter trails make the jungle feel almost timeless.

belgrade serbia.desc: Belgrade, Serbia’s capital, sits where the Sava meets the Danube and blends centuries of history with a famously energetic nightlife. You can stroll through the pedestrian Knez Mihailova street to the Kalemegdan Fortress for big river views, then dive into museums, galleries and cafés scattered around the centre. In the evening, the bohemian quarter of Skadarlija fills with live music and grilled specialities, while floating clubs on the rivers keep the party going late. It’s a great city break if you enjoy culture, food and long, sociable nights without a huge budget.
belgrade serbia.highlights: Historic Kalemegdan Fortress with panoramic views over the Sava–Danube confluence. | Lively pedestrian centre along Knez Mihailova, full of shops and cafés. | Skadarlija’s cobbled streets with traditional taverns, live bands and hearty cuisine. | Iconic floating river clubs offering affordable drinks and dancing until late.
belgrade serbia.bonus: Stay for sunset at Kalemegdan or the Zemun riverside, when the fortress walls, church towers and river barges glow in soft evening light.

madrid spain.desc: Madrid, Spain’s capital, is a bright, walkable city where grand boulevards meet lively neighbourhood squares. You can move easily between art icons like the Prado and Reina Sofía, the Royal Palace and the historic plazas of Sol and Plaza Mayor, stopping for churros or tapas along the way. When you need greenery, Retiro Park offers rowing boats, shady lawns and the glass pavilion of the Crystal Palace. Whether you come as a couple, with friends or with family, Madrid rewards slow wandering, long lunches and evenings that stretch from rooftop sunsets to late-night bars.
madrid spain.highlights: World-class museums such as the Prado, Reina Sofía and Thyssen within easy reach. | Historic centre around Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor, perfect for strolling. | Retiro Park with lake boats, shady paths and the elegant Crystal Palace. | Tapas culture, rooftop terraces and flamenco shows for evenings full of flavour.
madrid spain.bonus: Catch sunset at the Temple of Debod, an Egyptian temple overlooking the skyline where locals gather with picnics, cameras and guitars.

austin usa.desc: Austin, Texas blends small-city ease with big-city energy. You wander from food trucks and craft breweries to live-music venues where bands play every night, then step outside to paddle along Lady Bird Lake or hike shady trails in the Barton Creek Greenbelt. Neighborhoods like South Congress mix vintage shops, colorful murals and skyline views, so you're never far from a good photo and great tacos. It's a smart pick if you want a city break that keeps you outdoors and on the move.
austin usa.highlights: Live-music venues every night, from intimate bars to iconic stages. | Easy outdoor escapes: Lady Bird Lake, Barton Springs Pool, city greenbelts. | Flavor-packed food trucks and barbecue joints across every neighborhood. | Creative districts like South Congress full of murals, indie shops and boutiques.
austin usa.bonus: Catch the sunset from the boardwalk at Lady Bird Lake while bats stream from Congress Avenue Bridge for a uniquely Austin moment.

koh phangan thailandia.desc: Koh Phangan, in the Gulf of Thailand, is an island where jungle-covered hills meet white-sand coves and turquoise water. By night you can dive into legendary parties on Haad Rin Beach or enjoy a cocktail at a quiet beach bar, and by day explore calmer bays, waterfalls and viewpoints along the coast. Yoga studios, massage salas and beach bungalows give the island a slow, barefoot rhythm. It’s a great choice if you want a tropical escape that mixes nightlife, nature and time to simply drift.
koh phangan thailandia.highlights: Soft beaches and clear, warm sea ideal for swimming and snorkeling. | Famous Full Moon Party at Haad Rin plus smaller jungle and beach events. | Quiet bays and viewpoints in the north for sunsets and starry nights. | Plenty of yoga, massage and beach bungalows for a laid-back island stay.
koh phangan thailandia.bonus: Take a longtail boat to hidden coves or to Ang Thong Marine Park for limestone islands, lagoons and some of the best views in the Gulf.

tbilisi georgia.desc: Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia, stretches along the Mtkvari River between steep hills and church-topped ridges. In the Old Town you wander past carved wooden balconies and brick domes of the sulfur baths in Abanotubani, then ride the cable car up to Narikala fortress for wide views over tiled roofs and glass towers. Cafés and wine bars pour aromatic Georgian wines and serve hearty dishes that keep you exploring long into the evening. It’s ideal if you enjoy atmospheric cities where European and Asian influences blend in a walkable center.
tbilisi georgia.highlights: Characterful Old Town lanes with balconies, churches and hidden courtyards. | Historic sulfur baths in Abanotubani for a steaming soak after sightseeing. | Cable car and hilltop viewpoints like Narikala with sweeping city panoramas. | Excellent food and wine culture, from cosy cafés to modern restaurants.
tbilisi georgia.bonus: Book a private sulfur-bath room at sunset, then step outside to see the Old Town glow in warm light beneath Narikala’s walls.

essaouira morocco.desc: Essaouira, on Morocco’s Atlantic coast, is a compact port city where sea spray hits old stone ramparts and white-and-blue houses. Within the UNESCO-listed medina you wander a simple grid of lanes lined with woodworkers, art galleries and spice-scented souks before emerging at the fishing harbour where boats unload the day’s catch. A long, breezy beach just outside the walls is popular for walks, kite- and windsurfing. With its mild climate, easy scale and relaxed pace, Essaouira suits travellers who want culture and ocean air without the chaos of a big city.
essaouira morocco.highlights: UNESCO-listed medina that is easy to navigate on foot without getting lost. | Historic sea walls and Atlantic views from the Skala with crashing waves. | Fresh seafood grilled right at the harbour alongside simple local stalls. | Long, windy beach ideal for long walks, kitesurfing and watching surfers.
essaouira morocco.bonus: Slip away to the ramparts at golden hour to watch the sun sink into the Atlantic while gulls circle above the silhouette of the old cannons.

da lat vietnam.desc: Da Lat, in Vietnam’s Central Highlands, sits around 1,500 metres above sea level and feels more like a mountain town than a tropical city. Pine forests, lakes and flower gardens surround low-rise streets where cafés serve locally grown coffee and strawberries instead of beach cocktails. You can spend your days walking around Xuan Huong Lake, riding the cable car to Truc Lam monastery or visiting nearby waterfalls such as Datanla or Elephant Falls. With its cool “eternal spring” climate and romantic scenery, Da Lat works especially well for couples and travellers who enjoy gentle outdoor adventures.
da lat vietnam.highlights: Mild, spring-like temperatures year-round, a welcome break from Vietnam’s heat. | Pine forests, lakes and viewpoints ideal for easy walks and photo stops. | Day trips to waterfalls like Datanla and Elephant Falls in lush valleys. | Strong coffee culture and fresh produce, from strawberries to flowers.
da lat vietnam.bonus: Wake up early to watch mist rise over Tuyen Lam Lake or the pine-covered hills, then warm up with a slow Vietnamese coffee in a local café.

wroc aw poland.desc: Set on the Oder River in western Poland, Wrocław combines colorful townhouses, Gothic churches and lively riverside promenades. In the Market Square you wander past the medieval Town Hall, buzzing cafés and the city’s famous bronze dwarfs hiding at street corners. Cross the bridges to Cathedral Island for lantern‑lit streets, brick towers and peaceful river views that feel almost storybook. It’s an inviting city break if you love walking everywhere, lingering over craft beer and discovering Central Europe at a relaxed pace.
wroc aw poland.highlights: Compact old town with colorful facades, historic churches and a lively central market square. | Dozens of bridges and river islands perfect for sunset walks and easy boat cruises. | Playful dwarf statues that turn sightseeing into a fun treasure hunt for all ages. | Cozy cafés, beer gardens and student bars that keep the atmosphere young and friendly. | Good rail links to other Polish cities for simple multi‑stop itineraries.
wroc aw poland.bonus: Climb the cathedral tower at dusk to watch warm light spill over Wrocław’s rooftops, bridges and river islands in every direction.

hamburg germany.desc: Hamburg, Germany’s great port city, spreads around the Elbe River with a mix of historic warehouses and bold contemporary architecture. You wander through the red‑brick canals of the Speicherstadt, then step into modern HafenCity where the glass waves of the Elbphilharmonie rise above the docks. Lakeside paths around the Alster, buzzing nightlife in St. Pauli and easy harbor cruises make it a city that feels both maritime and cosmopolitan. It’s a strong choice if you enjoy water views, culture and urban energy in equal measure.
hamburg germany.highlights: UNESCO‑listed Speicherstadt district with brick warehouses, canals and atmospheric evening lighting. | Striking Elbphilharmonie concert hall offering a public plaza with panoramic harbor views. | Relaxed walks or bike rides along the Alster lakes in the heart of the city. | Colorful nightlife, street art and live music in St. Pauli and the Reeperbahn area. | Regular boat tours that reveal Hamburg’s docks, container ships and constantly changing harbor skyline.
hamburg germany.bonus: Head up to the Elbphilharmonie Plaza at golden hour to watch ships glide past while the sun sets behind the cranes and church spires.

bogot colombia.desc: High in the Andes, Bogotá spreads across a plateau where colonial streets meet bold street art and modern glass towers. In La Candelaria you stroll between colorful facades, baroque churches and cafés serving rich Colombian coffee, while murals turn entire walls into open‑air galleries. A cable car ride up Monserrate reveals the city and surrounding mountains in one sweeping view, especially dramatic at sunset. Bogotá suits travelers who enjoy big‑city energy mixed with culture, gastronomy and a cooler mountain climate.
bogot colombia.highlights: Characterful La Candelaria district with cobbled lanes, colonial houses and lively plazas. | Vibrant street art scene, with guided walks that explain artists, messages and local history. | Panoramic lookout from Monserrate, easily reached by cable car or funicular railway. | Excellent museums such as the Gold Museum showcasing pre‑Columbian treasures. | Dynamic food and café scene, from traditional ajiaco soup to contemporary fusion cuisine.
bogot colombia.bonus: Join a Sunday Ciclovía, when major avenues close to cars and fill with cyclists, runners and families enjoying Bogotá like a giant open park.

amman jordan.desc: Built on a series of hills, Amman blends ancient ruins with busy modern neighborhoods and wide desert horizons. In the downtown area you wander from the Roman Theatre up towards the Citadel, where columns and temples overlook a sea of white stone houses. Cafés and restaurants along Rainbow Street introduce you to mezze, falafel and sweet kunafa, while markets hum with everyday Jordanian life. Amman suits travelers who enjoy history, food and a softer introduction to the Middle East before exploring Petra or the Dead Sea.
amman jordan.highlights: Impressive Roman Theatre and archaeological sites that bring the city’s long history to life. | Amman Citadel hill with sweeping views and remains from different civilizations. | Rainbow Street with cafés, rooftop terraces and casual spots to try local dishes. | Traditional souqs selling spices, sweets and textiles alongside everyday local shops. | Easy day trips to Jerash, the Dead Sea or desert castles with organized tours.
amman jordan.bonus: Time your visit to sunset at the Citadel, when the muezzins’ call and golden light over Amman’s hills create an unforgettable first taste of Jordan.

sofia bulgaria.desc: Backed by the slopes of Vitosha Mountain, Sofia feels both urban and surprisingly close to nature. In the center you move between the golden domes of Alexander Nevsky Cathedral, Roman ruins under glass walkways and spacious boulevards lined with cafés. Vitosha Boulevard offers shopping and people‑watching with views of the mountain, while mineral springs and parks create quiet pockets of green. Sofia works well for travelers seeking a European city break with layers of history, fair prices and easy access to hikes in the nearby hills.
sofia bulgaria.highlights: Iconic Alexander Nevsky Cathedral with glittering domes and richly decorated interior. | Compact historic center where Roman, Ottoman and socialist‑era landmarks sit side by side. | Vitosha Mountain close enough for half‑day hikes or cable car trips from the city. | Relaxed parks, mineral spring fountains and outdoor cafés ideal for slow afternoons. | Generally affordable restaurants and bars compared to many Western European capitals.
sofia bulgaria.bonus: Take a tram or taxi up towards Vitosha to watch sunset over Sofia, then return to enjoy dinner on a terrace along the lively Vitosha Boulevard.

bucharest romania.desc: Bucharest, Romania mixes wide boulevards, Belle Époque palaces and stark communist blocks in a way that feels chaotic but full of energy. In the Old Town you wander past tiny churches, hidden courtyards, street art and bars that spill onto cobbled lanes until late at night. Just a few tram stops away, leafy parks and lakes offer quiet corners, while the huge Palace of Parliament reminds you of the city’s dramatic recent history. If you enjoy affordable city breaks with character, Bucharest rewards curious travellers who love contrasts.
bucharest romania.highlights: Lively Old Town with cobbled streets, bars, cafés and small historic churches. | Monumental Palace of Parliament and grand boulevards telling recent Romanian history. | Large parks and lakes for walks, picnics and relaxed afternoons in the city. | Affordable restaurants, nightlife and accommodation compared with many Western capitals.
bucharest romania.bonus: Slip into Pasajul Victoria, a narrow passage of hanging umbrellas and cafés that feels like a secret photo spot between sightseeing stops.

gda sk poland.desc: Gdansk, on Poland’s Baltic coast, combines a beautifully rebuilt Old Town with the gritty charm of a working port. Colourful merchant houses line the Motława River, where ship masts, amber shops and café terraces create a relaxed maritime feel. History here is intense: museums tell stories from the Second World War to the Solidarity movement that helped change Europe. Add nearby sandy beaches and fresh sea air, and you get a city break that suits both history lovers and people who simply like strolling by the water.
gda sk poland.highlights: Carefully reconstructed Old Town with colourful facades, Neptune Fountain and grand merchant houses. | Waterfront promenades along the Motława River with cafés, boat trips and sunset views. | Excellent museums on World War II and the Solidarity movement’s fight for freedom. | Easy access to Baltic beaches and seaside towns like Sopot for a day by the sea.
gda sk poland.bonus: Climb the tower of St. Mary’s Basilica for a sweeping view over red rooftops, shipyards and the shimmer of the Baltic in the distance.

tirana albania.desc: Tirana, the capital of Albania, greets you with pastel apartment blocks, bold street art and a constant murmur of café life. Around Skanderbeg Square, museums and former communist buildings tell the country’s recent story, while a short walk leads you into the trendy Blloku district full of bars, brunch spots and boutiques. Take the cable car up Mount Dajti for fresh air and big views back over the city. Tirana suits travellers who like creative, evolving cities where everything important is within easy reach on foot.
tirana albania.highlights: Colourful facades and murals that give everyday streets a playful, Mediterranean vibe. | Central Skanderbeg Square with museums and historic communist‑era landmarks. | Lively Blloku neighbourhood packed with cafés, bars and small independent shops. | Cable car to Mount Dajti for cooler temperatures, hiking and panoramic city views.
tirana albania.bonus: Order a strong Albanian coffee in a Blloku café and watch locals drift between laptops, aperitifs and late‑night conversations.

skopje north macedonia.desc: Skopje, capital of North Macedonia, stretches along the Vardar River with mountains rising on the horizon and statues almost everywhere you look. The Stone Bridge links the modern main square to the Old Bazaar, where mosques, caravanserais and tiny workshops remind you of the city’s Ottoman past. On the other side you find wide boulevards, quirky new monuments and cafés buzzing late into the evening. Take the cable car or a hike up Mount Vodno for big views and a cooler breeze after a day in the city.
skopje north macedonia.highlights: Iconic Stone Bridge connecting Macedonia Square with the atmospheric Old Bazaar district. | Old Bazaar full of craft shops, mosques, tea houses and smoky grill restaurants. | Riverfront promenades and central cafés that come alive as evening temperatures drop. | Easy escape to Mount Vodno for forest walks, viewpoints and the Millennium Cross.
skopje north macedonia.bonus: Time your walk over the Stone Bridge for sunset, when the river, minarets and new city skyline all glow in the same golden light.

sarajevo bosnia and herzegovina.desc: Sarajevo, capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina, lies in a narrow valley where steep hills and minarets frame every view. In Baščaršija, the Ottoman‑era bazaar, cobbled alleys are packed with copper workshops, wooden cafés and the scent of grilled ćevapi. A few streets away Austro‑Hungarian facades, churches and museums tell another chapter of the city’s tangled history, from empire to siege. When the air feels heavy, you can ride the cable car or drive up into the surrounding mountains for cooler forests, viewpoints and simple mountain huts serving strong coffee.
sarajevo bosnia and herzegovina.highlights: Atmospheric Baščaršija bazaar with copper craftsmen, mosques and cosy wooden coffeehouses. | Fascinating mix of Ottoman, Austro‑Hungarian and Yugoslav architecture in a compact centre. | Powerful museums and memorials that explain the siege and recent history with sensitivity. | Easy escapes to nearby mountains like Trebević for walks, viewpoints and winter snow.
sarajevo bosnia and herzegovina.bonus: Follow a local’s lead: linger over a džezva of Bosnian coffee in Baščaršija, letting the city’s layered stories unfold in the background noise.

novi sad serbia.desc: Novi Sad, Serbia’s laid-back second city, stretches along the Danube with pastel facades, leafy squares and the dramatic Petrovaradin Fortress watching from the opposite bank. Wander between cafés, wine bars and galleries in the compact old town, then head down to the riverside for sandy beaches and sunset walks. Nearby Fruška Gora’s monasteries and vineyards offer an easy escape into rolling hills and forest. It’s a great base if you enjoy mixing relaxed urban life with nature, culture and a touch of festival energy in summer.
novi sad serbia.highlights: Panoramic Danube views from Petrovaradin Fortress and its hilltop ramparts. | Charming old town streets lined with cafés, patisseries and independent boutiques. | Easy day trips to Fruška Gora monasteries, vineyards and forest trails. | City beaches on the Danube for swimming, sunbathing and relaxed riverside walks.
novi sad serbia.bonus: For a special evening, time your visit to Petrovaradin Fortress for sunset and watch the Danube and city slowly light up beneath you.

fez morocco.desc: Fez in northern Morocco feels like a living museum, with its vast medieval medina, car-free alleys and the call to prayer echoing between the rooftops. You weave past stalls piled with spices and ceramics, watch leather being dyed in the famous tanneries and step into cool courtyards lined with zelliges and carved wood. Rooftop terraces reveal a sea of minarets and satellite dishes stretching to the surrounding hills. It’s an intense yet rewarding city if you love history, craftsmanship and getting pleasantly lost.
fez morocco.highlights: Atmospheric Fes el-Bali medina with maze-like streets and hidden squares. | Traditional tanneries where you can see leather being cured and dyed. | Historic madrasas, mosques and the ancient Qarawiyyin University complex. | Characterful riads and rooftop cafés for views over the old city at sunset.
fez morocco.bonus: Climb up to the Marinid Tombs hill in late afternoon for a wide panorama of the medina glowing golden as the sun goes down.

dalaman t rkiye.desc: Dalaman on Turkey’s Turquoise Coast is less a single resort and more a gateway to a string of beaches, coves and relaxed holiday towns. Base yourself here and you can split your days between Sarigerme’s long sandy shore, the protected Iztuzu “turtle beach” and calm bays like Sarsala surrounded by pine-covered hills. Boat trips along the Dalyan River reveal rock tombs, hot mud baths and riverfront villages, while inland you’ll find citrus groves and quiet countryside. It’s ideal if you want easy sunshine with plenty of day trips and activities on the water.
dalaman t rkiye.highlights: Access to Sarigerme, Iztuzu and other Turquoise Coast beaches with clear, swimmable water. | Dalyan River cruises past Lycian rock tombs, reed-lined channels and mud baths. | Variety of resorts, boutique hotels and chilled seaside restaurants to choose from. | Good base for boat trips, paragliding in nearby Ölüdeniz or jeep safaris in the hills.
dalaman t rkiye.bonus: Book a Dalyan River excursion that combines the mud baths with sunset on Iztuzu Beach, when the crowds thin and the sky turns deep orange over the sea.

vientiane laos.desc: Vientiane, the sleepy capital of Laos on the banks of the Mekong, feels more like an oversized riverside town than a hectic city. Golden stupas such as Pha That Luang, tree-lined boulevards and French-era villas give it a gentle charm, while temples like Wat Sisaket and Wat Si Muang invite quieter moments. As the heat eases, locals head to the riverside promenade for jogging, street food and the night market. It’s a soft introduction to Laos, ideal if you like slow travel, bicycles and days that end with a sunset over the river.
vientiane laos.highlights: Relaxed Mekong riverfront with evening food stalls, markets and wide sunsets. | Iconic Pha That Luang stupa and the Patuxai victory monument with viewing platform. | Historic temples and the COPE Visitor Centre explaining the country’s recent history. | Compact centre that’s easy to explore by bike or tuk-tuk without stress.
vientiane laos.bonus: Rent a bicycle in the late afternoon, ride out to the riverside and watch the sun sink behind Thailand as families gather in the park to exercise.

hue vietnam.desc: Hue, the former imperial capital of Vietnam, stretches along the Perfume River with a mix of moody weather, leafy streets and grand relics of the Nguyen dynasty. Inside the vast Citadel you wander through gates, palaces and lotus ponds that hint at royal ceremonies of the past, while outside town imperial tombs and pagodas dot the hillsides. Riverfront cafés, markets and simple eateries showcase Hue’s famously refined cuisine in a much calmer setting than Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh City. It’s a rewarding stop if you love history, slow walks and atmosphere rather than big-city buzz.
hue vietnam.highlights: UNESCO-listed Imperial City with moats, temples, gardens and palace ruins. | Scenic Perfume River with boat trips to pagodas, villages and royal tombs. | Distinctive regional cuisine with small, elegant dishes and street-food classics. | Easy cycling to countryside rice fields, bridges and quiet local neighborhoods.
hue vietnam.bonus: Take an evening boat ride on the Perfume River with traditional music on board and watch the city lights reflect softly on the water.

pai thailand.desc: Hidden in the green hills of northern Thailand, Pai is a small valley town where rice fields, waterfalls and misty mountains sit just beyond your guesthouse door. You wander between laid-back cafés, night markets and live-music bars, then hop on a scooter to reach hot springs, Pai Canyon or remote villages. The relaxed, bohemian vibe makes it easy to slow down, stay longer than planned and mix sunset viewpoints with yoga classes or easy hikes. It’s a great base if you want nature, freedom and a sociable backpacker scene without the chaos of big Thai cities.
pai thailand.highlights: Scenic mountain valley with rice fields, waterfalls and viewpoints close to town. | Easy scooter routes to hot springs, Pai Canyon and quiet countryside roads. | Relaxed cafés, markets and live-music bars ideal for slow, social evenings. | Plenty of yoga, trekking and outdoor activities for a gentle, active break. | Affordable guesthouses and bungalows that suit long stays on a backpacker budget.
pai thailand.bonus: Ride out before sunset to Pai Canyon, where narrow rust-red ridges and wide mountain views create one of northern Thailand’s most memorable golden hours.

battambang cambodia.desc: Battambang, on the banks of the Sangkae River in western Cambodia, combines sleepy provincial life with traces of French colonial grandeur and nearby Khmer temples. You can pedal along quiet streets lined with old shophouses, ride the famous Bamboo Train through rice fields or head out to hilltop pagodas with wide views over the countryside. At sunset, millions of bats stream out of caves near Phnom Sampeau, while in town small cafés and galleries showcase a growing creative scene. It’s a gentle, atmospheric stop if you enjoy culture, history and local life more than big‑city nightlife.
battambang cambodia.highlights: Riverside city with colonial shophouses and relaxed, low‑traffic streets to explore. | Iconic Bamboo Train ride across rice paddies and rural villages. | Nearby temples like Wat Banan and Phnom Sampeau with wide countryside views. | Spectacular bat exodus at dusk, an unforgettable natural show. | Friendly, low‑key cafés and art spaces that support local initiatives.
battambang cambodia.bonus: Time your visit to Phnom Sampeau for sunset to watch the bat clouds pouring from the caves while the sky turns orange over the rice fields.

la paz bolivia.desc: At more than 3,600 meters above sea level, La Paz, Bolivia tumbles down a steep valley, its brick houses clinging to the hillsides while snow‑capped peaks rise in the distance. You glide above it all in the Mi Teleférico cable cars, moving from busy markets and colonial streets to the high plateau of El Alto with sweeping views of the city bowl. Back on the ground, street art, traditional cholita culture and fragrant food stalls give every neighborhood a different personality. La Paz suits adventurous travellers who don’t mind the altitude and want a city break full of contrasts, from urban chaos to nearby Moon Valley hikes.
la paz bolivia.highlights: Dramatic high‑altitude setting in a deep valley surrounded by Andean peaks. | Mi Teleférico network offering easy, scenic transport and bird’s‑eye city views. | Colorful markets and the famous Witches’ Market full of Andean traditions. | Street art, local eateries and bars that show the city’s creative side. | Access to day trips like Valle de la Luna or Death Road for extra adventure.
la paz bolivia.bonus: Take the cable car up to El Alto just before sunset for a glowing panorama of La Paz and Illimani turning pink above the city.

arequipa peru.desc: Arequipa, in southern Peru, lies in a sunny valley beneath the volcano El Misti, its historic center built largely from white volcanic stone that gave it the nickname “White City.” You wander past elegant arcades on the Plaza de Armas, step into the colorful cloisters of the Santa Catalina Monastery and sample rich local dishes in traditional picanterías. Outside the city, viewpoints reveal a skyline of volcanoes and rural terraces, and many travellers use Arequipa as a comfortable base before exploring Colca Canyon. It’s ideal if you want colonial charm, good food and nature close at hand without sacrificing urban comforts.
arequipa peru.highlights: UNESCO‑listed historic center built from white sillar stone and full of arcades. | Beautiful Plaza de Armas and photogenic Santa Catalina Monastery to explore. | Renowned regional cuisine with dishes like rocoto relleno and chupe de camarones. | Pleasant, often sunny climate that invites slow walks and café stops. | Easy access to viewpoints and tours towards Colca Canyon and surrounding volcanoes.
arequipa peru.bonus: Climb up to one of the rooftop terraces at dusk: domes, cloisters and volcanoes glowing in pastel light give Arequipa a uniquely cinematic skyline.

oaxaca mexico.desc: Oaxaca de Juárez, in southern Mexico, is a colourful colonial city ringed by mountains and famous for its complex cuisine, mezcal and vibrant indigenous culture. You stroll past green‑stone churches and shady plazas, stopping at markets where smoky grilled meat, chocolate and freshly made tortillas scent the air. Museums and galleries tell the story of Zapotec and Mixtec civilizations, while nearby ruins like Monte Albán and villages known for weaving or pottery are easy day trips. Evenings are for rooftop bars, live music and lingering in the zócalo. Oaxaca is ideal if you love food, crafts and a creative city atmosphere more than beaches and resorts.
oaxaca mexico.highlights: Atmospheric historic center with green‑stone facades and pedestrian streets. | Exceptional gastronomy, from street stalls to innovative restaurants and mezcalerías. | Lively markets and talleres where you can meet artisans and buy textiles or pottery. | Easy access to Monte Albán, Hierve el Agua and traditional villages on day trips. | Strong cultural scene with frequent festivals, live music and contemporary art.
oaxaca mexico.bonus: Join a guided tasting in a small mezcalería: learning how different agaves are roasted, distilled and sipped adds depth to every drink you’ll have in Oaxaca.

granada nicaragua.desc: Granada, on the shores of Lake Nicaragua, blends pastel-coloured colonial streets, church bell towers and a relaxed Central American rhythm. Wander between shaded plazas, lively markets and rooftop terraces where you can watch the sun sink behind the Mombacho volcano. Out on the water, boat trips through the tiny isletas reveal herons, mangroves and lake breezes that cut the tropical heat. It’s an easygoing base if you love slow city strolls, warm evenings and small adventures on the lake.
granada nicaragua.highlights: Colourful colonial centre with churches, plazas and photo-worthy facades around every corner. | Lake Nicaragua on your doorstep for breezy boat trips among tiny islets. | Easy excursions to nearby Mombacho Volcano for cloud-forest trails and panoramic views. | Laid-back atmosphere with cafés, rooftops and bars ideal for long tropical evenings.
granada nicaragua.bonus: Climb the bell tower of Iglesia La Merced at golden hour for sweeping views over Granada’s tiled roofs, Lake Nicaragua and the smoky flank of Mombacho.

colombo sri lanka.desc: Sri Lanka’s bustling capital Colombo spills along the Indian Ocean, where glass towers sit beside faded colonial mansions and palm-lined promenades. You weave through tuk-tuk traffic to visit Gangaramaya Temple on Beira Lake, wander the lanes of Pettah market and pause for a curry or iced tea in a shady courtyard. By late afternoon, everyone drifts towards Galle Face Green to watch kites, street-food stalls and big waves under a tropical sky that can switch quickly from sun to sudden rain. For a first taste of the country’s energy, culture and flavours, Colombo makes an exciting short stay.
colombo sri lanka.highlights: Oceanfront setting with sunsets, sea breeze and lively evenings on Galle Face Green. | Mix of colonial landmarks and modern city life, all within easy tuk-tuk rides. | Colourful markets in Pettah for spices, textiles and an authentic local buzz. | Beautiful temples such as Gangaramaya and lakeside Seema Malaka for quieter moments.
colombo sri lanka.bonus: Time your evening drink at a historic seafront hotel near Galle Face to watch the sun drop straight into the Indian Ocean.

yogyakarta indonesia.desc: In Yogyakarta, cultural heart of Java, you swap big-city stress for palace courtyards, street art and the smell of sate grilling on every corner. Within the city you can wander through the Kraton and Taman Sari water palace, browse batik workshops and shop along busy Malioboro. Just outside, sunrise trips to Borobudur and evening visits to the lit-up Prambanan temples reveal why this area is UNESCO-listed. If you love mixing heritage, local food and easy day trips into the countryside or towards Mount Merapi, “Jogja” makes a rewarding base.
yogyakarta indonesia.highlights: Strong Javanese identity with the Kraton palace, Taman Sari and traditional neighbourhoods. | Easy access to Borobudur and Prambanan, two of Indonesia’s most iconic temple complexes. | Lively streets around Malioboro with night markets, music and endless street-food stalls. | Day trips towards Mount Merapi for village life, viewpoints and cooler evening air.
yogyakarta indonesia.bonus: Book a pre-dawn Borobudur visit: watching first light over misty rice fields and rising stupas is one of Java’s most memorable moments.

pokhara nepal.desc: Pokhara swaps big-city chaos for lake views and Himalayan peaks that seem almost close enough to touch. The city stretches along Phewa Lake, where colourful wooden boats drift beneath the reflection of Machapuchare and the Annapurna range. By day you can paddle across to the island temple, wander Lakeside cafés, or head up to the Peace Pagoda or Sarangkot for huge panoramas. In the evening the air cools, the mountains glow and Pokhara feels like the perfect place to rest before – or after – a trek.
pokhara nepal.highlights: Spectacular backdrop of the Annapurna range and Machapuchare rising above the lakeside. | Phewa Lake for easy boat trips, island temples and relaxed walks along the shore. | Viewpoints such as World Peace Pagoda and Sarangkot for sunrise and sunset over the Himalaya. | Adventure options from paragliding and zip-lines to multi-day Annapurna treks starting nearby.
pokhara nepal.bonus: Set your alarm for a Sarangkot sunrise: watching the first light hit the snowy Annapurna peaks while the valley slowly wakes up is unforgettable.

noosa australia.desc: Noosa, on Queensland’s Sunshine Coast, feels like a beach town that has learned the art of taking things slow. Between Main Beach, the boutiques and cafés of Hastings Street and the headland of Noosa National Park, you can move easily from morning surf to coastal walks and sunset drinks without ever needing a car. Gentle waves, warm water most of the year and plenty of shade make it friendly for families as well as first-time surfers. If you want laid-back Australia with good food, ocean views and a touch of wild nature, Noosa is hard to beat.
noosa australia.highlights: Protected Main Beach with usually gentle waves, ideal for swimming and beginner surfing. | Noosa National Park’s coastal track, fairy pools and hidden bays just a short walk away. | Lively Hastings Street for brunch, sunset cocktails and people-watching near the sand. | Access to the Noosa Everglades, lakes and hinterland for kayaking and quieter nature escapes.
noosa australia.bonus: Walk the coastal track towards the fairy pools, then stay for sunset at a clifftop lookout as the sky turns orange over the Coral Sea.

rovaniemi finland.desc: Rovaniemi, in Finnish Lapland, sits right on the Arctic Circle and wraps you in snow-covered forests, log cabins and crisp polar air. In winter you can chase the Northern Lights, ride in silence on reindeer or husky safaris and warm up in cosy saunas after a day of snowmobiling or snowshoeing. Summer brings the midnight sun, rivers ideal for gentle rafting and endless hiking trails across the fells. It’s a magical base if you dream of Santa, Arctic landscapes and unforgettable family memories.
rovaniemi finland.highlights: Chance to cross the Arctic Circle and visit Santa Claus Village. | Frequent Northern Lights sightings from late August to early spring nights. | Reindeer and husky safaris through silent, snow-draped forests. | Cosy cabins, glass igloos and authentic Finnish sauna experiences. | Midnight-sun hikes and river adventures during the bright Arctic summer.
rovaniemi finland.bonus: Book an evening aurora tour that combines a lakeside campfire, Lappish snacks and expert tips for photographing the Northern Lights.

marbella spain.desc: Marbella, on Spain’s Costa del Sol, blends long golden beaches with whitewashed streets, orange trees and a relaxed Andalusian rhythm. You can sunbathe by the Mediterranean, stroll the seafront promenade lined with chiringuitos and beach clubs, then dive into the Old Town’s cobbled lanes and lively tapas bars. Just behind the coast, the La Concha mountain offers hiking trails and sweeping views over the bay. It’s a great choice if you want sea, sun and a town that feels vibrant both by day and at night.
marbella spain.highlights: Wide choice of sandy beaches, from family-friendly coves to chic clubs. | Charming Old Town with white houses and Plaza de los Naranjos. | Seafront promenade ideal for evening walks, jogging or cycling. | Easy access to golf courses, marinas and nearby white villages. | Mild Mediterranean climate that invites you outside for most of the year.
marbella spain.bonus: Hike up a stretch of La Concha in the late afternoon and watch the sun set over Marbella and the glittering Costa del Sol.

porto cervo italy.desc: Porto Cervo, in Sardinia’s Costa Smeralda, is a glamorous harbour town where emerald coves, sculpted granite rocks and designer boutiques meet. By day you can sail to tiny bays with turquoise water, relax on white-sand beaches or explore coastal trails perfumed by Mediterranean scrub. In the evening the Piazzetta fills with yachts, terrace bars and fine dining overlooking the marina.
