With lots of sunshine, family-friendly resorts and sports facilities, La Manga works well for groups of friends, sporty couples or families who like to keep moving.
la manga spain.highlights: Unique setting between the Mediterranean and the calm Mar Menor lagoon. | Three established 18-hole golf courses at La Manga Club. | Wide choice of sports: tennis, padel, football pitches and more. | Many nearby beaches with generally warm, sunny weather. | Apartments and resorts suitable for families and larger groups.
la manga spain.bonus: Take a break from the course and drive up to a coastal viewpoint at sunset: watching the light reflect on Mar Menor and the open sea is quietly spectacular.

agadir morocco.desc: Agadir, on Morocco’s Atlantic coast, is a modern beach city where wide sands meet a relaxed seaside promenade. You spend your days between the long, sheltered bay, surfy spots up the coast and cafés shaded by palms, then wander through souks perfumed with spices and argan oil. A mild climate and long hours of sunshine make it a favourite winter escape, with the Atlas foothills and Paradise Valley close enough for easy day trips. It’s a great choice if you want seaside downtime with a taste of Moroccan life.
agadir morocco.highlights: Wide sandy Atlantic beach with a lively, palm-lined promenade. | Plenty of sunshine and mild winters ideal for off-season beach escapes. | Authentic souks and markets for spices, argan oil and local crafts. | Easy excursions to Paradise Valley, Atlas foothills and surf spots like Taghazout.
agadir morocco.bonus: Climb or drive up to Agadir Oufella at sunset for panoramic views of the bay, city lights and surrounding mountains.

hua hin thailand.desc: Hua Hin, on the Gulf of Thailand, blends the feel of a royal seaside retreat with that of a laid-back beach town. You stroll along a long, gently sloping beach, watch fishing boats bobbing offshore and choose between simple seafood shacks, night markets and stylish resorts with pools and spas. Just outside town you find temples on hilltops, national parks with limestone peaks and quiet beaches that still feel local. It’s a great option if you want the warmth of Thailand’s coast without the party scene of the more hectic islands.
hua hin thailand.highlights: Long, family-friendly beach with calm water and views of fishing boats. | Easy weekend escape from Bangkok with a relaxed small-town atmosphere. | Night markets, fresh seafood and cafés mixing Thai flavours with modern style. | Nearby hilltop temples and national parks with caves, viewpoints and nature trails.
hua hin thailand.bonus: Finish the day with a sunset drink on the beach, then wander Hua Hin’s night markets for street food, sweets and live music.

taupo wairakei new zealand.desc: Taupo and nearby Wairakei sit on a volcanic plateau in the heart of New Zealand’s North Island, where a deep blue lake meets steaming earth. Here you can cruise across Lake Taupo, soak in mineral-rich hot pools and walk boardwalks past bubbling mud, geysers and white silica terraces. Just a short drive away are Huka Falls, forest trails and bike paths that make the region feel like one giant outdoor playground. It’s an inspiring base if you love combining water, geothermal wonders and easy adventure in a compact area.
taupo wairakei new zealand.highlights: Spectacular setting on Lake Taupo with big-sky views and clear water. | Geothermal valleys with steam vents, bubbling mud pools and colour-streaked terraces. | Relaxing mineral hot pools and spa experiences in and around Wairakei. | Easy access to Huka Falls, forest walks, bike trails and lake cruises.
taupo wairakei new zealand.bonus: After dark, slip into an outdoor hot pool and watch the stars appear above the hills and drifting geothermal steam.

ayrshire turnberry scotland uk.desc: Turnberry, on Scotland’s Ayrshire coast, is a classic seaside retreat where wild cliffs and rolling links meet a grand country-house hotel. You wake to views of the Firth of Clyde, play championship golf with Ailsa Craig and the Isle of Arran on the horizon, then warm up in elegant lounges, a modern spa or restaurants that showcase Scottish produce. Beyond the resort you can wander along coastal paths, visit nearby castles and explore small harbour villages. It’s a memorable choice if you like dramatic seascapes, refined comfort and the idea of having everything from golf to afternoon tea in one place.
ayrshire turnberry scotland uk.highlights: Iconic links golf courses with sweeping sea views and challenging, wind-shaped holes. | Grand hotel atmosphere with fireplaces, afternoon tea and attentive Scottish hospitality. | Spa, pool and outdoor activities for non-golfers along the Ayrshire coastline. | Easy day trips to castles, fishing villages and other famous courses in the region.
ayrshire turnberry scotland uk.bonus: On a clear evening, walk the path towards the lighthouse to watch the sun sink behind Ailsa Craig and the darkening outline of Arran.
